loans.use: Additional Capital for her business a general store(sari-sari store)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more commodities for her shop.

loans.name: Firmine

texts.fr: H. Firmine est née en 1975 à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin. Firmine réside avec sa famille depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Missèbo à Cotonou capitale économique du Bénin. Firmine est mariée à TIDJANI Soulé, un chauffeur, et est mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. Firmine vient en aide à son mari Soulé dans les charges de la famille grâce au revenu de son activité. En effet,Firmine vend des sacs de sortie et des tissus au grand marché missèbo de Cotonou. Firmine achète ses produits à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Pour répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle pendant cette période de fête de fin d'année, Firmine sollicite un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Firmine H. was born in 1975 in Abomey, a historic town of Bénin. For about twenty years, Firmine has been living with her family in the neighborhood Missèbo in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Firmine is married to Soulé TIDJANI, a driver, and is the mother of three children all in school.

Thanks to the income from her activity, Firmine is able to help her husband with the family’s expenses. Indeed, Firmine sells purses and fabric at the large Missèbo market in Cotonou. Firmine buys her products from Lomé, the capital of Togo – a neighboring country of Bénin. To meet the high demand of her customers during the year-end holidays, Firmine is requesting a loan from ALIDé.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of purses and fabric.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu D. is from the village of Balide, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 30 years old. Marichu is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marichu owns & operates a business copy center, providing photocopy and encoding services in the local community. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Marichu joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Marichu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Marichu from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services

loans.name: Clara Naida

texts.es:
La socia CLARA NAIDA pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. El nombre del banco comunal es de origen del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “SONCCO” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”. ( please click here Quechua)

La socia tiene 48 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos varones, la socia esta sacando adelante a su familia haciendo estudiar a sus tres hijos en la universidad, ellos viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se dedica al negocio y piensa en aumentar su capital de negocio comprando más productos de belleza como aretes, collares, y perfumes para estas fiestas navideñas y venderlas aun precio cómodo. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Clara Naida is a member of the Communal Bank “Hatun Soncco”, which means “Big Heart” in the Quecha language. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of three sons. Clara lives in the imperial city of Cusco and strives to support her family and help with her children’s university expenses.

She divides her time between her household activities and her small business selling beauty products. Clara has been engaged in this line of work for many years and has done very well thanks to all of her hard work. She is a strong-willed, enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business. Clara wishes to increase her business capital so that she can buy more beauty products such as earrings, necklaces, and perfumes for the Christmas festivities. She plans to sell them at affordable prices.

Clara is grateful for the opportunity provided to her and promises to complete her payments on the respective due dates.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of beauty products for the Christmas season

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola is 39 years old, married with four children. She deals in building materials. Her husband is in a similar business. Bukola has been a member of Owonikoko group for two years now. She has been in this business for over 11 years and she says the business is moving well. She needs the loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. With this kind of business she hopes to increase her earnings in the long run and be able to provide better for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Asiyam's Group

texts.ru:
Айсаева Асиям – лидер группы. В данное время Асиям живёт в г. Карабалта, Кыргызстан. Ей тридцать четыре года. В это тяжёлое время, когда очень тяжело устроиться на работу и даже если устроился, зарплаты ни на что не хватает, одно из наиболее выгодных дел, которым может заняться простой житель – это выйти на рынок торговать. Но и для этого требуется иметь начальный капитал и предпринимательские качества. Главным же качеством, пожалуй, является стремление и готовность рисковать. Асиям не стала ждать перемен или помощи со стороны кого – либо, а просто решила начать своё дело. Положение обязывало Асиям не сидеть, сложа руки; мужу пришлось уехать в г. Алматы, Казахстан. Пять лет назад она обратилась в микрокредитную компанию за кредитом, закупила товар и начала торговать  одеждой на рынке. Ей было довольно легко подобрать одежду, которую бы народ покупал, и дело её пошло. Её муж до сих пор работает в г. Алматы. У Асиям трое детей: две дочери и сын. Дочерям двенадцать и десять лет соответственно, а младшему сыну всего три годика. Дочери учатся в школе и после уроков помогают маме смотреть за младшим братиком. Это изрядно облегчает положение Асиям. Асиям добилась значительных успехов в бизнесе, несмотря на упадок в торговле. Она купила кое – какую живность для домашнего хозяйства и улучшила уровень жизни своей семьи. Сейчас её месячный доход составляет около пятнадцати тысяч сомов ($350). А ведь она начинала дело всего с пяти тысяч сомов ($116). Асиям нужен кредит, чтобы закупить зимние вещи для зимнего сезона. Она также хочет накопить деньги и купить автомашину и бытовую технику для детей. 

У Асиям трое партнёров по группе:

Жылдызкан 34 года. У неё двое детей. Муж занимается бизнесом. Жылдызкан воспитывает детей и находится дома. Жылдызкан обратилась за кредитом, чтобы помочь мужу вложить кредитные средства в автомашины.

Тилеку двадцать пять лет. Он женат и у него одна дочь. Жена работает продавщицей в магазине. Дочь воспитывает бабушка. Тилек работает водителем и предоставляет услуги по перевозке пассажиров. Тилеку нужен кредит, чтобы купить зимние шины для машины. 

Нургуль тридцать три года. Муж находится в России на заработках. Сама Нургуль занимается розничной торговлей мужских джинсов. У Нургуль одна дочь.  Нургуль обратилась за кредитом, чтобы вложить деньги в закупку товара.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
A. Asiyam is the leader of this group. She lives in the city of Kara-balta in Kyrgyzstan. She's thirty-four years old. In these difficult times, when jobs are scarce and even if one is found, the pay is hardly satisfactory, one of the most profitable jobs available to the average person is to become a salesman on the market. But in order for this to transpire a capital and entrepreneurial skills are required. The most valuable skill is, probably, the ability to take risks. Asiyam didn't wait for any changes or for outside help, but decided to start her own business. She could not afford to sit helplessly; her husband had to leave for Almaty City. Five years ago she approached a company specializing in microcrediting; received a loan, bought goods and started to sell clothes on the market. She could easily pick out the clothes that people would later buy from her, and so her business was successful. Her husband still works in Almaty City. Asiyam has three children: two girls and a boy. Her daughters are twelve and ten and her son is just three years old. Her daughters go to school and help look after their younger brother when they come home, which is considerable help for Asiyam. Her business is very successful even considering the recent decline in trade. She has been able to buy some livestock for her household and raise her families’ quality of life. Right now her monthly income is about fifteen thousand soms ($350), whereas she had started her business with just five thousand soms ($116). Asiyam is asking for a loan in order to buy winter clothes for the winter season. She also wishes to save up some money and buy a car and some household appliances for the children. Asiyam has three partners in her group: Jyldyzkan is thirty-four years old and has two children. Her husband is a businessman. Jyldyzkan takes cares of her children at home. Jyldyzkan is asking for a loan to help her husband invest their capital in automobiles. Tilek is twenty-five years old. He's married and has one daughter. His wife works as a cashier in a store. His daughter is cared for by her grandmother. Tilek works as a taxi driver. He is requesting a loan in order to buy winter tires for his vehicle. Nurgul is thirty-three years old. Her husband works in Russia. Nurgul sells men’s jeans. She has one daughter. She is asking for a loan to buy new merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy winter clothes to sell in the winter season

loans.name: Na We Cam Group

texts.en:
Here are members of the "Na We Cam" Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are seeking a loan of SLL 2,000,000 (or SLL 500,000 each) to enable them to expand their businesses. With the help of this loan, they can add more goods to their businesses, make better sales, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Ramatu K. on the right is the leader of this group. 50-year-old (approximately) Mariatu is a widow with 8 children between the ages of 12 – 35. For 6 years now, Ramatu has been selling gara lappers (locally dyed cloth, sometimes with fabricated designs). With her share of this loan, she will buy two lengths of white cotton (30 yards make a length), inks, caustic soda, powder and will pay experts to make designs on the white cloth.

loans.use: Buy 2 lengths of white cotton, inks, caustic soda, powder, and pay designers

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khim P. is 44 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the third is a student in public school. Her husband, Mr. Bonith Lum, is a commune consultant who makes a small salary that helps support the family.

Khim and her family live in Svay Thum village, Takeo province, where she is her village’s bank president. Khim’s group consists of eleven members who plan to use the requested loan to purchase supplies, equipment and other items for different purposes. Khim herself is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field upon which she cultivates rice. She is also a silk weaver, and in order to sustain her weaving, she has decided to request a loan in order to buy more silk for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is an Ibo by tribe but she lives and works in Benin City, Edo state. She is married to a clergyman with children. Charity sells groceries, drinks and foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers.  She hopes to own a world-class supermarket in the future. Her business has been a major source of income for her family. She needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Jabir

texts.en:
Jabir A. is 24 years old, married with one son. He was born into a simple, rural family and has worked with livestock for ten years. He is very experienced and has special skills in livestock care that help him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock as well as meat and milk.

Jabir is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to enable him to purchase more cattle. This will enable him to increase milk production as well as meat he can sell. The income will enable Jabir to provide for his family, take good care of his cows, and supply his neighbors with quality products.

loans.use: purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Leopoldino

texts.es:
El Sr. Leopoldino es casado hace varios años tienen 4 hijos mayores todos ya están casado e independientes de ellos.
Juntos con su Sra. montaron un copetín en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizaron anteriormente como asalariados (Guardia de Seguridad).
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando han  educando a sus hijos y comprando todas las necesidades de su hogar.
El Sr. Leopoldino además del copetín trabaja como Guardia de seguridad.
El ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones en esta ocacion solicitó para la compra de mercaderías para la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Leopoldino has been married for several years, they have 4 grown up children who are married and are independent.

Along with his wife they set up a snack bar in their home that is located in a very populated neighborhood in the area. They began their business with a small investment that they got from other jobs that they had done before as wage workers (security guard).

Thanks to the work they are doing, they have been able to educate their children and to buy all the household essentials.

Mr. Leopoldino besides working in the snack bar works as a security guard.

He has shown to be a very responsible and honest person in his obligations.

He has already had other loans with us and has met his obligations excellently, this time he needs the loan to buy merchandize to sell in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various merchandize like sugar, rice, spaghetti, meats and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more vouchers for selling.

loans.name: Lucia Maria

texts.pt:
Lúcia Maria Julião 

Lúcia Maria Julião nasceu na Província de Cabo Delgado, Norte de Moçambique, tem 33 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 10 e 05 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez 12ą classe e formação de professores. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta 3 irmãos que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Cabo Delgado para Maputo com a sua irmã e cunhado a fim de continuar com os estudos. Actualmente é funcionária do Ministério da Educação como docente ha mais de 12 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 4.115.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta Bancária (Millenium Bim).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, aros para janelas, areia e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 13.000.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para continuar com melhoria da sua casa, para poder oferecer melhores condições de habitabilidade.
texts.en:
Lúcia Maria Julião was born in the Cabo Delgado province in the north of Mozambique. She is 33 years old, and is a single mother of two children of 10 and 5 years. They both go to school. She herself attended school through 12th grade. She lives in her own home with her children and she supports 3 brothers who also live with her.

She left Cabo Delgado for Maputo with her sister and brother-in-law after finishing school. Currently she has been employed in the Ministry of Education as a teacher for more than 12 years. She has never had any employees, and she makes a monthly salary of 4,115MT, which she uses for her household expenses and saves some to her bank account (Millenium Bim).

She has never taken a loan from any other bank. She came to know Hluvuku through her coworkers who are also clients of the institution. This is her second loan and is for the amount of 15,000MT. She plans to use this to buy construction materials (cement, window panes, sand, etc.) to continue the construction of her home. The previous loan was for 13,000MT and was used for the same purpose. She promises to make loan repayments dutifully so that she can access others. In the future she would like to take more loans for additional home improvements so that she can provide more habitable conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, window panes, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is indeed delighted with her business. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions and foodstuffs to boost her business. She has been in this business since 6 years. With these combined businesses, she hopes to support her husband in meeting the basic needs of their home. She needs the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell.

She is married to a welder and they are blessed with a child. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase hair extension to sell

loans.name: Taborsu Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Abdul K. who is pictured in the middle. Abdul is age 39. He was born in Makeni where he lives with his wife and three children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools except for the last who is not of school-going age. For 15 years now, Abdul has been selling honey, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), beans, onions, pepper, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. He will invest his share of this loan in his business and buy the above items wholesale. 

In the photo are members of the “Taborsu” Group. They are small scale businesspeople based in Makeni city, in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy honey, palm oil, beans, onions, pepper, Maggi, etc.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA III sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et  2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à DANGUELEDOUGOU un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz (par SOGONA K.), l’arachide et le haricot. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, SOGONA K. compte acheter, des intrants et des petits matériels pour entretenir  0.75 Hectare . 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75.000 FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé de la  famille.
Elle souhaite entretenir  sa collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’exploiter  une superficie culturale plus grande pour en tirer plus de gains et pouvoir couvrir tous les charges de leurs besoins.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group SABOUGNOUMA III are married women who, on average, are thirty years of age and have two children. For the most part, the women live in polygamous families in Dangueledougou, one of the villages in the town of Kadiolo, in the Sikasso prefecture (The 3rd administrative region of Mali). The women work with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully complete their agricultural activities during winter. This is their fourth time working with the institution, having well handled their past loans. The crops cultivated are: rice (by Sogona), peanuts, and beans. With her new loan, Sogona expects to buy the location and small tools needed to maintain .75 Hectares. The women's products are sold after the harvests at the village level at the markets in Kadiolo and Zegoua to male and female customers. After the planting, they expect to make an average profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be used to support the costs of their children's schooling and their families' healthcare. The group expects to maintain its partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to work a larger area of cultural land, from which to make greater profit and to be able cover all the costs of their needs.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and small agricultural materials.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob K. Kisoi is 49 years old and married with 4 children ages 9-19.  He hopes to provide them with a quality education. His business is located at Maasai market in Kisumu city along the Kisumu-Nairobi highway. He has been selling curios, necklaces, bangles, and carvings to tourists for 15 years. He says that this business is profitable and his major challenge is lack of adequate marketing. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more carvings to sell so he can grow his business.  He hopes to open a tours and travel company in the future. He describes himself as hardworking and self motivated.

loans.use: To buy more carvings for selling.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mr. Thorn C. (pictured with his wife) is 49 and his wife, Mrs. Sitha Say, is 42 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The son is in school and the daughter attends school and works. The family is living in a suburb of Phnom Penh City.  

Thorn is a motor taxi driver. He drives in Phnom Penh. His wife has been a garment factory worker for two years. Thorn is asking for his first loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his daughter to drive to work

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
In Angkonh village, Takeo province, lives a person named Mr. Ly S., who was born in 1977. He is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support his family; moreover, he is also a motorbike broker. 

His wife, Mrs. Bach Chea, is a seamstress in a garment factory, where she gets a low salary to support her family. Although they try to work hard, they can make only a little money. So to improve conditions for his family, Mr. Ly S. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. 

He is a father of two children, both of whom are too young to work or study. His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Cesarea

texts.es:
Cesarea es casada y tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 6 estudian, Cesarea tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de sus hijos.
Cesarea es socia del Banco Comunal Lila y durante este tiempo los prestamos le ayudaron en su negocio y con ello pudo educar a sus hijos, Cesarea solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Cesarea sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Cesarea is married and has 8 children, six of whom are still in school. She has a grocery store in her home where she stocks assorted groceries, vegetables and meat. She is open for business every day and sometimes gets help from her children. Cesarea is a member of the “Lila” (Lilac) communal bank and the loans have helped her business and that made it possible for her to educate her children. Cesarea is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. Her dream is that her children become professionals and to be able to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson K. M. is a married man with no children yet. His wife is a business lady. Jackson's business is located at Muthurwa, an open-air market in Nairobi. He sells clothes such as trousers and shorts. He has been in this business for ten years now and has managed to employ one person. He sells to passers-by and also has repeat customers. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people in the area doing the same kind of business as his and so customers are "spoilt  for choice". 

Weather, especially when it rains, also slows business making him not able to make as much profit as he would wish. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to increase his stock of clothes to meet the high demand by his customers. He hopes to diversify his business to property management some day. He also hopes to buy a plot of land. He describes himself as humble, honest and hardworking.

loans.use: Trousers and shorts

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie R. is from the village of Bonbon, Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Vergie owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling silver jewelry such as necklaces, bracelets, earrings and rings in the local community. Vergie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Vergie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Jhony Adalberto

texts.es:
Jhony es un padre de familia de 40 años que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector El Puente del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque. A más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que hace mas de diez años. El cuenta con un pequeño terreno agrícola en donde suele sembrar limón. Como es la fuente de ingresos más importante con la que cuenta el siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para obtener siempre buenas cosechas.

Precisamente para lograr este objetivo ha creído conveniente adquirir algunos abonos con los cuales desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Jhony es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar alguna carrera superior. En la imagen aparece junto a uno de ellos.
texts.en:
Jhony, age 40, lives with his wife and children in the El Puente sector of the Olmos district.  It is an agricultural area in the Lambayeque province, and it is two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been doing agricultural work for over ten years.  He has a small piece of land where he grows lemons.  As this is his most important source of income, he always tries to give the best of himself in order to always have good harvests.

That is exactly why he believes it is advisable to get some fertilizers to achieve this objective.  He will use the fertilizers for crop maintenance.  To do so he has seen the necessity of requesting a loan, for the first time, from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,500 soles.

Jhony is a very level-headed and responsible person.  His greatest desire is to be able to give his children the opportunity to study and have a better career.

He appears in the photo with one of his children.

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for his lemon crops

loans.name: Chang

texts.en: Chang K., 36, is married and resides with her husband in TaK. Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. K. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 1.5 each per day. K. has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 5 on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase hair dressing equipment to start a new business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy hair dressing equipment

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana; tiene 33 años de edad, y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de de tejidos de alpaca, la socia realiza tejidos como chompas, vestidos, y chalinas y luego los exportar hacia el país de Japon, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para el tejido como lana al por mayor.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “Mosoc Runa.”  The bank is located in Cusco District, which is part of Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

The member is Sra. Roxana.  She is 33 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business selling woven Alapaca products, for instance sweaters, dresses and scarves.  She then exports her products to Japan.  Through this business, she has been able to give her children a better future.  The member is hoping to expand her businiess.  She is requesting the loan in order to purchase weaving materials, like wholesale wool.

This member is thankful for the loan she has requested, and she promises to comply with the established time frame for repaying the loan.

loans.use: This member is requesting the loan in order to purchase weaving materials, like wholesale wool.

loans.name: Luis Alonzo

texts.es:
el señor Luis Alonzo A. Z. tiene 30 años de edad, esta casado. Luis es una persona humilde, trabajadora.
Luis se dedica al destazo de reses, hace como dos años emprendio este negocio en donde a adquirido buena experiencia, nos comento que este negocio le da buenas utilidades, sus ventas son los dias sabados y domingos, el resto de la semana se dedica a buscar vacas y a visitar los negocios que van a comprarle la carne y el hueso logrando de esta manera tener menos riesgo de no vender su carne.

 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de una vaca.
 
su mayor deseo es que su hijo que esta por llegar a la familia nazca bien de salud.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Alonzo A. Zunigo is 30 years old and married.  He is a humble, hard-working person.  He works as a butcher, a business he started two years ago and where he has been able to acquire good experience.  He gets a good income from his business.  He sells on Saturday and Sunday; the rest of the week he looks for cows and goes to the business that will buy his meat and bone, thus reducing the risk that he will be unable to sell his meat.

He will use the loan to buy a cow.

His greatest wish is that his child that is due soon is born in good health.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en:
Avetik A. is 54 years old and he lives in Ijevan city with his wife and his school aged son. 

In 2007, Avetik and his wife organized their own bakery which they have managed to the present time. At the same time Avetik runs a food shop, where he sells part of his bakery’s production. The remaining part of his bakery’s production is delivered to other food shops. 

Thanks to their hard work, Avetik and his wife were able to buy a car, which makes their work much easier. Now they can transport their bakery’s production and shop’s merchandise without excess expenses. 

Avetik asks for a 500.000 AMD loan to buy flour for his bakery and to increase his shop’s assortment. Avetik received a loan from Nor Horizon four times already without delays in payment.

loans.use: To buy flour for his bakery and to increase his shop’s assortment.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel S. is from the village of San Andres. He is 43 years old. Samuel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Samuel plants and harvests rice for sale. Samuel has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Samuel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samuel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Samuel is requesting a new loan of 32,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Samuel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es:
Alcira tiene 63 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo ya a su hijo en el distrito D. Chulucanas, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia D. Morropón y se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a más D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza D. ganado ovino y vacuno. El cuanta con un grupo considerable D. ovejas las cuales cría en corrales situados cerca a su domicilio. Cuando esta se han desarrollado completamente las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona y al público en gerenal. Adicionalmente cuenta con algunas vacas D. las cuales aprovecha la leche que producen para venderla a sus vecinos. Esta actividad le ayuda a sentirse activa y le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía familiar.

Alcira desea invertir en alimento balanceado para sus animales D. modo que estos se puedan desarrollar D. mejor modo y le brinden mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta trazada
texts.en:
Alcira is 63, married and lives with her husband and a son in the Chulucanas district, a farming area in Morropón province of the Piura region, about three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises cattle, sheep and cows.  She has a large herd of sheep that she keeps in a corral near her house.  When they are full-grown, she offers them up for sale to the merchants who come through the area, and to the general public.  She also has cows from which she gets milk that she then sells to her neighbors.  This business helps her feel active and allows her to help her husband with supporting the family.

Alcira wants to buy balanced food for her animals so that they can grow best for the highest income when they are sold.  To achieve this objective she decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 1000 new sols that will help her reach her planned goal.

loans.use: To buy balanced food for her animals.

loans.name: Jomelyn

texts.en:
Forty-one-year-old Jomelyn is married and has a beautiful daughter. They live in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. Jomelyn plants and harvests rice. Part of her harvest is used for family consumption and the rest is sold to the market. Jomelyn works hard for her daughters’ future.

Jomelyn is in need of additional seeds and fertilizer. She has applied for a loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from CEVI. She is hopeful that this loan will help improve her harvest.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: Doña Damasia A. C., es casada D. 36 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 4 estan estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía, confeccion D. delantales, lleva 8 años D. experiencia, inicio su negocio por iniciativa propia y deseos D. superacion, y cuenta con el apoyo D. sus esposo que se dedica al comercio, quiere ampliar su capital D. trabajo con el fin D. tener mas produccion D. delantales, por lo que reune a 10 compañeras con el fin D. organizar un grupo para solicitar un prestamo a ASDIR, cada una D. las integrantes se dedica a diversas actividades productivas como: Crianza D. animales, Bordado D. Blusas, Confección D. delantales, Venta D. Consumo Diario, Helados, Ropas Típicas, quieren invertir el prestamo para ampiar su capital en la actividad al que se dedica cada una, esperan ver su negocio y tener un local comercial propio.
texts.en:
Damasia A. C. is 36 years old and married.  She did not have the opportunity to go to school.  She has 5 children, 4 of whom attend school.

Damasia is in the handicraft business.  She makes aprons and has 8 years experience.  She started in the business on her own initiative and with a desire to improve herself.  She has the support of her husband who is a salesman.

Damasia would like to increase her working capital so that she can produce more aprons.  For this reaS., she gathered together 10 friends to form a group that could request a loan from ASDIR.  Each of the group's members carries out their own business activities such as raising animals, embroidering blouses, making aprons, selling essential food products, selling iced treats and selling traditional clothes.  They would all like to invest their loan money in increasing the working capital of their businesses.  They would like to see their businesses grow and own their own business premises.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina A. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Sabina is widowed and has seven adult children. To make a living Sabina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling used clothing and shoe products (ukay-ukay). She also buys and sells assorted products such as toys, combs, needles and threads. Sabina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010 Sabina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sabina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Sabina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of used clothing. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Sabina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothing.

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 31-year-old mother of three. She lives and works in Sderot. In June of 2010, Marilyn opened her business, which involves educational and entertainment activities with animals for young children. Marilyn has created a strong following of clients and works in two major nursery school systems in her city. She also provides birthday party activities. Marilyn decided to open a class with young children this year. In order to open the class, she needs additional equipment and small cosmetic renovation of her balcony.

Marilyn needs the loan to purchase equipment and additional animals for the activities as well as paints and renovation supplies for her enclosed balcony where she is holding the classes.

The weekly classes will provide a steady supplement to Marylyn's income as opposed to being dependent on school and birthday celebrations. Marilyn wants to see her business continue to expand and strengthen. Eventually she would like to hire two staff people and part-time activity coordinators to help her reach more clients.

loans.use: to purchase equipment, animals, paints and renovation supplies

loans.name: Bendicto

texts.en:
Bendicto is 62 years old and a father of eight children, two of whom are still schooling. He lives in his native town of Kisii, in South Rift, Kenya, and has been practising mixed farming for 30 years producing tea, bananas, maize and coffee.
Bendicto has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to fund his purchase and insurance of a dairy cow. He says the income will help him pay school fees for his remaining two children in school and will also subsidize their meals. He is focusing on having better quality dairy cows in the near future. Bendicto, like a good number of farmers in the area, has worries with animal diseases and challenging market prices.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Luzminia Maria

texts.es: La señora Luzminia es de un municipio de achuapa, su negocio es una abarrotería. Tiene más de 5 años con esta actividad, inicio con una mini pulpería pues ella no tenía mucho capital para invertir en su negocio y fue con la compra de ciertos productos que logro obtener lo que actualmente tiene hasta los momentos. Luzminia solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, aceite, sopas, golosinas, papel higiénico, jabón detergente. Ella deicidio poner esta actividad para así lograr solventar su ingresos que se generan en su hogar a un que su familia es pequeña quiere darle lo más necesario y así animar a sus hijos a seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Luzminia is from the town of Achuapa and runs a small convenience store.  She’s been doing this for five years, having started with a small store out of her home because she didn’t have very much working capital to invest.  By buying certain items, it allowed her to grow her business into what she has today.

Luzminia is asking for this loan in order to buy corn, beans, rice, cooking oil, soups, snacks, bathroom tissue, and detergent soap.  She decided to start this business so that she could solidify her income, be able to provide for her family, and motivate her children to stay in school.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Las Paceñas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS PACEÑAS” iniciará su primer ciclo  en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Tomasa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: taller de costura, venta de repuestos de minibús, tejido de chompa, venta de sal yodada, tejido de macrame, tienda de barrio, comidera, venta de golosinas, macrame de mantas.

La señora Tomasa,  indica que es el segundo ciclo en una asociación comunal en Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de los promotores que fueron a su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de golosinas que viene realizando hace siete años atrás; este negocio lo desarrollo poco a poco.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de golosinas (que servirá para incrementar su capital) los que adquiere de la Ceja (lugar comercial de la cuidad de El Alto), posteriormente lo venderá en la Escuela Republica de Japón, de lunes a viernes, todo el día. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y vive con sus dos hijos.
  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS PACEÑAS" is beginning its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, which belongs to the Cascada Social Center.  It is comprised of 11 members and led by a board of directors presided over by Mrs. Tomasa.  The businesses of the members vary and include: sewing, minivan repair parts sales, knitting of sweaters, iodized salt sales, macrame weaving, convenience store, diner, sweets sales and blanket macrame.

Mrs. Tomasa says this is her second cycle in Pro Mujer and she was invited to join by promoters in the area.

She plans to use the loan to buy sweets (to increase her capital) in Ceja (a commercial area in El Alto city).  She will sell them in the "Escuela Repubica de Japón" school from Monday through Friday, all day long.  This work allows her to generate an income to support her family as best she can.  She is single and lives with her two children.

When asked what she likes best about Pro Mujer, she says health is most important.

loans.use: To buy sweets

loans.name: Anna Muthoni

texts.en:
Ann Muthoni is 53 years old.  She is married to Joseph, who also contributes to the family income.  She has five independent children.  Ann has been running her boutique for a period of 12 years and earns an income of 22,700 Kenyan shillings a month. 

This is Ann's second loan cycle from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous one. She wants to use this loan to buy cosmetic products to sell in her boutique. She hopes to grow her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products to resell

loans.name: Macaria Elena

texts.es:
Doña Macaria Elena es casada, tiene 33 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian, se dedica a la artesanía específicamente a la confección D. pantalones para caballeros, lleva 10 años D. experiencia en este trabajo, inició siendo operaria. 

Solicita un préstamo en ASDIR para invertirlo como capital D. trabajo, específicamente para la compra D. telas e hilos que son materia prima muy necesaria para la produccion D. pantalones, que es una fuente D. ingresos muy importante para ella, en el futuro espera ver su negocio con varios trabajadores.
texts.en: Macaria Elena is married and she is 33 years old. She did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has 2 children who are in school. She is an artisan who, more specifically, makes gentlemen's slacks. She has 10 years' experience in the business. She started out as an operator. She requests a loan from ASDIR (Kiva Field Partner) to invest as working capital, especially to purchase fabrics and threads. They are the materials which are very necessary for the production of slacks. It is a very important source of income for her. In the future she hopes to see her business with several employees.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Inayat's Group

texts.en:
Inayata, 55, is the leader of this group. She resides in the southern town of Tashkomur, which has a small population. She often noticed a lack of good cafes and small restaurants for residents to go out and eat various meals at accessible prices. Inayat therefore decided to combine her cooking and management skills and open a small café. Quickly, thanks to a small advertisement, her café became one of the most visited. Her husband, a retiree, and her son help with the café management in their free time. A monthly revenue of 20,000 soms helps to make major repairs and build additional rooms. Inayat would like to also build a summer café. For this purpose, she is asking for a Kiva loan. Inayat’s wish for the future is the construction of a small shop by the café. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to build a summer cafe.

loans.name: Eté

texts.fr: Etê  est âgée de 38 ans et père de 02 enfants. Il vit en couple avec sa femme qui est couturière. Il est éleveur de poules et revend les œufs de ces derniers. Pour les besoins de sa ferme il s’approvisionne à Accra(GHANA). Il est dans sa 1ière année d’activité, et ce prêt va lui permettre d’acheter de nouvelles pondeuses et de stocker leurs nourritures.
texts.en: Etê is 38 years old and a father of two children. He lives with his wife who is a seamstress. He raises chickens and sells the eggs. He purchases supplies for his farm in Accra, Ghana.  He is in his first year of business and the loan will help him purchase quality hens and to stock up on chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther, es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar, tiene 29 años, es conviviente, con 2 hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropas para surtir su mercadería que lo compra en la ciudad de Lima.
Esther antes trabaja en una tienda de ahí aprendió el negocio, junto su capital y comenzó a trabajar independientemente, ahora tiene un puesto en le mercado 12 de abril y le va bien con sus ahorros incrementó su negocio. Ahora está ahorrando para la construcción de su casa. Su sueño es que su negocio siga prosperando, darle una buena educación a sus hijos y abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the communal bank Despertar. She is 29 years and lives with her partner and two children.

She sells clothing for women, men, and children. She will invest the loan that she is applying for in the purchase of clothing to stock her merchandise, which she buys in the city of Lima.

In the past, Esther worked in a shop and there she learned the business. She got her capital together and began to work independently. Now she has a stall in the 12th of April market, and it is going well. With her savings she has expanded her business. Now she is saving for the construction of her home. Her dream is that her business continues to prosper and that she can give a good education to her children and open a store.

loans.use: to buy various seasonal clothing

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima has operated a food stall business for five years, cooking beans and chipati (flat bread). Her primary business challenge is the high costs of transportation. Her major dream for the future is to establish a restaurant business.

With her Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

Halima is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and maize flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Geovanny

texts.en:
Geovanny is a married women with three children. She lives in the city of Hato Mayor, a rural area where agricultural activities are common.

Geovanny sells different products such as accessories (earrings, rings, necklaces, bracelets, etc) and underwear. She has been running this business for four years. She has taken out seven loans with Kiva field partner Esperanza International over the past year. The loans, which have been paid back in full, were used to expand her business. Thanks to these loans, she had been able to make various changes in her home structure and provide for her family.

Her most important challenge is to finish studying and her favorite thing to do is enjoy time with her children and be at her house. She thanks all of you for supporting her dream to change her life and give her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy womens accessories and underwear.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a married man who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

For  the past one year, he has operated a computer servicing business, operating in a shop where his potential customers are the neighboring community members. He faces the major challenge of theft because of the lack of security in his area of operation.  He dreams of expanding his business to improve his living standards.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase computer software and drivers for his servicing business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase computer software and drivers for his servicing business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking businessman. He is 28 years old, married, and blessed with one child. For the last three years, he has earned a living as a photographer. Previously, he was involved in farming. 

Joseph is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy a camera. In the next five years, he wants expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a camera

loans.name: Jenny Janide

texts.es:
La señora Jenny tiene 32 años D. edad, está casada con el Señor Rigoberto D. 39 años, el cual tiene una gomería. Ellos tienen dos hijos, Rodrigo D. 15 años D. edad, actualmente en la escuela cursando el noveno grado y Ana Paula D. 5 años D. edad, esta en pre escolar.
La señora Jenny tiene un copetín, empezó este negocio desD. muy joven, hace aproximadamente 13 años. Comenzaron trabajando para otras personas del mismo rubro hasta que decidieron independizarse y lanzarse en el negocio D. venta D. comidas y minutas por cuenta propia, con el correr D. los años fueron afianzándose y lograr posicionarse en el mercado. Con las ganancias del negocio siempre mantuvieron el hogar y lograron quitar adelante a su familia.
Como su copetín la ayuda mucho en la economía D. su casa, es por eso que desea seguir mejorandolo, justamente por ese motivo ella solicita el crédito para las mejoras del local, lo cual le ayudará mucho.
texts.en:
Señora Jenny is 32 years old and is married to Señor Rigoberto who is 39 years old and runs a tyre store. They have 2 children: Rodrigo who is 15 years old and is studying 9th graD. and Ana Paula who is 5 years old and in pre-school.

Señora Jenny has a snack place which she started at a young age about 13 years ago. They started by working for others in the same business until they decided to go it alone and set up their own business selling cooked food and fast food. With the passage of time they consolidated their business and positioned themselves in the market. With the profits they were able to maintain the home and move their family forwards.

As her snack place helps her a lot with the household expenses, she wants to continue improving it. For this very reason she is asking for a loan to improve her premises which will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve the premises.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña Maria Elena es una mujer de 44 años de edad madre de un niño, divorciada, una mujer muy trabajadora, esforzada, luchadora, una señora con caracter de emprendedurismo, hace 10 años maneja el negocio de la floristeria, empezó como empleada y ahora es la dueña del negocio, es su segundo  préstamo, se entero de la Fundación por medio de la tia.

La clienta tiene un negocio de floristeria a la par de su casa ella acondiciono un cuarto para su oficina de tarjetas decorativas,con este credito seria el segundo  con el primero crecio su mobiliario ya que compro varios equipo de trabajo

Por alrededor del negocio  no hay competencia, es un local frente a la calle es un buen punto de veta, ella se levanta temprano todos los dias y abre el negocio a las 8 de la mañana y cierra a las 7 de la noche las labores domesticas las hace en la mañana y  hijo le ayuda con el negocio

Con el credito piensa invertir en la compra de mas mercaderia y materia prima para reforzar su capital en flores y la deoración de tarjetas.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a 44-year-old woman.  She is the mother of one son and is divorced.  She is a very hardworking, determined and strong woman.  She has an entrepreneurial character and has run her flower shop for 10 years.  She started as an employee and is now the owner of the business.  This is her second loan.  She found out about the foundation through her aunt.

The borrower has a flower shop adjacent to her house.  She converted one room to serve as her office where she makes greeting cards.  With her first loan she bought furniture and equipment for her business.

There is no competition around where her business is located. It is a location facing the street, in a good position to make sales.  She wakes up early every morning, and she opens her store at 8 in the morning and closes at 7 in the evening.  She does her household chores in the morning, and her son helps her with her business.

With this loan she intends to invest in more merchandise and material to build her inventory of flowers and greeting cards.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as flowers and materials to make greeting cards and floral arrangements.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is a 35-year-old married man with three children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to have a better residential house and to add to his income. He has been in the farming business for the last 12 years and has managed to buy more land for tea planting. He is faced with the challenge of the dry season where he harvests less. His dream is to farm on 100 acres of land. Sunday needs the loan to buy more acres of land for tea planting.

loans.use: to buy land to plant tea

loans.name: Sinar Kasih Group

texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old married with three children. They are eighteen, fifteen and ten years old. The older one already finished high school and the other two still go to school. 

Maria has been selling daily needs like eggs, oil and flour since 1981. She has a little kiosk near her house and people find it easy to access her kiosk. Her business is going well. She can help her husband who works for a publishing company to fulfill their family needs. This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Indonesia, and now she wants to add more inventory to her kiosk.

She really likes running this business, because she can get extra money for her family and still can take care of her family. Her future plan for her children is have enough savings to send them to university. Also in the future she wants to open a bigger kiosk or even more, she would like to open a branch of her store.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her kiosk such as flour, eggs, and oil.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is requesting another Kiva loan of 10,000 KES to start up a new business distributing water. She also sells paraffin and operates a beauty salon to provide an income. Hellen will use her loan to purchase water pipes which will improve her living standard. Hellen dreams of expanding her beauty salon business.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes

loans.name: Rosendo

texts.es:
Rosendo de 18 años, es un joven empeñoso. Soltero y con planes claros para el futuro, vive en la casa de sus padres en la comunidad nativa San Pablo de Shaoriato. Desde que tenía 7 años ayudaba a sus padres en el campo, de esa manera aprendió sobre lo duro y gratificante que puede ser las jornadas.
A sus 18 años ya cuenta con 2 lotes de terrenos de 20 por 15 metros cada uno. En ellos siembra kion y naranjas. Frutos que traslada hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki para su venta al por mayor inmediata, pues cuenta con compradores fijos. Pero deja una menor producción para expenderla al por menor.
“El kilo de kión está a 1.50 soles y su cosecha es cada 7 u 8 meses, depende de los cuidados, abonamiento y limpieza”, explica. Los suelos fértiles de su comunidad son propicios para el crecimiento y desarrollo de grandes y jugosos kiones. Además los ríos de la zona son cuna de cardúmenes de peces. Rosendo caza y vende pescados como: “Chupadora” “Barbón” a los visitantes de su comunidad.  Este joven emprendedor prioriza su evolución como persona, ampliando sus sembríos y mejorando la producción. Posteriormente tendrá su familia, pero no está en sus planes cercanos. Sería la primera vez que Rosendo accedería a un crédito de MFP. Se siente contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal. Por esa razón, da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas y responsable con las actividades dentro del grupo. De obtener el préstamo, Rosendo invertirá en el pago de operarios que trabajarán sus terrenos, en el “porcado” (acumulación de la tierra alrededor de la planta), y  deshierbo (limpieza de sembríos).
texts.en:
Rosendo, 18, is a hard-working young man with clear plans for the future.  He is single, and lives in his parents home in his native village of San Pablo de Shariato.  Since he was 7 he helped his parents in the fields and thus learned how hard and gratifying daily work can be.

At 18 he has 2 fields of 20 and 15 meters each.  Here he plants kions (a ginger-like tuber) and oranges, fruits that he transports to Pichanaki to sell wholesale right away to regular buyers but he also keeps a small amount to sell retail.
He says,  "The kilo of kion is 1.50 sols and his harvest is every 7 or 8 months, depending on the care, fertilizing and weeding".  The fertile soil in his community is favorable to the growth and development of big and juicy kions.  Also the rivers in his area are thick with schools of fish.  Rosendo fishes and sells fish called: "Chupadora", and "Baron", to the people who come to his village.  This young entrepreneur prioritizes his development as a person, increasing his planting and improving his production.  In the future he will have a family but this is not in his plans at the moment.  This will be the first time that Rosendo requests a loan with MFP.  He feels happy to belong to the communal bank.  Thus, he promises to be punctual in making the payments and responsible in the activities of the group.  He will use the loan to pay the people who work his fields, in the “porcado” (forming dirt around the plants) and in weeding (cleaning the crops).

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine lives together with her husband. She is engaged in agriculture. Armine's husband is a butcher and also helps her with agriculture. Armine would like to expand her farm, but she doesn't have sufficient financial means. With the requested loan, Armine plans to purchase livestock and forage. This loan will help Armine to develop farming and increase her income. Additional income means higher living standards for Armine's family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for livestock and forage

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a resident of Muranga in Central Kenya where she dwells with her two children, ages 20 and 9 years, with the younger one still schooling. Lydia currently runs her farm with the help of one farmhand and produces coffee, tea and milk which she sells locally.

Lydia has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 63,600 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This is her first loan with Juhudi Kilimo and she believes dairy farming will be her source of income and act as her self-employment. She remains optimistic she will be able to improve her children's living standards. She is however, unhappy with unstable milk prices.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Maame Ama

texts.en:
Maame Ama is a petty trader. She sells dresses and underwear at the village of Akotokyire, and she has been in this business for the past 8 years. 

Maame‘s husband is a student, and they have 2 children. Because her husband is a student, she is responsible for feeding, clothing, and paying the school fees for their children. Maame will need this loan to purchase more dresses and underwear to sell. With the new profit, she plans to acquire a shop where she can sell her dresses.

loans.use: to purchase more dresses and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Felipa has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Felipa has been a member of HSPFI since 2005. In the future, Felipa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Jesukpego9 Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO9 est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Adjoï Patricia (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 55 ans. Adjoï Patricia est mariée à un certain René.  Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Adjoï Patricia et son mari. Pour cette raison, Adjoï Patricia vend de la nourriture à son domicile, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Adjoï Patricia s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Adjoï Patricia sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUKPEGO9, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de maïs, de riz, des condiments, de l'huile végétale et du charbon de bois.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Florence (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 36 ans.Florence  est marié à un certain Richard. Le couple a un enfant, qui scolarisé et à leur charge. Florence vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Florence et son mari. Pour cette raison, Florence vend de la farine de bouillie par la technique de distribution depuis vingt ans et des boissons en canettes de façon secondaire, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de son enfant et à son éducation. Florence s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Florence sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter de la farine de bouillie.

loans.name: Ruth Jacinta

texts.en:
Rutt Jacinta is from Merida, Yucatan. She has been dedicated for 40 years to the food sales business in her small store called “La Guadalupana”. She started her business by the request of her parents and also because she loves commerce. Now she hopes to transform this business with microcredit programs.

At the moment, she has two employees who help her in the store. Her small business is the only way she has to obtain income and, for this reason, she needs a credit by US$ 650 for her business to respond to the demand of her clients. Rutt needs to have a variety of products to be able to compete against other businesses similar to her own as well as to provide enough of her products in this season (December, which is an excellent month for sales).

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Rutt Jacinta que es originaria de Merida, Yucatán, se ha dedicado desde hace 40 años a la venta de comida en su Estanquillo “La Guadalupana”. Comenzo solo por petición de sus padres y el gusto al comercio y ahora lo ha hecho su forma de vida, Ruth espera poder desarrollar su negocio con apoyo de algún programa de Microcreditos. Actualmente cuenta con dos empleados que la apoyan, este estanquillo es el único ingreso con el que cuenta, es por eso que Rutt necesita un crédito por US$ 650 Dolares americanos ya que debido a la demanda de sus clientes necesita tener mas variedad de productos para poder competir , y mas en esta temporada (Diciembre) que es un excelente mes de venta.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sonnia

texts.en:
Sonnia se dedica a elaborar collares, pulseras, aretes en pedrería. Hace todo lo que el cliente le pida. Tiene 4 años haciendo esta actividad. Ella cuenta que una vez que la despidieron de su trabajo comenzó a caminar y se detuvo en un bazar y vio como hacían las pulseras, la dueña del bazar la invitó para que observara y se quedó en el bazar viendo. Su esposo le prestó $ 200, y comenzó su negocio de esta manera.

Ella sale a recorrer a los bazares, amistades y recomendadas. Siempre pide el 50% adelantado y el saldo contra entrega. Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar: piedras, canutillos, argollas y adornos, para poder elaborar mayor modelos.

Sonnia nació en Ancón. Tiene 44 años y tiene 3 hijos. Su esposo es ebanista y ha sido un apoyo fuerte en su hogar. Ellos son una familia muy humilde pero muy trabajadora. Ambos han tenido que trabajar desde muy joven para poder tener sus bienes. Actualmente tienen su casa que poco a poco la han mejorado. Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio y arreglar un espacio de su casa para poner su bazar donde pueda exhibir sus creaciones.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

Sonnia creates collars, bracelets and earrings using different stones and she has been doing this activity for 4 years. She says that once she was fired from her work, she started to walk around and stopped at a store where she saw how the owner was making bracelets. The owner invited Sonnia in and let her observe. Her husband lent her $200 and so she started her business.

She offers her products to stores, friends and people she’s been recommended to. She always asks for 50% in advance and the rest is paid after the product is delivered. She needs the loan to buy stones, rings and decorations so that she can create more and different models.

Sonnia was born in Ancón. She is 44 and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter and has been a great support for their home. Their family is humble but very hard working. Both Sonnia and her husband have had to work since they were very young so that they could have the goods they have now. Nowadays, they own a house that they have improved little by little. Their goal is to see their business grow and to make a space in their house so Sonnia can put up a shop where she can exhibit her creations.

loans.use: Para comprar: piedras, canutillos, argollas, adornos

loans.name: Caya

texts.en:
In December of 2000, Caya started her own grocery business. She is 42 and a married mother of a 24-year-old son and a 20-year-old daughter. Caya noticed that there were no stores in her neighborhood and thought it would be a good business opportunity. She therefore decided to open a grocery shop and she has done quite well. The business has been growing gradually and she has been able to help her husband cover the costs of the home and her children’s schooling.

Caya is now in need of a loan of $925 to acquire merchandise for a better selection in her shop and to purchase a larger refrigerator in order to better serve her customers. You can contribute the growth of this business as well as improve the life of this family. They sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

El diciembre del 2000, Caya inició su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y madre de un hijo de 24 años y una hija de 20. Caya se dio cuenta que por la colonia donde vive no había tiendas y pensó que era una buena oportunidad de negocio, así que se decidió a abrir un abarrote y le fue muy bien, poco a poco ha ido creciendo, de esta manera puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y la escuela de sus hijos.

Ahora Caya necesita de un crédito por $925 que empleará en al compra de mercancía para tener mejor surtido su negocio y comprar un enfriador más grande, para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayudar a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: A 36-year-old widow, Mai C., lives with her four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells Khmer noodles on the roadside of her village, and makes around $2/day in profit. Two of her children work at the nearby factory, and the rest of are students. Mai C. is currently requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more tools and some utensils for her business. She is so grateful for the big help of the loan, and hopes it will help to meet her clients’ needs and enable her to make additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase different tools and utensils for her business.

loans.name: Karanga

texts.en: Karanga S. is a meat and smoked cow skin salesman at the market of Port-Bouët, in the south of the Abidjan District. He is 30 years old and is married. Karanga has 2 children with his housewife Adjaratou. He has been doing this business since 1997. He joined AE&I microcredit program in February 2005. Karanga will use the loan  to purchase a cow, increase his business volume, and improve his margin. Karanga's 6-year-old daughter (the oldest) will start primary school in September 2007. This will increase the family's living expenses. Karanga wants to better develop his micro-business in order to meet the financial responsibilities of his house.

loans.use: Karanga Seni will use the loan to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married and has a grown daughter. She runs a small business selling women’s clothing at one of the city markets in Zaporoshye, Ukraine. Her clothing sales business exhibits good economic characteristics and fundamentals. Irina has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $3000. Her monthly net profit is about $600.
