Irina would like to get a loan of $1000 to increase her working capital so that she can continue working to improve her business. We believe her natural ability to please her customers by perceiving their needs and offering speedy, courteous service will help Irina achieve her goals, sustain her success and win as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: Irina would like to increase the working capital for her small women's clothing business.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
The good seasoning that Marisol uses daily for her family has become an aid in economic success that sustains she and her family. Thirteen years from when she first married, she saw the need to begin to contribute to the household income in order to support her family. Her mother-in-law, understanding this need, gave Marisol a position working at a chicken fighting ring, with the goal of holding a comfortable and agreeable job. Today, she has become one of the best anticucheras cooks in her region and would like to continue working in this field. Every night she prepares everything in order to start her sales and she washes her grill very well at the end of every day as well. Day after day she sees her business growing and she feels very satisfied, because she can support her two children comfortably without any great difficulties. Marisol has great dreams and one of those is the future opening of a touristic restaurant and is certain she would be very successful.

Today, she not only works selling anticuchos but also has a cow at her home from which she is able to give her family daily milk. She wishes to improve her business selling anticuchos and asks for this loan with the objective to obtain the sum requested in order to construct her dream little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

L. buena sazón D. Marisol siempre ha sido resaltante en su familia y esta cualidad hoy L. sostiene económicamente. Hace trece años desD. que se casó observó L. necesidad D. un sustento adicional para sostener satisfactoriamente a su familia y su suegra pendiente D. este hecho le cedió el puesto que tenía en un coliseo D. pelea D. gallos con el objetivo D. que se desempeñe en un oficio cómodo y agradable.Hoy se ha convertido en una D. las mejores anticucheras D. su zona y piensa seguir dedicándose a esta actividad. Cada noche prepara todos los implementos para iniciar su venta y lava muy bien su parrilL. al término D. su jornada. Día a día su negocio va prosperando y se siente satisfecha D. ello, porque pueD. otorgarle a sus dos hijos el sustento diario sin ninguna dificultad.Marisol tiene grandes anhelos y entre ellos está el D. aperturar a futuro un restaurante turístico que D. seguro será un éxito. Actualmente no sólo se dedica a L. venta D. anticuchos también en su casa tiene una vaca para que pueda brindarles diariamente leche a su familia. Desea mejorar su negocio D. venta D. anticuchos y apeL. a tu noble corazón con el objetivo D. obtener L. suma que solicita para construir poco a poco el sueño que tiene en mente.

loans.use: Implementation and purchase of new utensils in order to continue with her business selling anticuchos ( beef heart fried over a grill).

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Ever since she was very young, Elena has worked in various fields that have enabled her to sufficiently meet her children’s expenses, and thanks to her tireless, hard-working spirit, she is studying through higher education. She loans mototaxi rental services, and thanks to the monthly income, she has been able to invest a considerable sum of money in other businesses, including jewelry and handbag sales. Now her household expenses have increased due to the investment in her older children’s educations. Faced with this need, Elena wants to open a shop selling chicharrones, a food similar to pork rinds, and a liquor store, through which she will be able to earn more money and meet her household expenses. Sadly, she was also recently the victim of a robbery, and the thieves carried off a large amount of money, as well as furniture and other things. But in spite of this great loss, she did not lose her characteristic fortitude. You can help support her so that she can make these difficult times forgotten chapters of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Elena, desde muy joven ha trabajado en múltiples oficios que la han llevado a solventar los gastos de sus hijos satisfactoriamente y gracias a su incansable espíritu trabajador cursan estudios superiores.Presta servicios de alquiler de moto taxis y gracias al dinero que percibe mensualmente ha podido invertir una considerable suma de dinero en otros negocios, como la venta de joyas y de carteras.Ahora han aumentado sus gastos en su hogar debido a la inversión que realiza en la educación de sus hijos mayores y frente a esta necesidad Julia desea abrir una chicharronería y una licorería con el que podrá obtener mayores ganancias y solventar los gastos de su hogar.Desgraciadamente también acaba sufrir un robo en su domicilio y los maleantes se llevaron una gran cantidad de dinero entre los muebles y demás cosas, pese a esta gran pérdida no pierde la entereza que la caracteriza. Usted puede apoyarla para que pueda hacer de estos momentos difíciles capítulos olvidados.

loans.use: Opening a store to sell chicharrones.

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 44 years old. He has 4 children. Two of them are studying in university and the other two are studying in primary and secondary schools. He has an old, small shop for electric supplies and he has applied to get $1200 to purchase new electric supplies, renovate and paint the shop, and do some advertising to increase his income and develop himself.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new electric  supplies

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Born in the district of Vo, Madame Kossiwa M. is married and the mother of four children and responsible for three other people. Her job is based on the commerce of foodstuffs and other diverse items such as soap, canned food, pasta etc. To finance this project, she is asking for a loan to be able to stock her merchandise better and to purchase food from wholesale distributors, making the purchase economically advantageous. This will allow her to avoid frequent ruptures in her stock and to better satisfy her customer demand with the goal of increasing her revenues and her profits.

Translated from French to English by Kvia Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née dans la préfecture de Vo, Madame M. Kossiwa est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et a en charge trois (3) autres personnes. Son activité est basée sur le commerce de denrées alimentaires et de divers (savons, boîte de conserve, pâtes alimentaire etc.) A travers ce projet, elle sollicite un financement pour pouvoir augmenter son stock en marchandises et se ravitailler chez les grossistes ce qui l’avantage plus. Ceci lui permettra d’éviter les fréquentes ruptures de stock et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en vue d’accroître ses revenus et ses bénéfices.

loans.use: The stock and sale of merchandise.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma has a very important role in her house as a motivator who sees that work moves forward. She and her husband provide transportation services using a vehicle they purchased more than 2 years ago thanks to many years of shared effort. Today, she is delighted that they have turned this vehicle into a valuable source of income for their home. Throughout the day, she covers the route from Huancayo to Ancalá. While her husband drives, Irma actively supports him, often serving as fare collector and also preparing lunch for him. To continue and improve her business, she wants to repair her vehicle and continue with the development of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

Irma, tiene una función muy importante y protagónica en su casa es la que impulsa y alienta el trabajo para que todo salga adelante, ella y su esposo se dedican al transporte en un automóvil que compraron hace ya más de 2 años producto de muchos años de esfuerzo compartido que hoy les llena de satisfacción al haber convertido esta herramienta en un instrumento de trabajo muy valioso para la economía de su hogar y es así que durante todo el día se dedican a trabajar ofreciendo el servicio de transporte cubriendo la ruta de Huancayo hacia Ancalá,mientras que su esposo es el conductor de la unidad de transporte, Irma apoya activamente siendo muchas veces el cobrador y también preparando el almuerzo diario para su esposo.Para continuar y mejorar su labor desea reparar su herramienta de trabajo a fin de continuar con el desarrollo de su familia.

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Sihaba

texts.en:
Sihaba is 30 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 14 ,9, and 2 years old. Sihaba owns a general store, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Edina M., who is married and has two children aged 5 and 12. She also has two other dependents living with her because they are attending school in the area. In 2000, Edina established her fish and soft drinks business. Assisted by her husband and two employees, working six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day, she earns about $80 per month. Edina now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of fish and soft drinks in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $87. In the future, Edina plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish and soft drinks in bulk.

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.en:
Vitalyi is married and earns income running a small business where he sells seeds, flowers, plants and fertilizers in the local market of Vasilyevka. Vitalyi is a skillful manager who knows how to survive in an aggressive market environment. He has been in this business for over 4 years, and his current income is about US$2,000. 

Vitalyi’s consistency, perseverance in work and commitment to his business have ensured the growth and success of his small venture. He always treats people with respect which is one of the most effective methods of providing his business with customers which Vitalyi has a unique ability to reach and maintain. Moreover, Vitalyi is always willing to help his clients with business tips which oftentimes is something much needed. He is very hard-working and finds time not only to do his business, but also to take care of his beautiful garden which is his hobby. At the moment, Vitalyi is requesting a loan of US$875 to increase the stock of goods for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Ñanemba´ete Ete Group

texts.es:
The Ñanemba'eteete Committee (“Our Own Committee”, in the Guaraní language) is a fairly new committee within the Paraguay Foundation and consists of 16 members who are involved in diverse activities. Some of the women sell fruit, fruit salad, or general foodstuffs; some sell clothing; others have their own kiosks or “despensas” (typical Paraguayan mini-markets—often located in the owners’ homes). Still others sell medicinal herbs to drink in preparations such as tea, maté, and tereré, which is iced maté --a popular Paraguayan beverage.

All of the members are worthy women, dedicated to their families and to their children’s progress. One of these women, Dolly A., owns a small kiosk which she started six months ago with the help of her husband. Among other things, she sells snacks, juices, carbonated beverages and fast food. She joined the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs of the Paraguayan Foundation with the goal of obtaining credit and the training necessary to expand her small business.

This will be the first time that these women have taken out a loan, and they are very excited and eager to work. The loan they are asking for will be invested in the purchase of merchandise such as fruit, meat, flour, dairy products, vegetables, snacks, juices, carbonated beverages, clothes, recyclable cartons and plastic containers, and ingredients for meal preparation.

Translated by Melissa Hays, Kiva volunteer.

Este comité Ñanemba'eteete (Lo nuestro o propio en el idioma Guaraní) es un comité bastante nuevo dentro de la Fundación Paraguaya cuenta con 16 integrantes que se dedican a actividades diversas como venta de comidas, despensas, kioscos, venta de frutas y ensalada de frutas, otras venden ropas, o hierbas medicinales para tomar con infusiones como té, mate o tereré.

Todas las integrantes son mujeres de gran valor, que dedican sus vidas a sus familias y a lograr el progreso de sus hijos. De entre estas señoras tenemos a Dolly A. que posee un pequeño kiosco que inicio hace seis meses con la ayuda de su marido. Ella vende golosinas, jugos, gaseosas, comidas rápidas entre otros en su negocio, ella ingreso al programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya con el fin de lograr obtener los créditos y la capacitación necesaria para poder ampliar su pequeño negocio.

Este será el primer crédito que estas señoras retiren por lo que están muy emocionadas y con ganas de trabajar. El crédito que ellas solicitan lo invertirán en la compra de mercaderías como: frutas, carne, harina, lácteos, verduras, golosinas, jugos, gaseosas, ropas, cartones y plásticos para reciclaje, e ingredientes para preparar sus comidas.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise such as fruit, meat, flour, dairy products, vegetables, snacks, juices, carbonated beverages, clothes, recyclable cartons and plastic containers, and ingredients for meal preparation

loans.name: Bertha Cecilia

texts.es:
Ms. T. is 38 years old, is married with two children, one of which is in college and the other is in elementary school. She counts on the help of her husband who works as a private consultant and she also has a fixed income as a teacher. She is the owner of a shop located in her house, which helps them improve their living conditions. With the loans she has acquired, she has expanded her business; one of her biggest dreams is to strengthen her business everyday thereby moving her family ahead and to achieve a college education for her two children. 
 Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer. 

La señora T. tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, con dos hijos uno de ellos en la Universidad y el otro en primaria cuenta con la ayuda de sus esposo quien se desempeña como consultor privado y tambien ella tiene ingresos fijos como docente , pero a su vez es dueña de una tienda ubicada en su casa, con la cual ellos se ayudan para ir mejorando su condiciones de vida Con los creditos adquiridos ella ha hido ampliando su negocio y uno de sus mayores sueños es poder cada dia ir fortaleciendo su actividad para con ello lograr salir adelante con su familia y que sus dos hijos logren coronar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dora Erminda

texts.es:
La señora Dora Erminda Ibáñez S.  tiene cincuentaiun años y vive en la avenida Los Incas sin número del distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Tiene Primaria completa y como no pudo continuar estudios aprendió costura, mirando y ayudando en el oficio.
Actualmente tiene su pareja con quien se comprometió desde los treintainueve años, no tienen ningún hijo pero a su cargo están dos sobrinos.
Erminda siempre se dedico a la costura, pero su pareja le enseñó a hacer negocio de menestra, papa, chocho, etc.
Su primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos fue de 300soles hace ya ocho años, con el préstamo, empezó a trabajar en la compra venta de menestras y papa. Devolvió en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/ 800 soles, comprará papa seca, trigo, cebada y chocho que son productos de la estación.  Este préstamo será devuelto en cuatro cuotas.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal Progresistas y es una mujer muy activa, que no se puede quedar sentada debido a que le gusta mucho el trabajo.
Su actual sueño es viajar conocer otros lugares, otros países.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora Erminda Ibáñez S. is 51 years old and lives on Los Incas street in the Mache District of Otuzco Province, in the La Libertad Department of Peru. She completed primary school, and since she could not finished her studies she learned to be a seamstress by watching and helping others work. She has been in a relationship since she was 39, and though the couple does not have any children, she is raising two of her nephews.

Erminda has always worked as a seamstress, but her partner taught her the business of selling vegetable stew, potatoes, and corn. She took out her first loan of 300 soles (about US $100) from Manuela Ramos eight years ago and started to work buying and selling vegetable stews and potatoes. She repaid the loan in four months.

With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy dried potatoes, wheat, barley and corn, which are all in season right now. She will repay this loan in four installments.

She belongs to the Progresistas Communal Bank (a group loan) and is a very active woman. She likes her work so much that she can hardly sit still.

Her current dream is to travel so that she can get to know other places and other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy potatoes, wheat, barley, etc.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 10 años dedicada a la elaboración de velas negocio que aprendió de sus padres ya que ellos le enseñaron este conocimiento. ella tiene 3 pequeños hijos y es su deseo poder brindarles educación mejor calidad de vida. la elaboración de velas le deja ingresos mayores a los que tendría si trabaja en una empresa, además le permite estar siempre con sus hijos, con el auge que ha tenido su producto, ahora también renta las velas para eventos y después del evento recoge sus adornos y vuelve a reutilizables, así también recolecta los envases de cristal de las velas que se consumen en la iglesia del pueblo y ella los reutiliza para sus arreglos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar material y poder continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Beatriz has dedicated herself to making candles for 10 years, a business that she learned from her parents as they taught her this skill. She has 3 young kids and her desire is to be able to bring them a better quality education. Making candles gives her a better income than she would have if she was working in an office, and it also allows her to be with her kids. With the growth that her product has had she can now also rent out her candles for events, and after the event she collects her ornaments and reuses them. She also gets the glass candle holders that they use at the town's church and reuses them for her arrangements.

She needs a loan of $200, which she will repay over a period of 3 months, to buy material and to be able to continue with her business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work material/comprar material de trabajo

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
La señora Diana pertenece al Banco Comunal Pastaza ubicado en el Jr. Comandante Barrera Nº 558, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 22 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como mecánico de motos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motos. Tiene el apoyo de su esposo para la administración de su negocio. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 2 cientos de pernos, 40 rodajes, 2 docenas de cadenas, 2 docenas de anillos para motos, etc. 

Diana se siente contenta porque ha encontrado la felicidad al lado de su familia y con la ayuda de Manuela Ramos su negocio ha crecido.
texts.en:
Mrs. Diana belongs to the Communal bank Pastaza which is located in the Jr. Comandante Barrera # 558 street, in the Calleria district, province of Coronel Portillo, Uyacali department. She is 22 years old and has two children. She is married, and her husband works as a motorcycle mechanic. With the first loan of S./ 300 that she received from Manuela Ramos she invested in the food selling business. She has been working for a year with the communal bank. Currently she works selling repair/spare parts for motorcycles. She has the support of the husband in her business. With the new loan of S./ 1500, which she will repay in 5 moths, she will buy different spare parts, such as 40 gears, 24 chains, 24 rings for motorcycles, etc . Diana is happy because she has found happiness next to her family and her business has grown thanks to the help of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuỳ năm nay 45 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con tại thị trấn Gia Lộc tỉnh Hải Dương. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi và  kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá.  Nhờ có sự hỗ trợ giúp đỡ của chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành nên công việc kinh doanh của  gia đình chị đang phát triển rất thuận lợi và cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm hàng hoá phục vụ nhu cầu tiêu dùng   của bà con địa phương trong dịp Tết sắp tới.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Thuy is 45 years old and joined TYM fund in 2007. She lives with her husband and 2 children in the town of Gia Loc in the province of Hai Duong. Presently the main sources of income for her family are from raising animals, and operating a grocery store. With the assistance of her husband and children, who are grown, their business is profitable and brings in 183 USD average per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to purchase additional merchandise to meet the customers' needs for the upcoming Tet Holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Ipagala 1 Group

texts.en:
Mwamvita has owned a small food and flower store in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for the last three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of 90 USD. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food materials for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and improve her home. She is 28 years old, married, and has two children ages four and eight. She also cares for one additional dependent.

She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Siwema, Zainabu, Jane and Doroth. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her market

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
La señora Feliciana es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad de Sucano, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil es casada y tiene tres hijos, asimismo posee estudios de primaria incompleta (segundo de primaria).
Trabaja desde hace cuatro años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de engorde de ganado vacuno; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, que los destinó a la compra de forraje para engordar ganado y comercializarlo en las ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo y de Ilave.
Ella piensa alimentar mas ganado vacuno, asimismo requiere asistencia técnica para poder hacer un mejor engorde, con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles le servirá como capital para adquirir ganado y una parte en la alimentación de su ganado, finalmente la ganancias de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación de sus hijos y el sustento diario; se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en tres cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" Communal Bank in sector four of the Sucano community, located in the Pilcuyo district of El Collao province in the state of Puno. She is 58 years old, married with three children and has a 2nd grade education. She has worked for four years with the Manuela Ramos Movement and her business is raising cattle. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy feed for the cattle to fatten them to sell in the animal markets of Pilcuyo and Ilave. She wishes to feed her cattle but also requires technical assistance in order to fatten them more. This loan of 1,500 soles will serve as capital to acquire cattle and feed. The earnings from her business are invested in the education of her children and used to pay their daily expenses. She promises to repay the loan on time in three monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle and feed

loans.name: Roderick

texts.en:
PMPC was created to give programs and services to those who are in need of financial assistance and to provide training with regards to business. 

Mr. Roderick I. became a member of Paglaum on January 23, 2009. Roderick lacked financial capital for his sari-sari store. (The word sari-sari is Tagalog for "various kinds." Most sari-sari stores are privately owned shops that are operated inside the shopkeeper's home.) Roderick only had  enough money to build the sari-sari. His mother encouraged him to become a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Coop so he could borrow the money to buy assorted grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, assorted snacks, oils, spices, and many other items. He is requesting PHP 5,000.00 as start-up capital for his business. His wife will manage the store. 

Roderick has a job at the Municipal Nursery.  He is thankful that he has additional income for his family and that his wife will be having fun managing their business. In the future, Roderick hopes to expand his sari-sari to a mini grocery store and to have a house of their own for his family.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his store

loans.name: Nikolay

texts.en:
Nikolay is married with one son. He sells men's and women's shoes at the central market in Zaporozhye city. His profit is 3,000 UAH per month.

Nikolay has been in this business for 10 years. He started small and now has two business locations in very good places at the market. Nikolay sets affordable prices and provides very good client service. This brings many repeated clients to his business and helps him to make enough money for his family's needs.

Nikolay would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase a spring collection of shoes. He hopes to make additional profit and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a spring collection of shoes

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement, as he is popularly called, is 32 years old. He is married and blessed with twins who are breastfeeding. Clement M. is very hard working. He is a dealer in electrical goods like assorted lights, electrical cables, extension plugs, wires, electric lamps, speakers, transistors, screwdrivers, wires, television cords, antennas etc. He buys his supplies from importers at wholesale prices and sells to his customers at retail prices.

He requests this loan to enable him to procure increased stock of electrical and electronic parts. He hopes to increase savings to expand his shop to include refrigerators. He would be very grateful for your support. He has been in this business for the past seven years, gaining a lot of experience with a wider market share. He belongs to a village bank called ‘Won som’ which means 'let all help'.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of electrical appliances.

loans.name: Seliat

texts.en: Seliat is 60 years old and married with 5 children. She sells provisions and soft drinks. She is requesting a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Seliat says thanks to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sibu

texts.en:
Ni Nengah Sibu (DNR.M-0659) is a 50 years old and lives in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has one school-aged child. To making a living, Ni Nengah Sibu owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Nengah Sibu has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Nengah Sibu joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Nengah Sibu has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to expand shelter for her livestock. Ni Nengah Sibu is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This will be her 4th loan from DINARI. Ni Nengah Sibu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her child’s tuition fees.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Nengah Sibu - (DNR.M-0659) merupakan 50 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Nengah Sibu memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Nengah Sibu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Nengah Sibu menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Nengah Sibu bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Nengah Sibu meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk memperluas tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Nengah Sibu berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience O. is a small fishmonger in Elmina. Patience has received has no formal education. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a carpenter who lives on a small income.

Patience has been smoking fish since 1999 and supports her husband in paying the children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke and resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and further the children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and resell

loans.name: Perlyn

texts.en: Perlyn R. is from the village of Bay-bay, Balatacan, Tangub City. She is married and has three school-aged children. Perlyn owns and operates a business selling fish. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Perlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for the family's basic needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 40 years old and married to Rodel who is working in a funeral parlor and part-time as a tricycle operator. They have three children: Richard - 23 years old, college graduate; Rodelyn - 20 years old, H.R.M. graduate and their youngest daughter Rachelle - 18 years old, third year college student. Her family resides in Barangay Research Minante 1, Cauayan City. 
Myrna would like to borrow a loan of PHP15,000 for the improvement of the hog raising business that she has been managing for almost three years.  She believes that this amount will really help her maintain her business and increase her income.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Rani Ghulam Sarwar Group

texts.en:
Rani baji has been a citizen of a mid-sized city called Vehari, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband's name is G. S. and he runs a scrap business in the community where he sells old and rough items such as (wooden and iron cupboards and shoe racks, etc). He has 3 years of experience in this business. Rani baji is applying for a loan to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business.

This group loan consists of four additional people:

Sharfan baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart to load.

Suraiya baji and Razia baji each want a loan to buy scrap for their scrap businesses.

Alpha baji wants a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to sell. This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: Rani baji is seated in the middle of the baji’s.

loans.use: To buy scrap for their scrap business

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Luzmila es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Luzmila compra cereales que luego procesa en el molino de su hermano, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad. Además Luzmila tiene 2 carros que alquila.
Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo.
Los sueños de Luzmila son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the community bank Kusikuy, which means "rejoice" in Quechua. She lives with a partner, is 39 years old and has two children.

Luzmila buys grain that she processes in her brother's mill, and then sells in her city's markets. Luzmila also has two carts that she rents.

Luzmila needs a loan of 1350 PEN that she will invest in buying wheat. Her dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia T. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old, and is married with eight school-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alicia joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
T. Purevsuren is 52-year-old widowed businesswoman who lives with her child in Uvurkhangai province in central Mongolia. Her son attends secondary school.

Until 2000, Purevsuren worked as an assistant doctor until she decided to have her own business. She started selling cosmetics and medicine at the Arvaikheer central market. From that time, as result of her hard work and good customer service, her business has been steadily growing and expanding. She is requesting 2,000,000 tugrugs to purchase more supplies.

loans.use: to purchase more pharmacy supplies

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita C. has 1 hectare farm that she tills and hopes could provide her the food and income to pay the daily expenses in their home. She has laborers who help till the farm. She has been doing this business for nearly 40 years now.

She would like to request a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund then pay the laborers in her farm.

She said they have difficulty raising their children. But it wasn't really difficult because the farm help them provide their everyday needs.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase additional stocks of commodities for her business

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: H. Emilienne est née en 1984 à Abomey, dans le Département du Zou. Emilienne est mariée à AVAHOUN Borice, un chauffeur. Le couple a deux enfants et la famille vit à Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Emilienne et son mari assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. C'est les sous-vêtements et les chaussures que Emilienne vend de façon ambulante à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Pour mieux développer son activité, Emilienne sollicite un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Emilienne H. was born in 1984 in Abomey, in the county of Zou. Emilienne is married to Borice AVAHOUN, a driver. The couple has two children and the family lives in Agbodjèdo in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Emilienne and her husband provide together for the family’s expenses.

Emilienne sells underwear and shoes as a traveling saleswoman in Dantokpa, the large international market of Bénin. To better develop her business, Emilienne is requesting a loan from ALIDé.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and underwear.

loans.name: Betsaida Rosaly

texts.es:
la señora Betzaida Rosaly C. B. tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos. Hace 2 años se dejo con su esposo de nacionalidad mexicana, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y otros atuendos. Su casa de habitacion le fue heredada por su padre, el negocio esta ubicado en el interior del mercado municipal de Nacaome y se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 7 años, la cual le a ayudado a salir adelante con su familia,
su deseo es que su negocio sea una tienda y poder dar un buen estudio a sus hijos hasta convertirlos en profesionales, esta solicitando el credito para surtir de mercaderia su negocio y asi aprovechar la temporada navideña para tener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Betzaida Rosaly C. B. is 30 years old, is a single mother of 3 children. It has been two years since her husband, a Mexican national, left. She works selling clothes, shoes and other clothing. She inherited the home where she lives from her father. The business is located within the municipal market of Nacaome and she has worked in this activity for 7 years, which has helped her to get ahead for her family. She wants her business to be a shop and to be able to give her children a good opportunity to study to become professionals. She is asking for a loan to build inventory to have for the holiday season to make more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy children's and women's underwear, bras, skirts and blouses

loans.name: Omar Antonia

texts.en:
Omar, 28, has been working in this motorcycle repair shop since he was a child. The shop, called “Taller Miguel,” was started by his brother-in-law Miguel about 20 years ago, and now the two are partners.  Omar is requesting a loan to help buy motorcycle parts. He plans to buy all types of parts, including cables and batteries, but it depends on what his clients need. There are only three people who sell motorcycle parts in the area, and since Omar has a good supplier he can offer the parts at a very competitive price.

Omar is excited about the loan. It is his first with CEPRODEL. He hopes it will help him improve his shop and grow the business little by little. Omar lives with his partner and 5 year-old-daughter. He hopes to have more children some day.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Omar Antonia  from  Nicaragua

loans.use: To buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Rosa Cacilda

texts.pt:
Rosa Cacilda D. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, tem 52 anos de idade, separada e mãe de 5 filhos de 29, 27, 24, 21 e 10 anos de idade todos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ª classe, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta 6netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu da cidade da Matola para o bairro Patrice Lumumba para viver em 1975. Em 1996 separa se do seu marido e vai a Boane fixar sua nova residência, onde vive actualmente com seus filhos. Tem um negócio próprio no seu quintal onde trabalha das 7h as 22horas, dependendo do movimento de compras. Aprendeu esta actividade desde 1985 devido a varias dificuldades encaradas na sua vida quotidiana. Não possui empregados, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia e ferro) para ampliar a sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 13.600.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.
 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para concluir a sua obra para oferecer o melhor conforto a sua família.
texts.en:
Rosa Cacilda was born in the city of Matola, in the Maputo province. She is 52 years old, divorced and the mother of 5 children. Her children are 29, 27, 24, 21, and 10 years old and they are all in school. She went to school until the 5th grade and didn't continue because her parents could not afford her to. She lives in her own house with her children and six grandchildren.

In 1975, she left Matola to live in the Patrice Lumumba neighborhood. In 1996, she separated from her husband and settled in Boane where she currently lives with her children. She has her own business in her backyard. She works from 7am to 10pm, depending on the flow of customers. She started this activity in 1985 due to a number of hardships she has faced in her day to day life. She does not have any employees and has an income of around 5.000.00mt per month which goes toward household expenses and savings in Xitique, a traditional rotational savings system.

She has never had loans from other banks. She discovered Hluvuku through neighbors who are also members. This will be her fourth loan. She requests 15.000.00mt to buy building materials (cement, stones, sand and iron) to increase the size of her house. The previous loans were for 5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt and 13.600.00mt and were all used for the same activity.

In the future, she would like to request more loans to finish her construction and offer more comfort to her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials (cement, stones, sand and iron)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen de 45 años de edad es soltera, tiene una hija de 10 años de edad que esta estudiando en la escuela primaria.
Doña Carmen actualmente cuenta con su propio negocio de peluqueria que se encuentra ubicado hace más de 10 años en el mercado municipal de Caaguazú. Además se dedica a la venta de ropas y calzados de marcas. Le va muy bien ya que cuenta con una clienta formada gracias a la buena atencion que les ofrece a su clientela.
 Como sueño personal desea ampliar más su negocio para llegar a abrir un salón mas agradable y de primera calidad para que los clientes se sientan cómodos por el servicio que les ofrece.
La cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de un lavatorio de cabellos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen is 45 years old, single, and has a 10-year-old daughter who is in elementary school. Mrs. Carmen currently has her own hairdressing salon which has been located for more than 10 years in the municipal market of Caaguazu. In addition, she sells brand clothing and shoes. She does very well because she counts with a set clientele thanks to the attention she offers to her customers. Her personal dream is to expand her business to open a more pleasant, first class, salon so that her customers feel comfortable with the service she offers to them. The customer requests the loan to buy a hair washbasin.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a hair washbasin

loans.name: Lesbia Mayerly

texts.es: La señora Lesbia Mayerly P. C., de 30 años de edad, es casada y su esposo le apoya en el negocio, ellos tienen 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 4 años todos estudian, la señora P. es técnico de refrigeración desde hace 5 años, uno de los mayores sueños que posee la señora P. es el lograr tener su ropia casa y poder ofrecerles a sus hijos un negocio en donde ellos se abran paso hacia una vida laboral, ella inicio su negocio con el capital que ganaba como asalariada en la Curacao (Tienda de Electrodómesticos), poseteriormente y con el trabajo insesable, la señora pudo independizarse y lograr montar su propio negocio, pero ahora ha planeado inyectarle un mayor capital para la compra de marteria prima e instrumentos para trabajar con mejor agiliddad, comodidad y seguridad en su taller de refrigeración, con esta ayuda la familia pordría cambiar la manera de vivir y subsisitir ante los grandes desafíos que enfrentara con sus hijos debido a la edad de adolecencia que atraviesan actualmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Lesbia Mayerly P. C. is 30 years old, married, and has three children (ages 11, 9, and 4) who are enrolled in school. Her husband helps with her business. Lesbia has been working as a refrigeration technician for the past five years. One of her biggest dreams is to own a house and provide her children with a business where they will be able to work.

She started her business using capital she saved from her salary working at “Curacao” (an appliance store) and eventually became independent. Now that she has built her business, she has plans to inject more capital so that she can purchase materials and instruments so that she can work more efficiently, comfortably, and securely in her repair shop. With the help of her family, she has been able to achieve this lifestyle change. Her children are approaching adolescence, so she has to deal with those challenges as well.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tools & materials for her refrigeration business

loans.name: Vache

texts.en: Vache Jhanginyan is 37 years old. He is a painter and he lives in Kapan with his wife and two daughters. One of his daughters is 18 months, and the other is newborn. Vache’s wife doesn’t work; she takes care of their babies. Vache works at the “Coca-Cola” Company as a hawker, and at the same time, he manages his own café and Internet club in a rented place. His café and Internet club is open until late at night seven days a week. Vache asks for a 350,000 AMD loan to buy new furniture for his café, which helps him seat more clients.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for his café

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: K. Elise est née le 15 aout 1970 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Il y a 15 ans que Elise vit à Adogléta, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à HOUNYEME Francis, un chauffeur, Elise est mère de quatre enfants dont certains sont scolarisés. Les enfants qui ne sont pas scolarisés n’ont pas encore atteint l’âge requis pour fréquenter l’école. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges familiales. Pour aider son mari dans leurs dépenses, Elise vend des pains sucrés et de façon secondaire du poisson frais à son domicile et par la méthode de distribution. Elise achète ses produits à la boulangerie et à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Elise a arrêté les classes au cours secondaire mais exerce son activité depuis 15 ans. Ayant déjà obtenu cinq crédits tous bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé, Elise est maintenant une cliente fidèle de ALIDé. Dans l’optique d’élargir son domaine d’activité et d’augmenter le stock de ses produits, Elise désire bénéficier d’un sixième concours financier auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Elise K. was born on August 15, 1970, in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. For fifteen years, she's been living in Adogléta, a neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to a driver, she's the mother of four children, some of whom attend school. The other children have not yet reached the minimum age to attend school. The couple supports the family together. To help her husband with their expenses, Elise sells bread and, as a secondary business, fresh fish at her home and through the distribution system. She buy her supplies at the bakery and in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. Elise dropped out of school in secondary level, but has been running her business for fifteen years. She already benefited from five loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were all repaid without problems. She's now a loyal client of ALIDé. With the goal of broadening her business scope and bolstering her stock, Elise would like to obtain a sixth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell bread

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es: La Sra. María Del Pilar E. A. de 28 años de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo menor. Tiene casa propia de adobe ubicada en el Caserío de Santa Vicenta. Trabaja como obrera de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 2 años de experiencia. Adicionalmente recibe otros ingresos de una pensión mensual de alimentacion de parte del padre de su hijo. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento
texts.en:
Sra. María Del Pilar E. A. is 28 years old and a single mother of a young child. She has her own home made of adobe in the village of Santa Vicenta. María works as a farm laborer for an agro-industrial business and has two years of experience. In addition, she receives other income from a monthly food pension on behalf of the father of her child. María is an enterprising person, and thanks to her efforts, she was able to acquire her own property.

She is requesting a loan to finish the construction of her house. Her dream is to finish her entire house so that she can achieve a better quality of life. She is extremely grateful for the support being provided through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of her house

loans.name: Norma Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Norma del Socorro L. L., tiene 45 años vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es madre soltera de 4 hijos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, destazo de cerdo y res, y otros productos que comercializa.

Ella se siente agradecida con Kiva porque gracias a los prestamos,  ha podido invertir en su negocio en reiteradas ocaciones y mejorado  la infraestructura de su hogar, ahora ella solicita otro crédito para utilizarlo en la compra de ropa,  carne y productos domésticos, para aumentar el inventario de su negocio, debido a que ha observado, que su demanda se le ha incrementado, asi mismo quiere realizar unas reparaciones en la sala de su vivienda de tal manera que invertira en la comprad e materiales de construccion para dicho obra, agradece el apoyo brindado en los años pasados ya que a surgido un cambio en sus condiciones de vida, gracias a los prestamos que ha tenido con Afodenic.
texts.en:
Norma del Socorro L. L. is 45 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is the single mother of 4 grown children. She works selling American clothing, pieces of pork and beef, and other products. She is grateful to Kiva because thanks to the loans she has received, she has been able to invest in her business on several occasions and also improve the infrastructure of her home. She is now requesting another loan which she will use to buy clothing, meat and household products, to increase the inventory of her business, since she has observed that customer demand has increased. At the same time, she would also like to carry out some repairs to the living room of her home; accordingly, she will invest in construction materials for this project. She is thankful for the support provided to her in previous years, since she has seen a positive change in her living conditions thanks to her loans with Afodenic.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her business and buying construction materials

loans.name: Picaflor Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO D. EMPRENDIMIENTO PICAFLOR CUENTA CON  10 SECUENCIAS D. ANTIGÜEDAD LA MISMA QUE ES REPRESENTADA POR SU DIRECTIVA.

LA SRA. OLIMPIA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL BANCO, ELLA ESTA CASADA Y ELLA TIENE A SU CARGO 6 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. COMIDAS EN EL MERCADO LA PAMPA, SU ESPOSO LE AYUDA EN ESTA ACTIVIDAD Y JUNTOA A EL TRATAN D. SACAR A SUS HIJOS ADELANTE, TRABAJAN MUCHO Y TIENEN GANAS D. SUPERARSE Y ASI MEJORAR LA CALIDAD D. VIDA D. SU FAMILIA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACION D. SUS COMIDAS Y PODER ASI INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO. 

LA SRA. RHINA ESTA COMO TESORERA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS ELLA ES REPOSTERA D. PROFESION Y SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION Y VENTA D. TORTAS ES MUY CONOCIDA EN LA ZONA POR REALIZAR EXQUISITAS TORTAS ES MUY ALEGRE Y TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE ACTIVA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INGREDIEMTES PARA LA ELABORACION D. SUS MASAS Y TORTAS Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO.

TODAS LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON PERSONAS D. LA ZONA D. MINERO SAN JUAN, LAS MISMAS QUE SE CARACTERIZAN POR SU SENCILLES Y HUMILDAD CON RELACION AL NIVEL D. EDUCACION CON LA QUE CUENTAN, SIN EMBARGO SON PERSONAS EMPRENDEDORAS CON GANAS D. SALIR ADELANTE Y PARA ELLO SOLICITAN EL CRÉDITO PARA EL AUMENTO D. SUS MERCADERIAS Y D. ESTA MANERA GENERAR MAYOR UTILIDAD PARA EL SUSTENTO D. SUS FAMILIAS.

TODAS LAS SOCIAS ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Picaflor bank has had 10 previous loan rounds represented by the same director. Mrs. Olympia is president of the bank. She is married and has 6 children of school age. She sells meals in the Pampa market. Her husband helps her with this business and together they do their best to make a better future for their children. They work hard and earn money to improve their family's quality of life. With the money from the loan she will buy ingredients with which to make her meals and so increase her working capital. Mrs. Rhina is the treasurer, is married and has two children. She is a confectioner by traD. and makes and sells cakes. She is well known in the area for her exquisite cakes. She is very happy and hardworking, always keeping busy. With the money from the loan she will buy ingredients for her cakes and will increase her working capital. All of the members of the group are from the San Juan Mine region and are characterised by their sensitivity and humility. They have received little education yet they are entrepreneurial people who wish to get ahead in life and this is why they are requesting the loan to improve their businesses. In this way they will best be able to support their families. All of the members are very grateful to the lenders and Kiva for having faith in them and awarding them credit.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their working capital

loans.name: Salina Jerotich

texts.en:
Salina R. is 48 years old and is married to Joseph Chemokul. They have been blessed with six children. Salina and her husband are both farmers within Chembulet in Eldoret. Salina and her husband both specialize in planting passion fruit, which Salina sells after harvest and gets a monthly income of Kshs 8,000. She has been in this business for the past four years.

Salina was introduced to KADET by another existing client. She has applied for a loan, which she is going to use to buy farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers, and also to use in the planting of the passion fruit. 

Salina's dream is to diversify her business to include poultry, buy more dairy cows and build rental houses to increase her income, so that she can educate her children to the highest level of education in Kenya.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and use in the planting of passion fruit

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a LAPO client with good repayment records. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children. She sells used clothes to make a living. She hopes to own a boutique in the future. Gloria is very determined and wants to expand the size of her business in order to make more profits. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Edith Audelia

texts.es:
Niña Edith Audelia C. D. C., tiene 44 años  es casada y tiene dos hijos D. 12 y 8 años respectivamente, vive en casa `propia la cual esta ubicada Colonia la Pradera Etapa numero 2 Municipio D. El transito, departamento D. Usulutan.
Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa en un puesta ubicado en el mercado Municipal D. El Transito, su negocio lo empezó gracias al apoyo D. una amiga con quien vendía la ropa D. forma ambulante, con las ganancias D. esta actividad a logrado tener un puesto en el mercado, hacerle frente a las necesidades D. carácter básicas D. sus hijos y D. ella.
Actualmente no posee el capital suficiente para incrementar su negocio por lo cual solicita un prestamo que lo invertirá en ropa D. niños, mujer ropa interior D. hombres entre otros. Edith sueña con tener un local mas granD. para poder surtirlo mas y así obtener mas ganancias y poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edith Audelia C. D. C. is 44 years old, is married and has two children ages 12 and 8. She lives in her own home located in the Pradera Etapa neighborhood of El Transito in Usulutan. Edith sells clothes at a stall at the market in El Transito. She started her business thanks to the support of a friend with whom she sold clothing as a street vendor. With the profits from that business she was able to obtain a stall at the market. It has also allowed her to proviD. for the basic necessities for her and her children. She currently lacks sufficient capital to expand her business which is why she is requesting a loan. She will use the loan to invest in children's clothing, women's clothing and men's clothing. Edith dreams with having a larger stall so that she can have a larger stock which would allow her to obtain more profits so that she can proviD. for a better future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children, women and men's clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Santa Lucía Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su 7° ciclo, ellas se encuentran trabajando muy satisfechas y aprovechan el crédito para la invertir en la mejoras D. sus actividades y otras en las mejoras D. sus viviendas, compra D. artículos personales entre otras cosa.
 Podemos hablar D. la Sra. María Luz A.  con 32 años,  tiene 2 hijo se dedica en la venta D. ropas en el mercado para ello sale muy temprano D. su casa y al final del dia vuelve a su casa en ómnibus  por la tarD..
Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar D. su trabajo debe D. realizar las tareas D. la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante  con su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra  D. remeras, short, camisillas, pantalón, pollera.
texts.en:
The group pictured here is currently in the 7th loan cycle. Its members are very satisfied with their work; some are using the loans to invest in their businesses, while others are using them to make improvements to their homes as well as for purchase of personal items. For instance, Maria Luz A., age 32, has two children. She sells clothing in the market, and for this reason she leaves her home very early and at the end of the day returns home by bus. Maria is a very hard-working woman whose typical day is very exhausting since upon returning from work she must also take care of all the household chores. She does all of this for the well-being of her family. Maria is seeking a loan for the purchase of T-shirts, shorts, tank-tops, pants, skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pants, jackets, t-shirts, hats, socks, winter clothing

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma V. is from the village of Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 52 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Elma owns a home products store. Elma has been engaged in her business for 16 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC which was used for additional capital. Elma is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Elma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
 
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 54 years old and married with three children – Grace 12, Legaw 9, and Victor 6, who all go to school.
Samson runs a retail shop and rents out houses. He has six years of experience in the business. He is an active member of Tumaini Kabiku group in Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. Previously he took out a loan of 20,000 KES through the group, which he used to boost the business and successfully repaid. Because of this, he has been allowed to take out another loan of 30,000 KES. He will use the loan to purchase sugar for resale and to renovate his rental houses. He hopes to expand his business for better returns in the future. (This photo was taken in a garden behind his rental houses.)

loans.use: To buy sugar for resale and to renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida C. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Pangpang, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a rice retailing business. Her husband Jeremias C., age 53, earns a living as a construction worker and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 16 to 25 years old. Aida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Aida has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP; thus, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP to buy more rice. She will use the profits to meet basic everyday needs as well as allowance for the kids to go to school and for medicine for her sick mother-in-law. All the while, she is trying her best to continue to save up for the future. Aida C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: María Exaltación

texts.es:
María Exaltación nació en la ciudad del Chinchero y tiene 45 años. Actualmente,  María Exaltación vive junto con su esposo y sus 6 hijos en la misma ciudad. La ciudad de Chinchero se encuentra ubicada a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

María Exaltación tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco, donde vende trucha de horno. La pueden encontrar los días sábados, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, ella sirve una porción de comida con una trucha,  dos papas y ensalada, cada plato de comida cuesta S/. 7 nuevos soles. 

María Exaltación de lunes a viernes se dedica a  la elaboración de artesanía en su pequeño taller que se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ella los domingos vende su artesanía en el mercado modelo de Chinchero. 

Con su próximo préstamo, María Exaltación que espera recibir S/.1000 nuevos soles. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo  para comprar artesanía como por ejemplo bolsas, mantas, mochilas, casacas y chompas de alpaca.   El anhelo de la socia es abrir una tienda, donde pueda vender sus artesanías  a los turistas que vienen a visitar la zona arqueológica de Chinchero.    

El banco comunal “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” tiene dos años y medio de funcionamiento, María Exaltación pertenece desde hace dos años en el banco comunal y le va muy bien. El nombre del banco comunal es un término que en quechua (el idioma autóctono) significa “Princesa Hermosa de Chinchero”.
texts.en:
María Exaltación, 45, was born in the city of Chinchero. She lives with her husband and 6 children there. Chinchero is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. María Exaltación has a stand in Cusco’s Huancaro Market where she sells baked trout. She can be found there on Saturdays from 6am until 5pm. Her portions consist of a trout, two potatoes and salad. Each plate of food costs 7 new soles. From Monday through Friday María Exaltación makes crafts in a small workshop in her home and sells her items in Chinchero’s Modelo Market on Sundays. She expects to get 1000 new soles in her next loan. She’d like to use the money to buy crafts like alpaca bags, blankets, knapsacks, jackets and sweaters. Her goal is to open a store where she can sell her crafts to tourists that come to visit the Chinchero archaeological sites. The “Cusi Ccoyllor de Chinchero” communal bank has been in operation for two and a half years. María Exaltación has been a member for two years and does well. The name of the bank comes from Quechua (the local native language) and means: “Beautiful Chincero Princess.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy alpaca crafts like bags, blankets, knapsacks, jackets and sweaters.

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Fe inicia su ciclo 21 con 16 socias, que realizan diferentes negocios.
Como es el caso D. L. Señora Maria que es L. presidenta por primera vez D. su Banco comunal, es socia hace 5 años y en todo este tiempo aprendió a ser responsable, lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones.
Maria es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Maria junto a su esposo se dedican a L. venta D. ropa variada que venD. en las ferias D. L. región y también viaja a L. selva ayacuchana, sus productos los adquiere en L. ciudad D. Lima.
Además Maria en los días libres venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria cerca D. su casa, actividad que realiza por las noches.
Maria tiene un nieto que es sordomudo que esta a su responsabilidad y su sueño es que el pueda mejorar su calidad D. vida, también sueña con educar a sus hijos y tener una casa propia porque hasta L. fecha vive en casa alquilada.
Maria solicita un crédito D. 1800 para L. compra D. polos, pantalones.
texts.en:
The “Fe” (Faith) Communal bank is in its 21st cycle. There are 16 members, and they have different businesses. Maria is one of the members, and for the first time she is the president of the communal bank. She has been a member for five years. During all of that time she learned to be responsible. What she likes the most are the meetings. Maria is married and has two children who attend school. Maria and her husband sell assorted clothing. She sells at regional fairs, and she also travels to the Ayacuchana jungle. She gets the clothes in the city of Lima. On her days off Maria also sells food in an itinerant manner close to her house. She sells in the evenings. Maria has a deaf-mute grandson who is her responsibility. Her dream is to be able to improve their quality of life. She also dreams of educating her children and having her own house. They now live in a rented house. Maria is requesting a loan for 1,800 soles to buy polo style shirts and pants.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy polo style shirts and pants

loans.name: Brigilda

texts.en:
Brigilda V. is from the village of Burgos, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 37 years old,  married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Brigilda owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Brigilda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Brigilda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brigilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Brigilda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Brigilda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand and improve his shop

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
K. Wilber is 27 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. His child is not currently in school. Wilber's business is a jewelry shop, which he has had for five years.         

To help expand his business, Wilber has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more jewelry. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Wilber hopes to generate greater profits and take care of his family. In the future, Wilber hopes to expand his business more.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry

loans.name: Chitsala

texts.en:
Chitsala is a married man with four children, two of whom attend school. He owns a house that  has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children.

For over six years, he has operated a retail shop, selling sugar, maize flour and washing soaps to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season, farmers harvest their crops and they have enough food, hence few people buy goods from the retail shop while during the hot season, farmers have no food and they purchase from the retail shop. Chitsala hopes to become a big wholesaler in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase two sacks of sugar and five bundles of wheat flour.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of sugar and five bundles of wheat flour

loans.name: Juliana Lisbeth

texts.es: Juliana es una jovencita muy emprendedora, ella trabaja como estilista hace medio año. Con el sueldo de este servicio que presta pudo ahorrar y comprar algunas tijeras y cepillos; pero aún insuficientes herramientas para lograr su sueño de un salón de belleza en su casa que espera lograr. Desea especializarse más en su carrera. El crédito lo invertirá para comprar accesorios de belleza como tintes, oxigenta, gel, brillo y adornos de cabello dado que está próximo las fiestas de promoción de colegios y en su zona no hay mucha competencia de este tipo de negocio, lo cual espera alcanzar captar regulares clientes.
texts.en: Juliana is a very enterprising young lady.  She has been working as a stylist for six months.  With the money she earns from this service she has been able to save and buy some scissors and brushes.  However, she still has insufficient equipment to achieve her dream of having a beauty salon in her home which she longs to do.  She would like to specialize some more in her career.  She will invest her loan in buying beauty accessories such as dyes, Oxigenta lotion, gloss and hair accessories because school graduation parties are approaching and in her area there is not much competition in this type of business.  She hopes to take advantage of the occasion to attract regular customers.

loans.use: To buy dyes, Oxigenta lotion, gel and gloss

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam de 40 años, vende productos Yanbal (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes) y accesorios para hogar. Vive con sus dos hijos en una zona periurbana con todos los servicios básicos el lugar está ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.  

Para soportar los gastos de la casa ya que esta divorciada ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yanbal y accesorios para hogar. Poco a poco incremento la lista de clientes porque trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, tostadoras, vasos, pinzas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yanbal como perfumes, cremas, electrodomésticos. En el futuro quiere comprar más mercadería para tener variedad.
texts.en:
Miriam is 40 years old.  She sells Yanbal products (a company that offers independent sales to enterprising women) and housewares.  She lives with her two children on the periphery of the urban area, with all basic services.  The place is on Guayaquil’s Beltway, an area surrounded by marshes.

As she is divorced, in order to cover household expenses, she started selling Yanbal products and housewares.  She gradually increased her customer base, because she starts work early, offering the products to her neighbors and friends.  She sells perfume, creams, cosmetics, toasters, glasses, tweezers.  

She wishes to use the loan to buy Yanbal products, such as perfumes, creams, and household appliances.  In the future, she would buy more merchandise, in order to have more variety.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, appliances

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes to resell

loans.name: Loah
