texts.en: Loah L., 32, sells sugar cane juice, earning an income of USD 2 per day. L. is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 66 on food, USD 2 on electricity supply, and USD 15 on other necessary expenses every month. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of USD 8 per day. L. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more supplies to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplies

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy D. is from the village of Bayabas, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 38 years old. Randy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Randy owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is the buying and selling of bananas in the local community. Randy has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Randy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Randy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Randy from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding his business.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito G. is a farmer. He is married and is living in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. His friends describe him as a kind person. Carlito also enjoys what he does. He says he is very thankful for his rice farm because it helps his family in a lot of ways. Carlito works hard to improve his farm and earn more for his family. 

Carlito applied for a loan from CEVI. He will use it to buy fertilizers and other materials needed for a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farming materials

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia, de 46 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Juan de 44 años y sus 4 hijos menores, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Basilia ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos. Sus productos los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde la Arveja, habas y maíz que cultiva, son rápidamente comprados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, sabe que este aporte le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Los mil nuevos soles solicitados, los invertirá en la compra de abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Basilia, 46, is a very kind, hard working woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Juan, 44, and their four minor children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

By working hard, Basilia has managed to grow her crops.  She rises very early every morning to water and care for her respective crops.  She sells her products in Tarma’s wholesale market where the peas, lima beans and corn she grows are quickly bought.

What she enjoys the most about her work is enjoying the freedom of working in the fields.  She’s been in this occupation for 13 years and considers the most difficult part having to till the soil.  In time she’d like to be able to buy more land to expand production.

This is her 4th loan with MFP.  She knows that the support will help her quite a bit in the development and progress of her business.  This is why she’s willing to repay all her installments punctually.  She is a very responsible member of her communal bank which makes her very well liked.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy manure and insecticide.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and insecticide.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito is from the village of Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Charito owns and operates a retail store. She has been engaged in her business for three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month. 

Charito joined PMPC in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 15000 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Charito from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa M. is a palm oil seller at the Jukwa Market in Abura, Cape Coast. She also sells food items, such as okra and tomatoes. She has been in this trade for four years and is now keen to expand her business. She intends to use the loan to purchase more food items to increase her sales. 
Her income helps support her family – she has four children and is married to a farmer. Her earnings help pay for school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to purchase more food items and increase her sales.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy A., age 41, sells second-hand shoes from his stall at a big market in Nairobi called Gikomba. He has been in this business for the last 14 years and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 20,000. His wife, Ebby Kagena, supports him in the business. They have two children, ages 10 and 14.

Kennedy is a new client who has just joined KADET Ltd recently, and he has applied for his first loan, which he plans to use to add more shoes to his existing stock. He anticipates making a profit from this investment and plans to use it to expand his business as well as to open another market stall that his wife will manage.

Kennedy hopes to open more stalls in future and ensure that his family is well taken care of.

loans.use: to buy shoes to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Socos, tiene 63 años, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos.
Flora, vive en el distrito D. Socos, se dedica a la venta D. quesos,  carne, que los compra en las ferias D. Alpachaca y Rosas Pata, tambien realiza la venta D. mantas que los compra en el penal D. Yanamilla, panes wawa que los compra en el mercado D. Huamanga. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra, D. quesos, carne, mantas, pan wawa, estos los venderá en la ciudad D. Lima.
Está en Finca Perú desD. hace 3 ciclos, ingreso por la invitación D. su hija le gusta porque le dan créditos para trabajar y pueD. ahorrar, su sueño es que su capital crezca para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
Flora is 63 years old and is a member of the Socos communal bank.  She is a widow with five children.

Flora lives in the Socos district and sells cheese and meat that she buys at the Alpachaca and Rosas Pata fairs.  She also sells blankets that she buys at the Yanamilla prison, and wawa breads that she buys in the Huamanga market.  She will use the money from this loan to buy cheeses, meat, and wawa bread that she will sell in Lima.

She has been with Finca Perú for three cycles and she joined after her daughter invited her.  She enjoys it because she is able to get loans and it allows her to save.  She wants to grow her capital so that she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy inventory for resale

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald M. S. is 38 years old, widowed and has 2 children ages 13 and 6 years old, whom he hopes to give good education to the university level. 

Ronald is a charcoal dealer in Mombasa. Mombasa is along the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many tourist attraction sites, particularly the Indian ocean white beaches. Ronald has been selling charcoal for the last 2 years to the local people and has managed to give employment to 2 people. He says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge he has is there are so many people in the same kind of business as his in the area, so customers are spoiled for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 50,000 KES to buy more charcoal to expand his business. He hopes to grow his business and start supplying gas in the future. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua B. is a widow. She has four children. As the family’s sole breadwinner, she earns her income by selling food items such as cowpeas (as shown in the photograph). She is keen to expand her business and will use her loan to purchase more cowpeas, ripe plantain and palm oil. She hopes this will increase her sales. Additional profits will be reinvested back into her business. 

Ekua has been in her current business for the past 2 years and she plies her trade in Besease Village, which is near the fishing town of Elmina.

loans.use: to purchase more cowpeas, ripe plantain and palm oil.

loans.name: Angel Alfredo

texts.es:
Don Alfredo es casado, tiene 29 años de edad, estudio 4 años en educación primaria,  se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, tiene 10 años de experiencia en este trabajo, inició su negocio pensando en su superación personal y ahora en la superación de su familia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa.

Decide ampliar su capital de trabajo para lo cual solicita un préstamo que le servirá para comprar hilo de diferentes clases y colores esto para seguir produciendo mas cortes y obtener ganancias al vender el producto final de la inversión que esta haciendo, ya que en el futuro desea ver su negocio prospero y con mejores ganacias.
texts.en:
Alfredo is married, 29 years old, and studied until the 4th grade.  He dedicates himself to weaving traditional fabrics, and has 10 years of experience in this work.  He started his business with thoughts of personal accomplishment, and now in terms of its benefit to his family.  He counts on the support of his wife.

He has decided to augment his working capital, which is why he is requesting a loan.  He will use the funds to buy threads of different types and colors, so he can continue to produce more fabrics.  He hopes to obtain profits from selling the final products from the investment he’s making.  In the future, he wants to see a prosperous business with greater income.

loans.use: buy threads of different types and colors.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has been working in the mechanics field since 2000. His work consists of maintaining all types of cars. He is thankful for his business income. It helps him satisfy his family's needs. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy more materials needed for his work. In the future, he is planning to enlarge his business and open a new shop where he will sell car spare parts. This will be his second Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy more materials needed for his work

loans.name: Luzlinda

texts.es:
Luzlinda  tiene 30 años  ella vive con su esposo y su  menor hijo en casa propia en un sector perteneciente al distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz apocos minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo en el departamento de Lambayeque.

Luzlinda cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su propio domicilio, este negocio es atendido por ella misma. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes de la zona diversos productos comestibles como golosinas y gaseosas, entre otros productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida, con esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Luzlinda ha venido experimentando una fuerte demanda en su negocio, debido a esto ella piensa  ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles, para lograr sus objetivos

Luzlinda es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona en donde reside. Las personas que le conocen la consideran alguien tranquila y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Luzlinda is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and her youngest child in their own home, located in a neighborhood within the district of José Leonardo Ortiz just a few minutes from the city of Chiclayo in the department of Lambayeque.

Luzlinda owns a small grocery store situated in her home. She attends to the store herself. At the store she offers her local customers an array of food products like sweets and sodas among other basics needs items and groceries. The business is very well received and through the business she helps her husband to financially support their family.

Luzlinda has experienced a lot of demand at her business and therefore she is thinking about expanding her business by acquiring more products. That is why she thought it was a good idea to request a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to achieve her goals.

Luzlinda is very well known and respected by the residents of the area she lives in. The people who know her consider her to be quiet and very responsible.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, povincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique casado  e pai de 3 filhos de idades entre 6 a 17 anos idades. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e  sustenta mais um sobrinho e um neto que vivem  com ele.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, e funcionario permanente a mais de 35 anos e tem um rendimento de 4.500.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de palestras de agentes de bancos e este e o seu quinto emprestimo no valor de 12.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para a sua obra (cimento, areia, tijolos,chapas e outros ), os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 9.600.00mt, 11.000.00mt, 13.000.00mt, e 12.200.00mt.

sonho e concluir a sua obra, mobiliar e comprar um carro e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Salvador was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 3 children who range in age from 6 to 17.  He studied through the fourth grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports one of his nephews and a grandson who live with him.

He never left Maputo.  He has had a full-time job for more than 35 years and makes 4,500 meticals a month, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through talks given by the bank's representatives.  This is his fifth loan in the amount of 12,500 meticals, which he will use to buy materials to finish his house (cement, sand, bricks, metal sheets, etc.).  His previous loans were for:  9,600, 11,000, 13,000, and 12,200 meticals.

He dreams about finishing his home, furnishing it, and buying a car, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish his home (cement, sand, bricks, metals sheets, etc.)

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa operates a grocery store where she sells such items as rice, canned fish and tomatoes, and powdered milk. She is shown here standing in front of her provision shop. She and her husband, who is a farmer, have two children. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase additional canned fish and tomatoes, rice, and other items to offer for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned fish and tomatoes, rice, and other items to offer for sale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene  19 años, nació en el caserío de Yanama Alto, ahí creció al cuidado de su mamá Agripina, su papá Cupertino y sus 3 hermanos con los que vive en su casa propia. La vitalidad y las ganas de triunfar le llevaron a tener visiones muy claras de lo que quiere en la vida. Cada 2 meses viaja al país de Argentina, donde se dedica al negocio de elaboración de zapatillas de todos los modelos y clases. Ahí tiene buenas ganancias, durante 6 días se dedica al corte del producto terminado, dejándolo listo para ser comercializado. Pero sus aspiraciones es poseer sus propias máquinas para comenzar su propio negocio, para eso le falta 15 mil soles de capital, los cuales espera obtener de la agricultura. Oficio que le enseñaron sus padres, ya tiene 2 años de experiencia en la siembra de papa, habas, arveja y ajos. Los cuales cuida y fertiliza en los meses de temporada agrícola, donde espera con calma la cosecha para venderla al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene buenas ganancias que le permiten juntar dinero para su objetivo y apoyar en los gastos familiares. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Manantiales de Yanama” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le ofrecieron. Además de comprometerse a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Juan de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja para comenzar está campaña agrícola.
texts.en: Juan is 19 years old, he was born in Yanama Alto, he grew up under his mother’s, Agripina, and father's, Cupertino's care. He lives with his 3 siblings and parents whom he lives with in his own home. His vitality and determination to get ahead have helped him have a clear vision of what he wants in life. Every 2 months he travels to Argentina where he makes shoes of all models and types, there he has good earnings and for 6 months he dedicates himself to cut the finished product leaving it ready to be sold. Juan wishes to have his own machinery to begin his own business and for that he needs 15 thousand soles for capital which he hopes to have through agriculture. This is work that he has learned from his parents and has 2 years of experience growing potatoes, broad beans, green peas and garlic which he cares for and fertilizes during the agricultural season. Juan waits patiently for his harvest to mature and sells it in the wholesaler market in the city of Tarma where he gets good profits that allow him to get enough money to meet his goal and support his families’ expenses. Juan belongs to the “Manantiales de Yanama” (Springs of Yanama) Communal Bank and this is his first loan with MFP, he is grateful for the opportunity to progress and is committed to meeting his payments quotas on time. Juan with your support will use the money to buy 2 sacks of pea seeds to begin his agricultural work.

loans.use: buy two sacks of green pea seeds.

loans.name: Catherine Nsoh

texts.en:
This borrower is separated with three children and lives in a house provided by a family friend at Nchuobuh, a quarter in  Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.

She had difficulties in educating her children after she left her husband, not to talk of providing shelter for herself and the children. The situation became worst when she was driven out of the family house because she was not supposed to stay in the family house with her children. Her mother who was so supportive to her and two sisters who were also very supportive to her died, making her more frustrated. 

Given a new loan she plans to invest in the rearing of pigs, to purchase feed,piglets  and pay for the construction of a pig sty. She will also rent a piece of land for farming, pay for labour to do clearing of the farm, purchase seedling for planting and also invest in the buying and selling of fresh groundnuts. Her activity will help the community to provide food and manure from her pigs  farm . Her activity will also help to provide employment in that people will clear her farm and also transport her produce. She will pay for labor for the construction of a pig sty and tilling of her farm.

 She will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her house rent. Her children’s school needs will be taken care of. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets, pig feed, fence Constrution, renting of farm buying of seedlings and fresh groundnut.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a married woman with two children; one attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She sells household consumption items like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing another retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, rice and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost the business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
This is Emily, 40, a resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Edgar, a security guard, and mother to their three children. The eldest is already in college while the youngest is still in elementary school. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Emily operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg.  She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emily hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business..

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.es:
Marlyn desde Pradomar,cerca a las Payas en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, da las gracias a sus financiadores por apoyar tantos negocios pequeños en el mundo; ella está preparándose para su segundo credikiva, porque va a comprar ingredientes para elaborar sus productos como harina de trigo, aceite , azúcar, margarina, carnes frías, desechables y bandejas, así mismo comprará un molino eléctrico de maíz y hará algunas reformas locativas al salón de producción. Con su anterior credikiva logró descuentos por la compra de ingredientes y se siente muy satisfecha de su inversión.  Ella textualmente envia el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva: "Reciban desde las cálidaas y costeras tierras de Puerto Colombia un gran saludo de agradecimiento, por toda la ayuda recibida, deseando que todos los fondeadores y sus familias sean bendecidos y prosperádos enormemente por el Dios de la Misericordia."
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Marlyn, ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/243055
texts.en:
From Pradomar, near Las Payas in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, Marlyn sends her thanks to the lenders who are helping small business owners throughout the world.  She is getting ready for her second credkiva which she will use to buy food ingredients such as flour, oil, sugar, margarine, cold meats, disposables and trays.  Shealso will buy an electric corn grinder and carry out improvements at her production shop.  With her previous credikiva she was able to get discounts on ingredient purchases and she is very pleased with the investment.  

She would like to send the following message to the Kiva lenders:  "From the warm, coastal lands of Puerto Colombia, receive a greeting of appreciation for all the help received, with hopes that our Merciful God will bless and make prosperous all the lenders and their families."

If you would like to know more about Marlyn, click on the following link:
http://kiva.org/lend/243055

loans.use: To buy food ingredients and an electric corn grinder, and make improvements to the production shop.

loans.name: Maria Ivone

texts.es:
La Sra. María tiene como actividad la venta de vajilla y utensilios de cocina,  actividad que realiza durante la semana  en su puesto de venta que esta en una céntrica feria del alto de la paz.
La familia de la cliente esta compuesta por su esposo y recientemente nació su primer hijo, es una familia joven y con muchas ganas de triunfar en la vida esta  actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ella  y su familia, el esposo tiene como profesión la abogacía, el destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería vajilla por cantidad para así agrandar su negocio y mejorara sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María sells dishes and kitchen utensils, which she does during the week in her stall in a central market in El Alto de La Paz.

María's family includes her husband and their recently born first child.  It's a young family that wants to be successful in life.  This activity is her principal source of income for her and her family.  Her husband works in the field of law.

The purpose of the loan is to buy table service merchandise wholesale and so increase her business and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy table service merchandise wholesale.

loans.name: Erick Ouma

texts.en: Erick is a married man aged 33 years with three children and he has a little restaurant business which is situated in a busy market. His clients are business people in the same area. His major challenge is high cost and storage of food items. However, he works hard from early morning to late evening to ensure his business is doing well. He hopes to own a big restaurant in Nairobi's CBD as well as buy himself a plot of land. He describes himself as aggressive and committed to his work.

loans.use: To buy fish to cook and serve.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en:
Elmie is 54 years old and has been engaged in running an eatery business for more than 17 years. Over these years of operating this kind of occupation, she paid for her two children to finish their studies. She gets all the expenses used for their education from her business. She struggled a great deal to promote their education, but because of her courage and faith in God, she completed her sacrifice.


Right now, she wants to recover all that was spent. Therefore Emilie is now asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy raw ingredients needed in her eatery such as vegetables, meat and "pancit". This would be a great factor to increase her sales every day. She is thankful that Alalay Sa Kaunlaran Inc. give her an opportunity to borrow an additional working capital to improve her current business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed in her eatery such as vegetables, meat and "pancit" (noodles).

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past nine years, she has operated a nursery school for young children from the neighboring community. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her school to incorporate upper classes in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase cement and timber to expand her classrooms. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cement and timber to expand her classrooms.

loans.name: Elizabeth Catalina

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth cuenta con 44 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales ya todos están casados, ella junto con sus hijos tienen una blockera (se dedican a la elaboración de blocks), desde hacen 6 años.
Ella dice que decidió iniciar con esta actividad, ya que quería buscar de manera de apoyar a su familia y mejorar aun mas su calidad de vida, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas material como: cemento y arena, para continuar con las ventas en su negocio.
La meta que tiene doña eli (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) para su negocio y espera poder cumplirla, es la de invertirle muchísimo más, para hacerlo crecer rápidamente, ya que quiere comprar mas utensilios de trabajo palas, marcas y 3 carretillas, para así mejorar e incrementar un poco mas sus producción e ingresos, puesto que así podrá asegurar su futuro.
Le da las gracias a los prestatarios de kiva, por la confianza que les ha brindando, ya que gracias a ese apoyo ahora puede continuar con la inversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 44 years old, widowed and has four children who are all now married.  She and her children own a brick factory (they manufacture concrete blocks); they’ve had it for six years.

She says that she decided to go into this activity because she wanted to find a way to support her family and improve their quality of life still more.  The loan she got will be used to buy more raw materials like cement and sand to continue with sales.

Eli’s (as she’s better known in her community) goal for her business that she hopes to reach is to invest much more into it to make it grow quickly because she wants to buy more work tools: shovels, templates and three wheelbarrows to improve and increase production and income a bit more because then she’d be able to insure her future.

She thanks Kiva lenders for the trust they’ve placed in her because thanks to this support she’s able now to continue investing in her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like cement and sand.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 48, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Touch is a farmer.

Touch is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the children to commute to work in the city. By doing so, her family is able to decrease expenses on public transportation. 

In the future, she would like to use additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Chemwa Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chemwa SHG Group in Western Kenya! Frida is the facilitator of the Chemwa SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Frida takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Frida had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Frida was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Frida and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Frida will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Chemwa SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Frida with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ashford

texts.en:
Ashford is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya.  He is aged thirty-three, married with two children aged ten and six and has been in farming for six solid years.  His farm produces coffee, kales and bananas which are sold locally.  He also does timber lumbering besides farming.

Ashford has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo amounting to KES 30,000 to help him purchase irrigation pipes for his banana plantation.  He says that the irrigation system will not only help in banana farming but will expand his entire farming business which has always been limited by insufficient rainfall.  He adds that the boost in farming income will take care of his basic family needs.

Ashford notes that sourcing for capital, insufficient rainfall and diseases are the major challenges farmers face in Nkubu.

loans.use: to buy irrigation pipes.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 51 years old and married to Mukui. They have seven children.

He has been in the farming business for the last 10 years, from which he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is applying for his third loan of KES 50,000. He paid his previous loan well and in good time. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer.

He hopes to use the loan to buy farm inputs. He plans to expand his farming to include a beekeeping project and buy a dairy cow in future.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Azingam

texts.en: Azingam is married and has three children ranging from five to thirteen years old. She describes herself as an honest and innocent woman. She runs a grocery store and sells vegetables such as tomatoes, ripe bananas, avocados, onions etc. Her business is in a residential area. She has been in this business for the last five years. She describes her business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve the business. She will be using the KES 15,000 loan to buy more vegetables and fruits. In the next five years, Azingam hopes and dreams of selling all type of vegetables and of venturing into a tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a 23-year-sold single man who owns a house with piped water but no electricity. His greatest monthly expense is food for himself. 

Neema has operated a farming supplies shop for the past 2 years; his potential clients are the local area farmers. He faces a major challenge of transportation. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 he wants to purchase 5 boxes of pesticides and 10 boxes of maize seed for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase 5 boxes of pesticides and 10 boxes of maize seed for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of the business.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He is 32, married, and has 2 children. Nadir has lost his parents in war. He sells flowers. Nadir applies for the loan $1200 to open his own flower-shop and increase the flower assortments.

loans.use: To open his own flower-shop and increase the flower assortments

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet sells various items for the home. She sells cosmetics, perfume, schoolbags, shoes and other items requested by her customers. She has run her business from her home for 8 years. In the afternoons she also goes and sells her merchandise from door to door. She attends clients from 7 AM to 10 PM and goes from door to door from 3 PM to 7 PM in the evening.

Janet is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of school supplies her clients are currently requesting because school is in session.

Janet is 38 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are studying. Janet considers herself a hardworking woman who is looking for a way to increase revenues in order to be able to support her children. She is confident that she will be able to succeed with the loan and thus meet her goals, which are to continue to educate her children and improve their lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Janet tiene negocio de venta de artículos varios para el hogar. Vende cosméticos, perfumes, mochilas escolares, zapatos y otros artículos que el cliente le solicite. Tiene su negocio desde hace 8 años en su domicilio. Janet por las tardes también recorre su mercadería de casa en casa. Su atención a los clientes en la mañana es desde 7AM a 10pm y en las tardes sale a las 15PM a 19PM

Janet solicita su crédito para invertir en compra de listas de útiles escolares que por ser la época de estudios sus clientes les están haciendo pedidos y no desea fallarles porque saben que ella les da tiempo para cancelarlas.

Janet es casada tiene 38 años y 2 hijos menores de edad que están estudiando. Janet se considera una mujer trabajadora que busca la forma de generar otros ingresos y así poder cumplir con las necesidades de sus hijos. Además ella tiene la plena confianza que saldrá adelante con el préstamo, por que tiene un propósito que cumplir que es seguir educando a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda.

loans.use: Investment in School Supplies

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly K. E. is a 47-year-old woman and mother of 1 child. She lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a landlord who builds different rooms to rent to the garment factory workers and can make a moderate amount, around $5 each day. Her husband, meanwhile, is too old to work, but he has three pool tables to service in his area which enables him to make around $5 each day. In order to maximize the size of her profits, Ly K. E. is requesting a loan amount of $1000 to build more rooms, so that she can fulfill her tenants' needs.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent out.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi T., 55 years old, lives with her husband and a daughter at Hung Dao Commune, Hung Nguyen District, of Nghe An province. Four of her older children (2 boys and 2 girls) are working away from home and rarely visit, leaving her to take care of the family and all the housework on her own. Mrs. T. starts loaning money in 1998 with the starting amount of $50 to invest in her butchery business. After her four children grew up and left home, without any one to help out, she had to change to fish-farming and raising pigs. Her husband, Mr. Tran Minh Quy, is a disable war veteran but has helped her a lot in both of these businesses. On average, for every farrow of pig she sells (usually once in every 3 months) she earns a profit of $150. Currently, Mrs T. is asking for a loan of $825 to invest in her home projects. This amount of money will be used to buy breeding fish (for $312), breeding pig (for $200) and foodstuff for them (for $312).

Translated from Vietnamese by Anh Hoai Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuyết, 55 tuổi sống cùng với chồng và cô con gái nuôi tại xã Hưng Đạo, huyện Hưng Nguyên, Nghệ An. 4 người con lớn gồm 2 trai, 2 gái đều đi làm ăn xa ít có dịp về thăm cha mẹ, chị Tuyết một mình chăm lo hầu hết công việc trong gia đình. Chị bắt đầu tham gia vay vốn từ năm 1998 với mức vốn 50 USD đầu tư cho việc mua thịt lợn bán, nhưng sau khi các con đi làm xa không có người phụ giúp, chị Tuyết chuyển sang chăn nuôi cá và lợn giống. Chồng chị, anh Trần Minh Quý, một thương bệnh binh là người phụ giúp chị rất tích cực trong công việc trông nom ao cá và đàn lợn. Tính bình quân cứ sau khi bán một lứa lợn ( 3 tháng ) chị Tuyết thu lãi khoảng 150 USD. Hiện nay chị Tuyết đang làm dự án xin vay 825 USD để đầu tư cho dự án của mình. Số tiền này được chị tính toán chi tiêu như sau: 312 USD mua cá giống, 200 USD mua lợn giống, 312 USD dùng để mua thức ăn.

loans.use: buy breeding pigs, fishes and food for them

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana O. is 35 years old, married with a child, and lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells fairly used clothes. She learnt her trade for 8 months before she opened her shop in 2003. She has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years. "I wish to start selling shoes with the loan amount of US$ 550 and also to buy more fairly used clothes for resale," Ana says.

loans.use: To buy more fairly used clothes and shoes for re-sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris is a very hard working woman - this quality can be attributed to her upbringing with lovely parents who instilled in her an attituD. of determination and dedication for her own self-improvement. With her husband, she has already dedicated many years to agriculture. She sows potatoes in little patches of land that she bought long time ago. Fortunately, this activity has allowed her to proviD. for her eight lovely children, who motivate her to work harder everyday. She wishes to improve the quality of production and to increase the quantity of her produce so that she can sustain herself economically for the rest of year while waiting for the following year's harvest of her country's product, the potato. For this wish, she does not lose hope and looks forward to continuing life optimistically. Thus, she seeks a loan to invest in more seeds and fertilizer to cultivate her land. With the profits, she hopes to materialize her goals. Let us support this strong and courageous woman.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Doris, es una mujer muy trabajadora y le debe esta formación a sus queridos padres que forjaron en ella una actitud D. empeño y dedicación para su propia superación. Ahora ya lleva muchos años dedicándose a la agricultura, en compañía D. su esposo y siembra papa en las pequeñas parcelas D. tierra que compraron hace mucho tiempo. Gracias a esta actividad ha mantenido a sus ocho queridos hijos que son el motor que la impulsa cada día a trabajar más. Desea incrementar la calidad D. su producción y acrecentar la cantidad D. sus productos para el mes D. mayo a fin D. sostenerse económicamente por el resto del año mientras esperan la próxima cosecha del producto nativo D. su patria; es por ello que no pierD. el optimismo y la fuerza que la anima a seguir adelante y solicita un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra D. semillas y abono para sus campos D. cultivo y con las ganancias concretará sus planes.Solidaricémonos con una mujer con mucho coraje y fortaleza para vivir.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer to cultivate her land so she can continuing harvesting her country's flagship produce, the potato

loans.name: Luvinda

texts.es:
Miss. Luvinda M. S. is a single, independent woman who has worked hard to achieve a stable quality of life and improve her financial situation which had been unfavorable.

For two years now, Luvinda M. S. has worked selling varied products (general store). However, she has been able to find a better opportunity in this type of business because she has invested her savings and is independent.

Luvinda M. S. has been working with CEPRODEL for two years and feels satisfied with the loans she has gotten because they have come at a good time, helping her satisfy the needs of her business and her customers. She has a record of 10 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señorita Luvinda M. S. es una mujer soltera independiente que ha luchado por obtener un nivel de vida estable y mejorar sus condiciones económicas las cuales han sido desfavorables.

Desde hace dos años Luvinda M. S. se dedica a la venta de productos varios (PULPERIA), sin embargo ha logrado encontrar una mejor oportunidad con este tipo de negocio porque ha invertido con ahorros propios ya que no depende de nadie.

Luvinda M. S. trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos años y se siente muy satisfecha con los créditos otorgados pues les han sido brindados en el momento oportuno, ayudando así a suplir las necesidades del negocio y satisfacer a diario a sus clientes. Ella tiene un record de diez créditos.

loans.use: Investing in her general store business (Inversión al negocio)

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Phạm Thị Hòa, 50 years old, graduated from an agricultural university, veterinary medicine major. In 1994, due to a family reason she resigned from a government position then opened a pharmacy and started practicing veterinary medicine. In 1999, she joins the TYM Fund, took out her first loan. Her business is so prosperous that enables her to build a 2-storey house for the couple and 2 small children. She is naturally good with kids so she offers to baby-sit 7 more children besides hers. The monthly income for all those activities is 350USD. She would like to take out a loan of 1200USD to purchase more medicine and equipment. She is planning to open a kindergarten in near future.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Phạm Thị Hòa, 50 tuổi, tốt nghiệp đại học nông nghiệp chuyên nghành chăn nuôi thú y. Năm 1994 vì lý do gia đình nên chị xin nghỉ công việc nhà nước về mở cửa hàng bán thuốc và dịch vụ thú y. Năm 1999 chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương vay vốn phụ thêm vào công việc kinh doanh. Với kinh nghiệm lâu năm và uy tín nên việc kinh doanh làm ăn rất thuận lợi. Chị xây được ngôi nhà 2 tầng khang trang sạch sẽ thoáng mát cho gia đình gồm 2 vợ chồng và 2 con. Tính cách nhân hậu yêu thương con trẻ nên chị còn nhận trông 7 cháu cho các đôi vợ chồng trẻ để họ yên tâm công tác. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình chị 350USD/tháng. Chị mong muốn được vay thêm 1200USD để mua thuốc và thiết bị thú y. Trong tương lai chị mong muốn sẽ có đủ điều kiện để thành lập một trường mầm non tư thục.

loans.use: Buy veterinary medicine, equipment

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa B. is married with her own house and two children, ages 10 and 15. They are in school while she works in a convenience store of her own. She sells various goods and has a good amount of meat that she sells as well. This makes her business competitive.

She is asking for a loan today to help her pay all the necessary bills including electricity and water, however, she wishes to invest most of the money in buying necessary goods like flour, oil, rice, and yerba mate.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like sugar, flour, rice, Yerba Mate, and pasta.

loans.name: Koku Séna

texts.fr:
Mr. Koku Séna G. was born on September 2, 1981 in Lomé. He is single and responsible for one other person. He started in the carpentry business in 2005. Given the growth of his business and the strong demand of builders, Mr. Koku Séna G. can no longer fulfill his clients’ requests because he delivers his work before being paid. This is why he is starting to lose some clients. To remedy this state of affair, he is requesting a loan of 300.000 FCFA to purchase twelve aluminum tubes and four glass panes of 8mm and 4m² each.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur G. Koku Séna est né le 02 septembre 1981 à Lomé. Il est célibataire et a une personne à charge. Il a commencé par exercer l’activité de menuiserie depuis 2005. Vu l’évolution de son activité et la forte demande des constructeurs de bâtiments, Monsieur G. Koku Séna n’arrivait plus à répondre à la demande de ses clients car il livre le travail avant d’être payé. Ce qui fait qu’il commence par perdre certains de ses clients. Pour palier à cet état de chose, il sollicite un emprunt d’un montant de 300.000 FCFA pour acheter douze tubes en aluminium et quatre vitres d’épaisseurs 8 mm et de 4m² chacune.

loans.use: Purchase of aluminum tubing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cooking equipment for catering

loans.name: Subi

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Subi J., who is married and has four children. In 2001, Subi established her salon business, and she now requires a loan in order to purchase two chairs, wall tiles, a television, and a setting machine for her salon. She thanks you for your support.

Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or plaited, and made to look like your own.

loans.use: To purchase two chairs, wall tiles, a television and a hair setting machine.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Mr. Ousmane Koné, 23, is married with no children. Together with his wife, he lives with his father in an extended family in the Torakabougou neighborhood of Bougouni (Bougoni Prefecture, Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

He learned this business from his father who was a well-known local carpenter. With 8 years' experience, he enjoys an excellent reputation with the citizens of Bougouni. For this reason he receives a lot of orders for furniture and various repairs.

To satisfy the ever-growing demands of his clientele, he decided to become a member of the Loan Program of Soro Yiriwaso so as to have additional financial resources. This is his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, he intends to purchase 10 sheets of plywood, a table saw, 8 wooden planks, and four bags of nails. He buys his supplies in Bougouni and displays what he makes in a shed in front of his workshop. His customers are inhabitants of Bougouni and those who pass through buying goods for resale.

He expects to make a profit of about US$ 100 per month and with this profit, he will pay the interest on the loan and help his father with family living expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Koné Monsieur Ousmane Koné a 23 ans, marié et sans enfant il vit avec sa femme chez son père dans une famille élargie au quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni (Prefecture de Bougouni Régoin de Sikasso République du Mali ).

Il a appris cette activité auprès de son père qui fut un grand menuisier de la place. Avec une expérience de 8 ans, il jouit d’une notoriété et une grande réputation au niveau des habitants de la ville de Bougouni. Par conséquent il recoit beaucoup de commande de meubles et diverses réparations.

Pour satisfaire les demandes de plus en plus grandissantes de sa clientèle, il décida d’intégrer le Programme de Crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour obtenir des ressources financières additionnelles. Il est à son premier prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Avec ce prêt il compte achéter 10 feuilles de Contre - plaquets, une Scie en tournée, 8 Planches de bois et 4 Sachets de pointes. .Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et expose sa production sous un hangar devant son atelier. Ses clients sont les habitants de Bougouni et les forrains.

Il compte réaliser un bénéfice de 40 000FCFA par mois et avec ce bénéfice, il paiera les intérêts du prêt et aidera son père à assurer les dépenses de la famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of plywood, a saw, planks, and nails

Achat de Contre plaquets, de Scie de Planches et de Pointes.

loans.name: Claritas Group

texts.es:
The Claritas Group comes from a beautiful town that is situated in the mountains that surround Atitlán Lake. This is a very traditional town. Here, one can find the women walking through the streets wearing their traditional outfits and speaking Quiche, a Mayan language. The people from Santa Clara are friendly people and are respectful T. strangers.

Santa Clara is passing through an important time, especially for the women. For the last few years, the women in the community are being recognized as independent people that can make important economic decisions and be responsible for them. This attitude opens more doors for microfinance.

The members of Claritas are a group of incredible and warm women. They meet three times a week T. carry out their financial transactions with The Friendship Bridge.

The Claritas Group has been recognized by The Friendship Bridge as excellent clients. They continue working with a project for years, always repaying punctually and standing out as leaders within their communal banks. The success of this group is based on the fact that all of the members are very responsible and that they have confidence in each other. The members maintain that the money they earn is not T. be spent, but is T. be invested because only then will they get returns and generate profits.

Many of the clients that work in this communal bank invest their loan inT. bakeries. Santa Clara is known for the delicious bread that it produces. Some of the women make bread in their homes, then they bring the bread T. a neighboring village, San Juan la Laguna, and they sell it there. The interesting thing is that they put the bread inT. baskets that they carry on their heads and will sell it from house T. house! Other women work in the production of beaded belts. Also, there is a member who bought a dressmaking machine with her loans. Finally, there is a woman that breeds animals, such as chickens and pigs, for sale.

This is a special group, and we should accompany them on their journey and support them. With your support, you will be able T. give them the opportunity T. improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Las Claritas provienen de un bello pueblo que está ubicado en las montañas que rodean el mágico lago de Atitlán. Este pueblo es muy tradicional. En este se puede encontrar a todas las mujeres caminando por las calles vistiendo sus trajes tradicionales y hablando el maya- Quiche. Un aspecT. muy bueno de los Santa Clareños es que son gente amigables y respetuosos con los extranjeros.

Santa Clara está pasando por un momenT. importante, especialmente para las mujeres. Desde hace unos años atrás, las mujeres dentro de la comunidad, están siendo reconocidas como personas indepedientes que pueden tomar decisiones económicas importantes y ser responsable de ellas. Para nuestro beneficio esa actitud le abre más puertas al micro- crédiT..

Las Claritas son un grupo de mujeres increíbles, en lo personal me quedé impresionado cuando entré al cuarT. donde este grupo de señoras se reunen tres veces por semana para efectuar sus transacciones financieras con The Friendship Bridge. Desde que llegué al cuarT. ellas fueron muy cálidas conmigo, fue una experiencia muy agradable.

Las Claritas han sido reconocidas por The Friendship Bridge como clientas de excelencia. Ellas llevan trabajando con el proyecT. por años, siempre pagando puntualmente y destacándose como lideres dentro de sus bancos comunales. El éxiT. de este grupo se base en que todas las clientes son muy responsables y se tienen confianza entre ellas. Durante la reunión le pregunte a una cliente sobre sus decisiones con respecT. al dinero y ella respondió que “el dinero no se gasta, solo se invierte porque sino no da vuelta y no se genera ganancia”

Un gran número de clientas que trabajan en este banco comunal invierten su crédiT. en panaderías. Santa Clara es conocido por el delicioso pan que produce. Algunas de las señoras producen el pan en sus casas, luego se lo llevan en un carro a la aldea aledaña, San Juan la Laguna, y lo van a vender ahí. Lo interesante es que ponen el pan en canastos que lo cargan en la cabeza y van a vender de casa en casa! Otras señoras trabajan en la elaboración de fajas de mostacilla. También hay una clienta que con sus préstamos se pudo comprar una máquina de confección. Finalmente, hay una señora que cría animales, pollos y cerdos para su venta.

Este grupo es especial y creo que debemos acompañarlos y apoyarlos, y ustedes con su apoyo van a poder darle la oportunidad de superarse.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a bakery, beads, animal feed, and fabric for dressmaking

loans.name: Mwaka's Tunatumai Group

texts.en:
Mwaka is 27 years old. She is married with 2 children; one is four years old and the other is three. She has been an embroidery and bed sheet seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 7:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Mwaka now requests a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with tailoring and shoe sales, bites (snacks) sales, clothes sales, juice sales, and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Casilda Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Casilda Yanet L. A. tiene treintainueve años y vive en la calle Soledad 108 del distrito de Mache en la provincia de Otuzco en el departamento de La  Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta el tercer año de educación secundaria, pero por falta de medios económicos sus padres ya no pudieron apoyarla para seguir estudiando.
Casilda Yanet se casó de 18 años con el señor Walter Miro López Rodríguez y tiene dos hijas que aun son estudiantes.
Tiene una bodega en su casa, pero también compra y vende queso quesillo,  carne de carnero y cerdo, la carne y el queso o quesillo los  vende en los mercados de Trujillo.
Recuerda con gratitud que la primera entidad de la cual obtuvo su primer préstamo fue de Manuela Ramos y fue de 300 soles, con lo que compró queso, quesillo y artículos para su bodega.
Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará quesillo y artículos de primera necesidad para su bodega.
Casilda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache desde hace aproximadamente siete años, en los que aprendió a administrar su negocio y a tomar sus propias decisiones.
Sueña con tener una linda casa propia en Trujillo donde estudia una de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Casilda Yanet L. A. is thirty nine years old and lives at 108 Soledad in the district of Mache of the province of Otuzco, in the region of La Libertad in Peru.

She attended high school until her 3rd year in high school but due to a lack of financial resources her parents were no longer able to support her to continue going to school.

Casilda Yanet was married when she was 18 years old with her husband Walter Miro Lopez Rodriguez and they have two daughters who are still in school.

She runs a small grocery store from her home but she also buys and sells fresh cheeses, beef and pork meats, all of which she sells in the markets of Trujillo.

She recalls with gratitude the first time when she received a loan from Manuel Ramos and it was for the sum of 300 soles with which she purchase cheeses and other articles for her grocery store.

This loan, amounting to 3000 soles, will be repaid in a term of 4 months and the funds will be used to purchase cheeses and staple items for her grocery store.

Casilda belongs to the Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache community bank and she has been a member for about 7 years, and in her experience she learned how to manage her business and make her own decisions.

She dreams of having her own beautiful home in the city of Trujillo where one of her daughters goes to school.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Hedy

texts.es: Hedy, a sus 23 años ha quedado viuda, con una niña de 8 meses, ahora está viviendo con su madre, que le apoya en este negocio del restaurante. Años atrás se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero dejó porque hay temporadas donde no es rentable, desde entonces, abastece de comida a los transeúntes del puente llamando Paucartambo. Trabaja en sociedad con su madre, para de ese modo puedan aliviarse el trabajo de todo el día desde; el desayuno, almuerzo y cena, se tiene que levantar a las 4 de la mañana y dormir a las 11 de la noche, por lo que terminan el día, muy cansadas.  Una de las mayores dificultades es el alza en el precio del pollo, ya que no pueden elevar el precio del menú, porque no tendría clientes y se quedarían con la comida preparada, por ello, se limitan a preparar de 10 a 20 platos, ganando casi, el 50% de su inversión.  Al quedarse sola, tiene que trabajar para la alimentación y vestimenta de su hija, y para ofrecerle un futuro próspero, cuando tenga necesidades de educación. Tiene en mente, invertir en la compra de vidrios para sus mesas, asimismo comprar un par de mesas, para darles comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hedy is a 23 year old widow with an 8 month old daughter. She is living with her mother who helps her with her business, a restaurant. She used to be a farmer but she gave it up because the seasons were not profitable enough. Since then, she has prepared food for people traveling over the Paucartambo bridge. Her mother helps her with the daily duties which include making breakfast, lunch, and dinner. They wake up at 4:00 a.m., go to bed at 11:00 p.m. and are very tired when their day ends. One of the biggest difficulties is the rise in cost of chicken because if they raised the menu prices, they would have no customers and would be left with the extra meals. Consequently, they only prepare 10 to 20 plates per day, earning back 50% of their investment. As a single woman, Hedy has to work in order to provide food and clothing to her daughter, and to offer her a prosperous future that includes the necessities for an education. With this loan, she thinks she will invest in glasses and new tables to provide more comfort for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables for her restaurant in order to improve its atmosphere

loans.name: Aura Adilia

texts.es: La Señora Aura Adilia está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 6to crédito con AFODENIC para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda para terminar de repellar su casa y hecharle el piso a la cocina, trabaja como docente desde hace 7 años, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 12 años estudia su 6to grado de educación primaria, la otra niña tiene 6 añitos estudia su 1er grado y una bebe de 6 meses, su esposo es agricultor, trabaja cultivando la tierra en la finca en colonia San Antonio, ambos comparten los gastos del hogar.  Aura Adilia se caracteriza por ser una docente  responsable con sus deberes en su trabajo y en el hogar es por eso que es muy querida en su colonia por ser una mujer que ha demostrado ser humilde pero muy trabajadora  y muy querida  por sus alumnos y padres de familia, ella vive en la colonia San Antonio a 15 km de Nueva Guinea, esta clienta acaba de terminar de estudiar una licenciatura en ciencias de la Educación en la Universidad URACCAN Recinto Nueva Guinea. Ella se siente agradecida con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha comprado electrodomésticos y a mejorado la vivienda donde ella vive, su sueño es  tener salud y estabilidad laboral.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aura Adilia is requesting refinancing for her sixth loan with Afodenic in order to improve her home and install flooring in her kitchen. She has been working as a teacher for the past seven years, and she has three children. The oldest one is 12 years old and is currently in sixth grade, the second one is 6 years old and she is studying in first grade, and the youngest one is 6 months old. Her husband works as a farmer in the San Antonio farm, and both of them contribute to the household expenses. Aura Adilia is very responsible with her duties both at work and at home, and that is why she is well liked in her neighborhood. She has been shown to be a humble and hardworking person, very loved by her students and family. She lives in the San Antonio farm, 15 kms from Nueva Guinea, and she just finished her Education studies in the University URACCAN in the Nueva Guinea precint. She is very thankful for the loans that she has received through Afodenic since those have allowed her to buy appliances and improve her home. Her dream is to be in good health and have job security.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cereceda, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her home and install flooring in her kitchen.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Mrs.Yi T. is a married  35-year-old woman that grows rice and raises pigs to earn a living. Her husband is Ngeng Vanna, age 38, who works on the farm along with his wife. They are the parents of two children and live in the Kompong Cham Province. Yi's goal is to provide her children with a higher education. She has applied for a loan to purchase more piglets, feed, and a cow for her family's business activities.(The picture shows Yi's husband because she was not available)

loans.use: To purchase more piglets, feed, and a cow.

loans.name: M/mpya E Group

texts.en:
Witness runs a small charcoal store and sells clothes in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma, which she has done for three years now. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. She currently earns an average monthly profit of 370 USD. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal and clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money.

Witness is 40 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 10 and 15. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Elizabeth, Mary, and Shukrani. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria N. is a 35-year-old woman. She is married but has no children. She lives with her husband in her matrimonial home in Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Victoria is an achiever and a resourceful woman. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living.

Victoria has traded in bananas in Abofour market for more than 20 years. She treks to surrounding villages in the central part of Ghana to purchase bulk stocks of bananas from the farmers and retails them to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick enough stock to make enough profit to support her family. Victoria will buy the unripe bananas in bulk, and she will cover them with plantain leaves in the bush. She leaves them for a while so when they are ripe she will sell them to her customers.

With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk supplies of bananas to enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her business growth. Victoria belongs to a village bank called Isaac. She hopes to receive GH500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To purchase bulk supplies of bananas

loans.name: Tat

texts.en:
R. is 48 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. She has three children: one is single and works as a local construction worker, and the other two are married and live separately. R. is married to Run, 49, who is a local palm climber.

R. is well-known for being a responsible mother and neighbor; she works hard. The villagers always come to her field to buy her vegetables because R. doesn't use any chemical fertilizer in her field. And so she had gained better savings.

Recently, R. is looking for a loan of US$ 1000 to buy a motor for her and her family. The loan will help the family have more updated living standards. R. was not available for the photograph so her husband is in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy a motor for her and her family

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr: Tchotcho K. est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est commerçante de légumes et fruits au marché d’Atakpamé. Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, Tchotcho espère avec ce crédit acheter des marchandises pour la revente. Cette opportunité lui permettra de gagner plus d’argent pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Tchotcho K., age 43, is married and the mother of four. She is a merchant of vegetables and fruit at the Atakpamé market. To expand her business and to respond better to the needs of her customers, Tchotcho hopes to use this loan to buy merchandise for resale. This opportunity will enable her to earn more money, so as to provide for her children’s needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a vender desayunos en una avenida principal cercana a su casa, comenzó vendiendo con un balde grande provisto de vasos; en la actualidad, cuenta con un carrito que le permite transportar sus desayunos. Erika vende todas las mañanas y todos los días de la semana, sus clientes son principalmente obreros y viajeros  que  se detienen en el lugar. Con el paso de los años Erika ha visto la creciente  demanda de su comida, y eso garantiza que tenga ganancias de su trabajo. Cada 15 días compra al por mayor sus ingredientes, para ello viaja a la ciudad de Lima para que sea menor su inversión. Para el futuro, Erika tiene grandes proyecciones para su negocio, quiere agrandar su carrito de ventas y tener otro puesto. Es la segunda vez que participa en un banco comunal, el cual sufrió dificultades, pero que ya se han superado, ella se siente orgullosa de ser parte de la solución y no del problema. Con el dinero que solicita comprará víveres para la preparación de desayunos; comprará sacos de quinua, maca; bidones de aceite y un balón de gas para cocinar.
texts.en:
Erika, 31, lives with her husband and children in a rented house. For 10 years she has sold breakfast on a main avenue close to her house. She started selling with a large bucket and glasses. Now she has a cart which allows her to transport her breakfasts. Erika sells every morning and every day of the week. Her customers are primarily workers and travelers who stop in the area. As the years have passed Erika has seen the demand for her food grow. This guarantees that she will have earnings from her work. Every 15 days she buys her ingredients wholesale. To do this she travels to Lima in order to spend less. In the future Erika has big plans for her business. She wants to enlarge her cart and have another stand. This is the second time that she has participated in a community bank. The bank had problems, but they overcome them. She is proud to be part of the solution and not the problem. With the loan she will buy supplies to use in the preparation of the breakfasts. She will buy sacks of quinua and maca (grains); oil drums; and a canister of gas to use while cooking.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients for her meals

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa G., 37 ans, est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de tissus, chaussures, parfums et divers accessoires. Elle souhaiterait améliorer ce commerce afin de pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa G., age 37, is married and the mother of four. She is active in the commerce of cloth, shoes, perfumes, and various accessories. She would like to improve this business in order to be able to improve her family’s situation regarding health and schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in cloth, shoes, perfumes, and various accessories

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Рахимбердиев Азимжон- мужчина 32 лет. Женат отец  4-х детей. Азимжон занимается откормом и перепродажей скота. Скот Азимжон покупает с Киргизии. Ему помогают  дети  Азимчон, раньше был, чабаном имеет 10-летный стаж в сфере скотоводства, и он очень любить животных. На полученный займ он хочет расширить своё стадо, купив овец. Жена Азимджона занимается переработкой пряжи.
texts.en:
Azimjon R. is 32 year old, married and a father of four children. He is involved in livestock feeding and sales. Azimjon brings the livestock from Kyrgyzstan. His children help him with the business. Azimjon used to be a shepherd and has a 10-year experience in the animal husbandry field. He loves animals. He wants to use this loan to grow his herd by buying sheep. Azimjon’s wife is involved in yarn processing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sheep

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth tiene 41 años, vive con su esposo, el cual es obrero textil, y con sus hijos; Luis de 15, María Elena de 14 y Flavio de 5. Desde hace 5 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de polos, empieza su jornada diaria después de enviar a sus hijos al colegio y darse un tiempo para la elaboración de los alimentos para el almuerzo. Después de esto empieza con la confección de las prendas, que usualmente dura hasta altas horas de la noche, ya que es ahí donde puede trabajar más tranquila, debido a que descansa de las labores del hogar. Felizmente su trabajo trae frutos, ya que los pedidos son muchos, obteniendo muy buenos ingresos económicos, de los cuales siempre guarda una parte para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. En el futuro le gustaría tener un taller grande para incrementar su producción y por ende sus ingresos económicos, y así brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Elizabeth regresa después de una temporada a Microfinanzas Prisma, ya que anteriormente estuvo más abocada a su familia, pero ahora que regresó con fuerza a su negocio solicita este préstamo para implementarlo comprando telas, hijos, entre otros materiales para dar a sus polos acabados mucho más novedosos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41. She lives with her husband, a textile worker, and her children; Luis is 15, María Elena is 14, and Flavio is 5. She has worked with her husband for five years making and selling polo shirts. She starts her work day after sending her children to school and taking some time to make the food for lunch. Afterward, she starts making the clothes. This usually lasts until late at night. That is when she can work more peacefully because she can rest from the housework. Happily, her work bears fruit. There have been many orders which give them very good earnings. She always takes a part of the earnings to invest in her business. In the future she would like to have a big shop to increase production and income. This way they can give their family a better quality of life. Elizabeth returned from spending some time at Microfinanzas Prisma. Previously she was more wrapped up in her family, but now she has returned with vigor to her business. The loan is to buy fabric and needles among other materials to make her finished polo shirts much more original.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make clothes

loans.name: Esmina

texts.en:
Esmina M., born in 1964, lives with her husband, son and daughter in Stupari, near Kladanj where they all operate a family business for the production of charcoal for the grill. Additionally, Esmina`s husband owns a truck and provides transport services, while Esimna has a cow and sells the milk and milk products. They have been in this business a long time and used earnings from it to build their house.

Esmina has requested her first loan from WWI ( Žene za Žene International ) in the amount of 3000 KM to purchase wood for the production of charcoal. They hope to keep this business operating as it provides jobs for the family.

loans.use: Acquisition of wood for the production of charcoal for the grill.

loans.name: Santos Aida

texts.es: Santos Aida R. B. reside en el municipio de Armenia en el departamento de Sonsonate. Aida es madre de tres hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad independientes económicamente pero ayudan a su madre con 200$ mensuales, dinero el cual Aida administra muy bien ya que es el único ingreso estable económico, es por ello que Aida se decidió a abrir su propio negocio y es así como inicio su venta de pupusas  en su casa, tiene una clientela muy estable y su demanda va incrementando poco a poco es por ello que solita este crédito para compra de materia prima para sus pupusas.
texts.en:
Santos Aida R. B. lives in the town of Armenia in the Sonsonate district. Aida is the mother of three adult children who support themselves financially. They help their mother by providing her $200 monthly, which Aida manages very well since it is her only stable source of income.

For this reason, Aida decided to open her own business selling “pupusas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) from her home. She has a very stable customer base and demand for her product is growing little by little. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for making pupusas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
