      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Хафиза - женщина средних лет, ей 39 лет. Она замужем и мать 4-х детей. Хафиза вместе с мужем занимаются производством и продажей национальных лепешек. Её муж печет дома лепешки а Хафиза продает их на базаре и принимает заказы от потенциальных клиентов. Хафизе и мужу помогают дети. Из дома до рынка лепешки отвозит их старший сын, а продавать лепешки помогает дочь. У детей сейчас летние каникулы, поэтому Хафизе и мужу легче. Хафиза и её муж хотят закупить парию муки примерно 25-30 мешков. Для этого Хафиза просит займ в размере 2500 сомони.
texts.en:
Hafiza is a middle-aged woman. She is 39 years old, married and is a mother of 4 children. Hafiza and her husband are involved in making and selling traditional flatbread. Her husband bakes the flatbread at home, and Hafiza sells it at a market and accepts orders from potential customers. Their children help Hafiza and her husband with the business. Their oldest son drives them from home to the market, and their daughter helps sell the flatbread. Now that the children are on their summer break, things are easier for Hafiza and her husband. Hafiza and her husband want to buy a stock of flour, consisting of approximately 25-30 bags. This is why Hafiza is requesting a loan in the sum of 2500 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour

loans.name: Primero De Mayo_Jovenes Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “Villa Tejada” se encuentra un grupo de jóvenes que se denominan “Primero de Mayo_Jóvenes”, todos tienen sus propios negocios, por ejemplo Edwin tiene el negocio de tapicería, él necesita el préstamo para  comprar materia prima como el tapiz y seguir trabajando, los demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de cuadernos, chompas y gasolina. Todos estos jóvenes estudian en diferentes lugares, apoyándose económicamente con los ingresos que generan sus negocios.
texts.en:
In Villa Tejada you will find a group of teenagers who belong to an organization called "Primero de Mayo Jovenes". Each of the members has his or her own business. For example, Edwin has an upholstery business and needs a loan to purchase materials such as fabric. The other members have various businesses, such as selling office supplies and fuel. The members of this group continue with their studying at various schools, using the money they make from their businesses to support their education.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies for their respective businesses.  The money they earn helps pay for their education.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou T. evolue dans la vente de produits cosmetiques depuis 1997.elle est parent beneficiaire habitant le quartier de camberene qui contribue beaucoup a l'amelioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.a cause de la forte demande a laquelle elle fait face elle sollicite un credit de cinquante mille(50 000)frs pour qugmenter son capital et renforcer son stock.
texts.en:
Fatou T. has sold cosmetics since 1997. She is a UIMCEC client living in Camberene who contributes a lot to the improvement of her family’s living conditions. Due to high demand, she is requesting a 50,000 franc loan to increase her capital and build up her stock.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her capital and stock

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Monsieur Kokouvi habite le quartier de Sanguéra à Lomé. Il est marié et a 02 enfants à sa charge. Il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente d’articles d’électricité et de plomberie dans une boutique qu’il a louée. Il exerce cette activité depuis 2007. Cette vente lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.  Il effectue ses achats au Ghana, le pays voisin. Actuellement sa boutique est très bien connue de beaucoup de plombiers et d’électriciens, et même des particuliers. Il vend ses articles en gros et en détail. C’est pour renouveler son stock en état d’épuisement qu’il sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour commander des tuyaux de différentes formes ainsi que des fils électriques, des ampoules, des interrupteurs, des prises électriques et bien d’autres articles importants.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokouvi lives in the Sanguéra district in Lomé.  He is married and has two children in his care.  His income-generating work involves selling electrical and plumbing supplies in his store, which he leased.  He has been in this business since 2007.  His sales enable him to provide for his family.  He makes his purchase in Ghana, the neighboring country.  Currently, his store is very well-known by many plumbers and electricians, and even by private individuals.  He sells his goods wholesale and retail.  To renew his exhausted inventory, he's requesting a WAGES loan to order pipes of different sizes, as well as electrical wire, light bulbs, circuit breakers, electrical plugs, and many other important items. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plumbing and electrical supplies

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena O., 52 years old, is a rice grower. She owns and manages a small rice field, which is nearly 1 hectare (2.5 acres) in size, to support herself and her siblings. She didn't marry anyone and focuses her attention on her business instead.

Magdalena would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to grow her harvest by purchasing farming necessities. In that way she will be able to better support her needs and the needs of her nieces.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Toulassi

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants. Depuis que son mari a eu sa retraite, il est difficile pour le couple d’assurer l’éducation scolaire de leurs enfants ; c’est pour cette raison que cette dame s’est lancée en 2002 dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale devant sa maison dans le quartier de Bè Kamalado à Lomé. Avec cette activité, elle arrive à apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer. Son voisinage apprécie en tout temps le bon accueil qu’elle a toujours su réserver à tous ses clients. Elle compte dans l’avenir agrandir plus son commerce en vendant de l’eau minérale, de l’eau de javel et des savons en poudre pour la lessive. Mais en ce moment elle a un besoin urgent de renouveler son stock ; pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 sacs de riz, 10 cartons de sardines, 10 cartons de tomates en boîte, 15 cartons de pâtes alimentaires macaroni.

loans.use: Achat des produitrs d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr: D. Pauline est née le 28 Décembre 1971 à Comè, dans le Département du Mono. Pauline est mariée à AGBOTON Paul, un photographe. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés. La famille vit à Kowégbo à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. C'est le mari de Pauline qui assure les charges de la famille. Pauline utilise alors les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. En effet, Pauline vend des divers (boîtes de tomate, lait, sucre, sardines; des pâtes alimentaires; des biscuits, des savons; de l'huile végétale; etc.). C'est devant son domicile que Pauline vend ses produits. Mais Pauline fait ses achats à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Pauline a eu déjà un crédit de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursé. Aujourd'hui, Pauline sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
D. Pauline was born on December 28, 1971 in Comè, in Mono County. She is married to AGBOTON Paul, a photographer. The couple has five children who are all in school. The family lives in Kowégbo in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Pauline’s husband is the one who ensures that family expenses are covered. So Pauline uses her revenues for developing her business further. Basically, she sells a variety of goods (canned tomatoes, milk, sugar, sardine, pasta, cookies, soap, vegetable oil, etc.) She does so in front of her home. She purchases her goods in Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. Pauline has had an ALIDé loan before, which she has repaid. Today, she’s requesting this second loan to respond better to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned tomatoes, milk, sugar, sardine, pasta, cookies, soap, vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El socio Guido, pertenece al banco “ALLIN MUJU”; este banco se encuentra en la ciudad del Cusco en el distrito de Huanchac.

Nuestro socio tiene 18 años de edad, el está conviviendo con su novia, y tienen un hijo, nuestro socio es cobrador de servicios de transporte urbano, el trabaja en Cusco de boletero, el socio el préstamo para poder invertir en sus estudios


Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Member Guido belongs to the Allin Muju bank. This bank can be found in the city of Cusco in the district of Huanchac. Our member is 18 years old. He lives with his fiance and they have one child. Our member is a collector for urban transport services. He works in Cusco as a cashier. He will use to loan to invest in his education. Our member is thankful for and values the loan granted to him in this manner. At the same time, he promises to make his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his education.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson G. R., tiene la edad de 20 años, es soltero y vive con sus padres y 4 hermanso. El quiere comprar de abono y asistencia de cafe para tener una mejor cosecha. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a su finca y su familia quiere crecer. La familia no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Él también tiene el deseo de mejorar la calidad y así generar mas ingresos, para una mejor calidad de vida de su familia. 
About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Wilson G. R. is 20, single, and he lives with his parents and his four siblings. He wants to buy fertilizer and cover coffee expenses to have a better harvest. He has been devoted to his farm for four years, and his family wants it to grow. The family has not had problems with the property, but they do have the desire for it to be a productive farm. This is the first loan he has received from Fudecosur. Fudecosur offered the simplest loan, and the interest rate is much lower. He also has the desire to improve the quality and generate more income in order to improve his family’s quality of life. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, coffee expenses

loans.name: Rashidatu

texts.en:
Rashidatu is a trader who deals in groceries and foodstuffs. She started this business nine years ago and she has been doing well since then. She is 30 years of age and married with three children.

Rashidatu says the only problem she is facing presently is a lack of sufficient capital to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She believes that having a large quantity of foodstuffs will increase her sales since the demand for foodstuffs is high.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Ramón tiene 26 años de edad, vive en concubinato con la Sra. Sandra Miranda, no tienen hijos, viven en un barrio muy conocido de la ciudad de Itá. 

 En el centro de la ciudad alquila un salón donde comercializa teléfonos celulares, carcasas, estuches y realiza servicios de reparación, además vende auto radios, parlantes, Twister, cornetas, cajas y realiza equipamiento de vehículos hace 3 años.  

El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de mas artículos para equipamiento de vehículos y celulares, en esta ocasión desea realizar sus compras de Ciudad del Este ya que allí estos artículos tienen un costo muy bajo lo cual le generará mayor margen de ganancia en sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ramón, 26, lives with Sandra Miranda. They do not have children. They live in a well known neighborhood in the city of Itá. He rents a space in the center of the city where he sells cell phones, covers, and cases; and he provides repair services. He also sells car radios, speakers, horns, and gearboxes. He has been equipping vehicles for three years. The loan he is asking for is to buy more items to equip vehicles and cell phones. This time he wants to make his purchases in the Ciudad del Este because these items are much cheaper there. That will generate a greater margin of earnings in his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cell phones and equipment for radios

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
El Sr. Christian es casado y su actividad del cliente es el servicio de transporte urbano de pasajeros radio taxi, actividad que desarrolla todos los dias, esta se constituye en la principal fuente de ingreso para su familia, que esta compuesta por sus tres hijos y su esposa quien tambien ayuda a su hogar  realizando pequeñas bolsas a macrame que despues las vende.

El destino del credito sera principalmente para el reacondicionamiento de su vehiculo, compra de llantas, cremallera, cambio de juntas omocineticas, rodamientos y otras reparaciones menores, para asi de esta manera tener su auto en optimas condiciones para desarrollar su trabajo.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Christian is married. His activity as a client is urban passenger transport via radio taxi. He does this every day and it is the main source of income for his family. His family is made up of his three children and his wife who also helps her household by making small macrame purses which she later sells. The loan is mainly to be for the re-conditioning of his vehicle. It will be for the purchase of tires, a rack, homokinetic joints, bearings, and other minor repairs. He will then be able to keep the car in optimal condition to carry out his work. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: REPAIR OF VEHICLE, PURCHASE OF TIRES, RACK

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia H. is from the village of Tinago in Ozamiz City in the province of Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Letecia is married and has five school-age children. To make a living, Letecia owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to local community members. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over five years, and she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase another transport vehicle for the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family members.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren makes wooden products. He started this business in 1995. Besides his wooden product making business, he started a transportation service in 2008. He transports people's baggage and luggage throughout his province. Lhagvasuren is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in Arhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a Mongolian traditional tent called a ger. His 9-year-old and 17-year-old sons attend the local secondary school and his youngest, age 8, is in kindergarten. Lhagvasuren is planning to maintain and continue his business. He is a very open-minded and hardworking businessman. He says, “I want to start a block manufacturing business in the near future. I made some calculations and realize that it could be a very profitable business in Mongolia.” He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of wood for his wooden product making business.

loans.use: To purchase wood for wooden products

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
Airene E. is the mother of two children, aged six months and five years old. 

Airene’s husband is very supportive of her every endeavor, especially in growing her fish-selling business. Therefore, when Airene shared with her husband her plan to rent a stall in the public market to acquire more customers and increase profits from selling fish, her husband supported her decision to request a loan for a much larger amount. 

Airene hopes that through Kiva, private individuals all over the world will extend their benevolent support to improve her business so that her family will be raised out of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a huge volume of fish for re-sale in the local market

loans.name: Sokroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokroeun S. was born in 1959. She is married to Mr. Soeurn Sem. They have five children, two of whom are construction workers, another does farming and the others are attending a local public school. This family lives in Thmei village in the Takeo Province. 

Mrs. Sokroeun S. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice to support her family. Her husband is a cow middleman who can earn a little profit to support his children. However, he does not make enough to reinvest in his business. Thus, Mrs. Sokroeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for re-selling.

loans.use: To buy two cows for re-selling

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Señora Elizabeth se dedica a la compra de productos como semillas, granos, comida balaceada, harina de yuca y papa al por mayor, su trabajo se inicia dividiendo  junto con una balanza y empaquetando pequeños paquetes de comida para aves de 250 y 500 gramos mezclando las semilla y  granos o tambien comida balanceada, y despues se los comercializa en su puesto de venta,  adicionalmente entrega paquetes de harina de yuca y papa del mismo peso, estos productos son entregados por pedido cada 15 dias en los supermercados de la ciudad, los mismos que le solicitaron que elabore paquetes de refrescos organicos (PITO) de quinua, amaranto, cebada y otros  para los meses que vienen y es por eso que la señora solicita este credito ya que necesita un capital a parte para comprar estos pitos, los pitos son harinas de maiz cebada, haba que se usan muchos de estos productos  como dieta diaria en muchos hogares de muestro Pais. La Sra. Elizabeth esta muy agradecida con emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Elizabeth buys wholesale products such as seeds, grains, bird feed, yuca and potato flour. Her work begins by dividing the products into portions using scales and making small packets of bird food: 250 and 500 grammes of mixed seeds, grains or bird feed. Then she sells them from her stall. She also weighs out the same size packs of yuca and potatoes. These products are delivered to order every fortnight to the town's supermarkets. These same supermarkets are also asking her to make up packets of organic quinoa, amaranth, barley and other things for the coming months. This is why the lady is asking for this loan as she needs money to buy these things. She needs corn and barley flour and broad beans. Thes products form the basis of the daily diet in many homes throughout the country. Mrs. Elizabeth is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting her by giving her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson B. is 35 years old and married to Leah Jepkorir. They have four children who are all in school. He lives in the Kipyeshi area of Kaiboi. 

Wilson does maize, vegetable, and dairy farming and sells the milk in the western area of Kenya which is 30 km from his farm.

Wilson was introduced to KADET by staff members who were conducting a marketing promotion in his area. He has borrowed money which will be used to prepare his six acres of land to plant maize during planting season, and to grow more horticultural crops using the water irrigation system during the dry season when demand for green vegetables is high.

He hopes his harvest will allow him to become financially independent.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and improve his dairy farm.

loans.name: Milka Jepchumba

texts.en:
Milka is a 49 year old woman, married to Moses Kelwon, a 55 year old farmer. They live in Kaprogonya and have six children: Victor (28 yrs), Philemon (14 yrs), Caleb (12 yrs), Esther (8 yrs), Deborah (6 yrs) and Hilda (5 yrs).

Milka sells clothes. She started this business a year ago and it yields a profit of KES 2000 every month. Her salary brings in an income of KES 14,000. She has borrowed a loan of KES 15,000 form KADET. She plans to use this loan to add more stock. A client of KADET introduced her to KADET.
Milka does her business in Kabarnet Town. Her clients are mostly women and children. If her loan boosts her business she will plough back the extra profit to expand her business. As someone who loves her business, Milka dreams and hopes to get more capital to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the business.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Los sueños de Bertha son construir una hermosa casa para sus hijas y brindarles la mejora educación. Bertha es soltera, tiene 2 hijas que están estudiando, viven en casa alquilada, Bertha viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región a donde lleva verduras y frutas, mientras que de las ferias compra cereales, animales menores, productos que comercializa de casa en casa y al crédito.
Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua y necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, maíz, quinua.
texts.en:
Bertha’s dreams are to build a beautiful house for her daughters and to offer them the best education. Bertha is single, has 2 daughters who are students, and they live in a rented house. She travels to different markets in the region where she sells vegetables, and fruit. While she’s at the markets, she buys cereals, and young animals that she sells from house to house on credit. Bertha is a member of the Communal Bank Llapanchik that means “Everyone” in Quechua. She needs a loan of 3000 sols to buy wheat, barley, corn and quinoa.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy apples, bananas, wheat, barley, corn and quinoa

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
El Señor Jorge M. C. 55 años de edad, es separado y es padre de 4 hijos de los cuales uno vive y es dependiente de él, al cual cría y ayuda en su educación, la madre de sus hijos lo abandono y se concubino con otra persona ya como 10 años de eso, él vive en Ivirgarzama con su hijo.
  
Jorge M. C. es un señor muy dedicado a su trabajo, tiene un lote agrícola  pequeño en el Sindicato Cerro Verde que está a 20 Km de la carretera Cbba.- Sta. Cruz, Quinta sección, el cultiva mandarina, naranja plátano palmito y otros cultivos, el cliente trabaja diariamente para el sustento de su hijo para que en un futuro próximo el siga con el cultivo de los productos que el produce. 

Joaquín se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para un reintegro para la compra de un vehículo para así poder facilitar el transporte de sus productos e incrementar la producción de cítricos y así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de su hijo y un futuro mejor para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge M. C. is 55 years old, separated from his spouse, and the father of four children. One child still lives with him and is a dependent, so Jorge raises him and helps with his education. The mother of his children abandoned them ten years ago when she became involved with someone else. Jorge and his son live in Ivirgarzama.

Jorge is very dedicated to his work. He has a small plot of farmland in the neighborhood of Cerro Verde, Quinta section, which is 20 kilometers away from the Cochabamba-Santa Cruz Highway. He grows tangerines, oranges, bananas, hearts of palm, and other crops. Jorge works every day to support his son so that in the near future, he can take over growing the crops that he produces.

Jorge visited the offices of CIDRE to apply for a loan in order to buy a vehicle to help transport his products and increase his production of citrus fruits. This will enable him to earn more income for the welfare of his son and a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle to transport his goods

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
42-year-old Evelyn D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is married and has two school-aged children. She is involved in farming. She tills her land for rice crops and sells her harvest in her town's local market. She also grows hogs for fattening and sale. She plans to have all her children finish college and find appropriate jobs for themselves.

Evelyn joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and feed for the pigs. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Evelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Melcer Achieng

texts.en:
Melcer Achieng Wesonga is 25 years old and married to Samson Wesonga. They live in the Ranen area in the outskirts of Migori town. They have three children: Elisha, 9; Judy, 6; and Emily, 5.

Melcer is a well-known tailor in her neighborhood as she is known for making the latest good fashions for men, women and children. She has a scarcity of materials and is applying for 25,000 Kenyan shillings to enable her add more materials and meet the demands of her clients. She also wants to buy another sewing machine to enable her to work more efficiently as the one she is using is old. This is the second loan she will be accessing from Kadet Ltd. after successfully paying the first loan.

She hopes to open a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: To buy more materials to add to her stock

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna O. is a 33-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store  business.  She lives in Prk 2, Brgy. Carabalan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her  general store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. 

Rosanna is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can have additional working capital for her general store.  This will be her 27th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosanna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: supplies

loans.name: Paul Michael

texts.es:
Paul tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Caín. Una zona urbano marginal situada en el distrito de Guadalupe, perteneciente a la provincia de Pacasamayo, ubicado en la región La Libertad, a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de alfalfa (forraje utilizado en la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y caprino), el vende este producto en el mercado de la ciudad de Guadalupe y se vale de una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros) para transportarlo y venderlo. Por las tardes utiliza este vehículo para brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros dentro del distrito de Guadalupe.

Actualmente sus unidad movil presenta algunas fallas producto del excesivo uso y del mal estado de algunos caminos que recorre diariamente. Estas fallas requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Para realizar esta acción Paul ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Paul es un joven activo y responsable. Sus amigos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima. En el mercado sus clientes le prefieren debido a que siempre brinda un trato amable y servicial.
texts.en:
Paul, 26, is single and lives with his parents in the Caín neighborhood. This is an urban neighborhood in the outskirts of the Guadalupe district. It is in the Pacasamayo province, located in the La Libertad region, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He sells alfalfa (forage used in raising cows, sheep and goats.) He sells this product in the market in the city of Guadalupe using a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle attached to a cab that is used to transport people and cargo) to transport and sell the alfalfa. In the afternoons, he uses this vehicle to provide passenger transportation services within the Guadalupe district. Now his vehicle is having some mechanical problems due to its heavy usage and the bad state of the roads where he drives it daily. These problems require urgent repair to guarantee its proper functioning. To do this, Paul has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles. Paul is an active and responsible youth. His friends and acquaintances hold him in high esteem. In the market, his customers prefer his business because he always provides them with friendly and helpful service.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for expenses to repair and maintain his mototaxi

loans.name: Vivitz Grace

texts.en:
Vivitz Grace R. is from the city of Dipolog City.  She is 35 years old.  Vivitz Grace is married and has three school-aged children.  To make a living, Vivitz Grace owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from baking and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community.  Vivitz Grace has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Vivitz Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Vivitz Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients.  This loan will be the first loan taken out by Vivitz Grace from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Never Give Up Group-Mukono

texts.en: K. Bruno, 40, belongs to Never give up group-Mukono. He is a happily married father of two. Self-interest drove him to begin his commercial motorcycle business in Nabuti four years ago. Before that, he was running a beauty salon. His weekly profits now total up to 60,000 UGX. Bruno wants to buy another motorcycle with his loan and his savings from previous loans.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Amistad Por Siempre Group

texts.es:
El banco D. Emprendimiento "AMISTAD POR SIEMPRE  " es un grupo  que se encuentra en su 6º   ciclo   , el cual demostraron ser  personas responsables, puntuales  y trabajadoras, este grupo esta representada por las siguientes socias: como Presidenta esta la Sra. Rosa  quien es la líder y fundadora del grupo, tiene el negocio D. venta D. sandalias en el Mercado los días Miércoles y Sábados,   es casada  y tiene 2 hijos los cuales ya están casados, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería en sandalias y así poder incrementar su capital D. trabajo. Como Secretaria esta la Srta. Karina quien  es soltera  y no tiene  hijos  y su negocio es la venta D. desayunos en el mercado solo por las mañanas, el dinero del crédito lo utilizaran en la compra D. una cocina,  y la Tesorera  es la Sra. Juana   quien es viuda   y   tiene 2  hijos pero independientes, tiene su negocio un local donD. venD. comida todos los días y es una persona muy responsable y querida por su grupo, el dinero del crédito lo utilizar en la compra D. abarrotes al por mayor.
Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras, están muy  agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The "AMISTAD POR SIEMPRE“ (Friendship Forever) communal bank is in its 6th cycle.  They showed themselves to be responsible, punctual and hard working.  

The group is represented by the following:  

Rosa, President, is the leader and founder of the group.  She sells sandals in the market on Wednesdays and Saturdays.  She’s married and has two married children.  She will use the loan money to buy sandals in order to increase her working capital.

Karina, Secretary, is single and doesn’t have children.  She sells breakfasts in the market in the morning.  She will use the funds to buy a stove.

Juana, Treasurer, is a widow with two independent children.  She has a stall where she sells food every day.  She’s a very responsible, well liked member of the group.  She will use the funds to buy groceries at wholesale.

All the members are responsible and hard working.  They are very grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: To buy sandals.

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a resident of Gujranwala which is located in Punjab and is famous in Pakistan for its sweetmeats. She has lived there in a 3-room brick house with her family in an area called Sheikh Ijada for many years. She is a 53-year-old lady who is married to M. A. and has five sons and one daughter. Her husband operates a grocery store in the nearby market. 
 
Her eldest son does embroidery; the next one is a motor mechanic, and her third son has a furniture-making business. They all contribute their family financially from their earning.  Her remaining 3 children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

Mumtaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan, he will increase his grocery stock by putting more groceries into it. He started this business 5 years ago and Mumtaz is hopeful that this investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position.  

She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her and she will be able to marry off her eldest son soon with the help of increased profits from the use of this loan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Delia Rosa

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal “Sol de Oro”  ubicado en el distrito Juliaca,  provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil  conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, estudió hasta 3ro de educación secundaria.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 08 meses, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de mercerías.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su mercadería para comprar cremas, papeles y detergentes para vender en su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital y tener más mercadería.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las charlas.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the “Sol de Oro” community bank which is located in Juliaca district, in San Román province, in the department of Puno.  She is 35 years old and lives with her partner.  She has one child and studied up to the 3rd year of her secondary education.

She has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 8 months.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling merchandise.

She is requesting a new loan for 500 nuevos soles which she will invest in her merchandise buying creams, paper and detergents to sell in her business.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital and more merchandise.

What she most likes about her community bank are the savings and the talks.

loans.use: To buy creams, paper and detergent to sell in her business

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Josefina tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Ella y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de helados, producto que lo tiene desarrollando desde hace 7 años, la idea surgió por iniciativa de sus hijos, además cuentan con una refrigeradora, única herramienta de trabajo, desde entonces emprendió este negocio. Con el tiempo se ha implementado de moldes y una nevera más, asimismo gran cantidad de barquillos. La preparación lo realiza durante el día hasta las 11 de la mañana y luego sale a vender repartiendo a las escuelas que se encuentran dentro de su zona; también hay personas que le ayudan a vender y por ello son retribuidos económicamente. La época más  rentable son  en temporada de verano. Sus planes futuros, es el de mejorar los implementos y equipos, para producir en mayor cantidad. Es el crédito número 5 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de productos básicos para la preparación de helados.
texts.en:
Josefina is 56 years old and lives with her husband and two children in their own house. She and her husband make ice cream for a living and have been developing their product for 7 years. The idea came from Josefina's children and they only had one piece of equipment needed for the job - a refrigerator. She launched the business then. With time, she set up popsicle molds and another freezer, and began using a great deal of cones as well. 

She now does preparation work during the day until 11 am, and then goes out selling the ice cream at schools in her area. There are people who help her sell and they are paid for their work. The most profitable season is the summertime. Her future plans are to improve her tools and equipment and to produce in greater quantity. This is Josefina's fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support. In addition, she is glad to be part of a communal bank because all of its members are responsible and very supportive people. She also is thankful to everyone who will provide the loan she is requesting since it will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan Josefina is requesting, she will invest in more primary materials for ice cream-making.

loans.use: To buy materials for ice cream-making.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa N. is a seamstress at Abura. Adjoa completed secondary education. She is single but has five dependents.  She responsibly sees to the well-being of her home. 

She is requesting to use the loan to buy more sewing materials to expand her business. 

She hopes to save the new profits from her activities and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials to expand her business

loans.name: Lalihan's Group

texts.en:
Lalihan S. is the leader of this group. She is 45 and married. Together with her husband she has brought up two daughters and three sons.  The two older daughters are married and live separately with their families, and the other children are students. 

In order to earn money to cover family expenses Lalihan and her husband breed livestock. Reselling livestock animals after fattening, the family earns an average of $106 per month. With money received from the loan Lalihan wants to purchase five goats for breeding. 

In the future she wants to increase the number of livestock and provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135
 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase goats for breeding

loans.name: Mauwa

texts.en:
Mauwa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a school for the past five years, while also teaching pupils in that school. Her major customers are children from the neighboring community. Mauwa faces a major challenge in the lack of enough classrooms to accommodate pupils in her school. In the future, she hopes to construct and expand her school.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase stationery for the school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her school.

loans.use: To purchase stationery for the school

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 40 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y nació en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Sonia después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica atender su tienda de abarrotes, ella tiene una tienda pequeña en su domicilio donde vende comestibles a sus vecinos y amigos de su barrio. Ya son 3 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Sonia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, leche, pan y muchas cosas más.   

Sonia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sonia, 40, has three children.  She was born in Cusco, Perú.  After doing her household chores she tends to her grocery store.  She has a small store in her house where she sells foodstuffs to her neighbors and friends in the neighborhood.  She’s been in business for three years and does very well.  Sonia needs the loan to buy merchandise like sugar, pasta, milk, bread and many other items.

Sonia is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Korn

texts.en:
Korn D., 29, resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. D. is a tailor, earning an income of USD 4 per day. Her husband sells used motorbikes, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 45 on food and USD 35 on the other necessary expenses. 

D. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a new sewing machine to expand her current business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine to improve her business.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Manuel S. tiene 37 años de edad y está casado con la señora Ninfa Gomez, quien tiene 34 años de edad, ambos de la ciudad de Caacupe, distante a unos 60 kilómetros de la ciudad capital (Asunción). Tienen 1 hijo y 2 hijas (todos en edad Escolar).
El señor Manuel S. cuenta en su domicilio con una hamburguesería desde hace 6 años. Donde trabaja con toda su familia.
Por más que el señor Manuel y su esposa trabajen mucho poseen algunas necesidades que satisfacer. Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas e insumos para sus hamburguesas, ya que la compra en cantidad disminuye el costo de los productos.
Agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya y Kiva el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio está creciendo, brindando productos de excelente calidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel S., 37, is married to Mrs. Ninfa Gómez, 34.  They are both from the city of Caacupe located about 60 kilometers from the capital, Asunción.  They have one son and two daughters, all school age.

Mr. Manuel S. has had a hamburger stand at his house for the last 6 years; he works there with his entire family.

Despite his and his wife’s hard work they still have some unmet needs.  He is asking for a loan to buy beverages and ingredients for the hamburgers because buying in bulk reduces costs of the products.

He thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support given for his business because, thanks to it, his business is growing providing his customers with products of excellent quality.

loans.use: to buy beverages and ingredients for his hamburgers.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La señora Bertha M. Q. de dedica al negocio de venta de comida estos almuerzos son repartidos a los trabajadores de la obras de construcción empezó el negocio hace 10 años es separada tiene cuatro hijos dos ya son mayores e independientes y dos están en edad escolar su sueño es construir su casa de material noble y poner un restaurante tiene buenas referencias , el dinero será invertido en comprar mesas y silla para su negocio y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes se propone crédito .
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha M. Q. operates a food stall and sells to construction workers in the area.  She began the business ten years ago.  She is separated and has four children, two of which are adults and live independently and the other two are in school.

Her dream is to build a house out of quality materials and set up a well-established restaurant.  She plans to use the loan to buy tables and chairs for her business so she can give her customers better service.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo y el menor de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Teofila tiene gran trayectoria en la agricultura pues son más de 50 años de haberse dedicado al cultivo y a la crianza de animales, pues ambas le han proporcionado estabilidad económica para ella y su esposo, ya que tienen 3 hijos a los que cuidaba, hoy son ya independientes. Se siente contenta de haber educado a sus hijos y solo le queda vida para continuar en el cultivo, y sólo trabaja para ella y su pareja. Hasta el momento ha sembrado maíz y papa, que son los principales productos que su tierra le brinda una buena producción. Entre los animales que cría son la vaca y el toro, que cuando es necesario los vende en las ferias ganaderas o algún vecino que requiere de estos animales. Es su crédito número 4 que tiene con MFP, le agrada compartir experiencias de trabajo con los demás integrantes de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita,  lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y semilla de alfalfa ya que lo necesita como forraje para sus vacas.
texts.en:
Teófila, 62, lives with her husband and the youngest of her three children in her own house.  Teófila has a long career in farming because she’s been farming and raising livestock for over 50 years.  Both these activities have provided economic stability for herself and her husband for they had three children to care for who are now independent.  She feels happy to have educated her children and now her remaining life is to continue farming and now she works just for herself and her husband.  To date, she’s grown corn and potatoes which are the main crops her soil produces in good yields.  Among the animals she raises are cows and bulls.  When necessary, she sells them at the livestock fairs or to some neighbor who requires these animals.

This is her 4th loan with MFP.  She enjoys sharing her work experiences with the other group members.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure and alfalfa seed that she needs as forage for her cows.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and alfalfa seed.

loans.name: Old Zengeza 5 Corner Shop Club Group

texts.en:
Alfred A. is the leader of Old Zengeza 5 Corner Shop Club from Chitungwiza and he is a vegetable vendor.  He is 42, married, and has three children aged 22, 17 and 10. The one aged 10 is still attending school.  

Alfred has been in the business of selling vegetables and fruits for 13 years now and does not have any other sources of income as his wife does not have any form of employment.  His main challenge is lack of enough capital that forces him to travel for orders on a daily basis. 


Alfred requested this loan through MicroKing for the purposes of buying tomatoes, green vegetables, sweet potatoes, apples and bananas for resale. He sees the loan amount improving the family's income and ultimately the quality of life for the family. He sees himself operating many stalls with increased income streams in the near future

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Ennest

texts.en:
Ennest is a 33-year-old married man with four children. He owns a four-room house in Kasese, Uganda. He started by selling coffee but later saved money to start a beer depot, which he has been running for the past six years. 
 
His hardship is breakage of empty bottles and his desire is to be able to supply beer to the western region of the country and have his own house in town. Ennest intends to use the loan to complete building his house.

loans.use: To complete building his house

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is 50 years old, married and has two children who are 32 and 35 years old. In 2000, she opened a grocery store and now works seven days a week, 10 hours a day to support her family.  She has already repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy goods to sell. She is very committed to improve her family's economic conditions and thanks Kiva lenders for their support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores called pasal are an important part of the local economy where people buy produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour to cook when they get home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory high and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of customers, produce, and shrewd businesswomen. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, the Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. Patan BPW also seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in a grocery store.

loans.name: Basoka Kwavula Development Group

texts.en:
Jackson is a 40-year-old ambitious businessman who relies on a food-sales business to provide for his family of 6. Jackson is happily married and he says his wife invariably helps him out at the food-market stall in Kayunga where he sells food. He has 3 years experience in running this business, where he principally sells bananas. 

Bananas are a staple food in most parts of Uganda and a seller cannot go wrong with sufficient reserves. In Jackson's case, farming has helped a lot. The fact that he is able to harvest bananas from his own gardens to sell has been pivotal. Jackson also sells cattle. He says his weekly sales profits are about 180,000 Ugandan shillings. With this Kiva loan, he says he is going to purchase high-grade manure for his banana farm.

loans.use: To purchase high-grade manure for his banana farm

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is a hairdresser. She also sells cosmetics at Abura. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a mason. As part of her responsibilities, she helps her husband to educate her child. Her loan will allow her to buy more hair products and cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more hair products and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
En su tienda Alfredo vende ranchos, víveres, abarrotes, carnes, bebidas frías, al detalle a sus principales clientes, que son, sus vecinos y especialmente las amas de casa ubicadas en el barrio Moderno donde se encuentra su negocio. La experiencia de Alfredo data desde hace 36 años, tiempo desde el cual ha logrado convertirla en  una tienda de gran tamaño; allí  trabaja con su hijo de 19 años, quien estudia por las noches una carrera técnica en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje, organismo apoyado por el estado. La tienda abre sus puertas desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m. de lunes  a Domingo, razón por la cual  la comunidad identifica este horario intenso como su gran fortaleza, porque cuentan con este negocio cuando lo requieran y esto es justamente lo que garantiza su éxito, así como también los precios justos que allí se ofrecen, acompañada de la vocación de servicio que tiene todos los integrantes de la familia C.. Su meta mas adelante es lograr convertir su tienda en un granero importante en el sector, para desde allí distribuir a pequeños negocios y con ello les resolvería su necesidad de ahorro en el transporte. Mientras Alfredo trabaja por alcanzar sus sueños, se esfuerza mucho en su negocio, logrando una liquidez de 4 veces y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 13%. 
Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará productos desechables  y víveres en mayor volumen, porque su rotación es muy rápida debido a que la ubicación de este negocio es favorable, porque se encuentra en una vía transitable de peatones y hay un despliegue comercial a su alrededor que potencializan su venta rápida.
texts.en:
In his grocery store, Alfredo sells canned goods, groceries, meat, cold beverages, and other retail items to his main customers who are his neighbors, especially the homemakers who live in the Moderno neighborhood where his store is located.  Alfredo has 36 years' experience and has been able to make his store a large one.  He works with his 19-year-old son who is studying at night for a technical degree through the National Learning Service which is state supported.  The store opens from 5:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m., Monday through Sunday.  The community recognizes these opening hours as a sign of greath strength because they can count on the store when they need to, which is what guarantees its success.  The prices are also low and all the members of the C. family show their true vocation for the business.

His goal for the future is to turn his store into an important sector establishment, being able to distribute to small businesses and saving on transportation.  While Alfredo works to reach his goals, he makes every effort in his business and is achieving a significant cash-flow and profit on sales of 13%.  His credikiva is his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He plans to use it to buy bulk disposable products and groceries, due to the quick turnaround because of his location where there are many passersby and surrounding shops.

loans.use: To buy bulk disposable products and groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stationery and printing materials

loans.name: Juanita Laura

texts.es:
La señora Juanita tiene ya más de tres años con su negocio de venta de ropa. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar mercancía que es juguetes, accesorios para bebes, zapatos y artículos de belleza, por el momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para realizar la inversión que le esta haciendo falta a su negocio, solicita su cooperación para este crédito, que pagara con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y darle los necesario para que tengan una buenas educación.
texts.en:
Juanita has been in the business of clothes sales for more than three years. She requests a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise, such as toys, baby accessories, shoes, and beauty products. She currently does not have the capital funds she needs to make this required business investment. She requests your cooperation for this loan and she will re3pay it with the profits she earns from her sales.

She wants to improve the quality of life for her family and to provide them with what they need in order to have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es:
Don Francisco de profesion zapatero, el cual elabora zapatos nuevos y de variedad de estilo de varon, con mas de diechiocho años. El cual comenzo con poca mercaderia, y que ha venido creciendo con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en cuatro ciclos todos invertidos en materia prima.
Su esposa esta vendiendo tortillas, el cual, ayuda con los gastos de sus tres hijos. Don Francisco espera invertir con este nuevo prestamo en la compra de ciento veinte pie de cuero, 48 pares de zuelas,, 6 yardas de charol, 18 pares de zuela de sandalias, un galon de pega blanca, un galon de pega amarrilla, 4 docenas de cordones. Todo esto para elevar su produccion.
texts.en:
Francisco is a cobbler by profession.  He manufactures new men’s shoes in a variety of styles.  He’s been in business for more than 18 years.  He started out with very little merchandise that he’s gradually increased thanks to Afodenic financing.  He’s been in four cycles and used all of them to invest in raw materials.

His wife is selling tortillas which helps him with the expenses of his three children.  Francisco hopes to use this new loan to buy 120 feet of leather, 48 pairs of soles, 6 yards of patent leather, 18 pairs of sandal soles, a gallon of white glue, a gallon of yellow glue, 4 dozen shoe laces; all of this to increase production.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to manufacture new shoes.

loans.name: Joweria

texts.en: Joweria lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister). Joweria has a food stall business. She has been in this business for two years and she works six days out of every week.  Joweria sells her products at the market by means of retail. Joweria has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes. The main business challenge(s) for Joweria include seasonality and the increasing price of foodstuffs. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked food stall. Joweria lives in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred has operated her agrovet shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last one year. (An agrovet shop sells animal medicines and supplies.) She is 26 years old, married to Wanii, and they have one child.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our field officer and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more goods to resell in her agrovet shop.

In the future, Winfred hopes to grow her agrovet from only retail to also some wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for resale in her agrovet retail shop.

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es:
El señor Calixto tiene 41 años de edad, es taxista en la zona urbana de la ciudad, es separado con 2 hijos. Empezó en la actividad como chofer desde muy joven, hoy en día cuenta con una parada de taxi y móvil propio.
Comenta que todo lo que tiene es gracias a su arduo trabajo, pues siempre se ha sacrificado mucho por lograr su propósitos y metas. Gracias a su trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles lo que ellos necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa, sin privaciones.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de repuestos para la reparación de su vehículo, ya que ese es su medio de trabajo y necesita mantenimiento. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Calixto is 41 years old, and is a taxicab driver in the downtown area of the city. He is separated with 2 children. He began this work as a driver when he was very young. Today he has his own taxi stand and his own cell phone. 

He says that all he has is thanks to his hard work, and he has always sacrificed a lot to achieve his plans and goals. Thanks to his work he has been able to provide a good life for his children giving them everything they need to have a decent and dignified life, without hardships.

He is asking for this loan in order to buy spare parts to repair his taxicab, as he needs his car to do his work and has to maintain it. He is grateful to the Foundation for the help it offers him.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in order to repair his taxicab

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
Mrs. Prak, a 59-year-old widowed woman, has been living in Kompong Speu province. Mrs. Prak has worked as a local cultivator since she was widowed. She was married, but her husband died a few years ago. Mrs. Prak has three children, one of whom is single and works as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh city. The other two children are married and live separately. 

From her business, Mrs. Prak typically earns an income of about 1.25 USD per day. She also depends on an income from her daughter who gets a monthly salary sewing clothes. With this little income, Mrs. Prak cannot cover all of her daily expenses. Thus, Mrs. Prak would like to request some funds from Kiva to purchase some pigs for breeding and future sale. In her prospect, Mrs. Prak hopes that she will able to increase her income from her pig-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase some pigs for breeding

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 47-year-old married woman with five school-going children. Her husband Jilani Tinga is a teacher who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Josephine has operated as a water and fish vendor for the past twelve years. In addition, she owns a small retail shop. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase more stocks of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu because of easy accessibility of loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of fish for resale.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 35 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is nine years old. Rosalina's husband is a fisherman.

Rosalina is a seaweed farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in this business for nine years. Rosalina earns about 5000 PHP per month with her business. She also helps her husband sell his catch at the market. 

Rosalina requested this loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs. She hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan is a 25 year-old market vendor who sells men's and women's clothes in the central market of Saatli.  He has 10 years of experience. Elkhan is single and lives with his parents. He brings clothes once in a month from Baku city. His monthly income from selling is 400 AZN. He applied for 1000 AZN loan to purchase more clothes for the upcoming winter season and to cover market demand.

loans.use: purchase seasonal clothes

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
La  Señora Adelina, tiene 63 años de edad, es madre soltera por viudez, tiene 6 hijos, ella reside en  una comunidad urbana del Municipio de Quimistan, Santa Bárbara.
Vive en compañía de 3 de sus hijos, los otros 3 están casados. Su negocio consiste en una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios.
Ella inicio su negocio con un crédito que le proporcionó ODEF y desde entonces ha sido cliente permanente. En el pasado ella se dedicaba a la venta de tortillas, pero con la necesidad de obtener mayores ingresos decidió cambiar su actividad económica.
Doña Adelina ha solicitado un préstamo para surtir su pulpería con productos como granos básicos (maíz, arroz, frijoles), golosinas, huevos, detergentes y jabones.
Considera que sus ingresos han mejorado, la cuota que debe pagar de su prestamo esta acorde con las ventas y utilidades que recibe.  Sus planes son aumentar las ventas y mantener surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
Adelina, age 63, is a single mother because she is a widow.  She has six children.  She lives in an urban community in the Quimistan municipality, Santa Bárbara.  She lives with three of her children; the other three are married. 

Her business is a grocery store where she sells food products.  She started her business with a loan from ODEF.  Since then she has been a permanent client.  She used to sell tortillas, but she needed more income.  She decided to change her business activity.

Adelina has requested a loan to stock her grocery store with products like basic grains (corn, rice, beans), sweets, eggs, detergents, and soaps.  She believes that her income has improved.

The loan payments that she needs to make are in accordance with the sales and profits that she receives.

Her plans are to increase sales and to keep her business stocked.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and sweets.

loans.name: Querobin

texts.en:
Querobin sells personal products such as cosmetics and shampoo in her village to earn a living. Operating her business for almost five years and earning about PHP2,000 each month, she sells her products mostly to her neighbors. Querobin's profits are just eniough to cover their daily expenses for meals and allowances for her two children.

She is now requesting a loan of PHP10,000 to buy more perfumes, colognes, shampoo and cosmetics to sell, and in the future hopes to earn consistent profits to develop her business and improve the lives of her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, colognes, shampoo and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar trades in washing supplies. With the income from her current business, Gohar isn't able to cover her family's costs. So she would like to enlarge her business. With the requested loan, Gohar plans to purchase more washing supplies to sell. An increase in sales will allow Gohar to get more income and ensure a better future for her family. Gohar lives with her husband and two children.

loans.use: to pay for washing supplies.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
El  joven Marco Antonio  vive en un bario pequeño en donde las personas  celebran la fiesta san francisco de asís.
Él solito el préstamo para invertir en la copra de ingredientes para la elaboración de  barretas en donde lleva trabajando dos meses en la que comenta que  le está dando un buen resultado para sus ingresos.

 Se inspiro en esta actividad ya que también quieres apoyara sus padres con los ingresos de la casi así también a hora para comenzar  su estudios

 Lo que él desea es segur estudiando para si terminar una carrera la cual pueda  desempeñar para  así seguir adelante y apoyar a sus padres con la economía.
texts.en:
The young Marco Antonio lives in a small barrio where the residents celebrate the feast of San Francisco de Asis.

He is requesting a loan to buy tools and materials for making metal bars and rods. He has been doing this for 2 months and he reports that good income is resulting from the business.

Marco Antonio is inspired to pursue his business because he wants to help his parents with their income, and also, he wishes to begin his studies again. What he wants most is to continue studying to complete his career, and to get out of debt, forge ahead, and help his parents economically.

loans.use: to pay for tools for his blacksmith's shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 31 years old. He is a taxi driver who has been in business for four years. He is married and is blessed with one child. He also owns a shop and operates a small-scale business. He is very hardworking as he has to support his family and also provide quality services to his customers. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has become very cooperative and focused.
 
He hopes to become a millionaire one day and expand his business. To make his dream come true, he requires a loan of 42,727.50 KES to open another retail shop.

loans.use: to open another retail shop

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is from Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, and is responsible for her 3 children. In 1998, knowing the necessities of truck drivers on the road, she decided to create her business called “Regaderas Escobedo”(Regaderas is like a quick shower on the road for all people who work as a truck drivers and many times they need this service because their travels are long and many of them do not rent a motel room). This business, in addition to offering showers, offers clothes washing and ironing, used clothes for sale, and Cokes.

Maria initiated the business with her daughter who is 18 years old. She started with a small amount of capital and later she was able to rent a place for her business. She has been growing little by little to serve her clients and the business allows her to have the resources to maintain her 3 children. Now her 3 children support her in the business.

Maria Guadalupe needs a loan of US$600 American Dollars and offers to repay it in 6 months. The loan is for renewing her work tools and purchasing clothes in order to increase her sales and give better service to her clients.

**This text has been translated from the original business description**

María Guadalupe es de Pedro Escobedo, Querétaro, teniendo la responsabilidad ella sola de la manutención de sus 3 hijos y conociendo las necesidades de los camioneros, en 1998 decide iniciar su negocio “Regaderas Escobedo” el cual presta servicios de renta de regaderas, lavado y planchado de ropa, venta de ropa usada y venta de refrescos para camioneros, inicia junto con su hija mayor que actualmente tiene 18 años. Ella empezó reuniendo un pequeño capital, después rento un local y lo fue acondicionando poco a poco para prestar los servicios que ahora ofrece y que le permiten tener los recursos necesarios para mantener de manera digna a sus 3 hijos que ahora la apoyan en el negocio. María Guadalupe necesita un crédito de US $600 Dólares americanos y ofrece pagarlos a 6 meses, esto es para renovar sus utensilios de trabajo y para invertir una mayor cantidad de ropa, y así incrementar sus ventas y dar mejor servicio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and tool for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase dairy feed

loans.name: Touch`

texts.en: Touch S. is 50 years old and lives with her four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  Unfortunately, her husband passed away and she was left to provide for the family herself.  S. sells traditional Khmer cakes in her village and typically makes about $2.50 per day.  Two of her children work at a nearby garment factory and another works at a private company.  Her fourth child helps S. to sell cakes.  She hopes to use this loan to construct a house for the family, since they are currently living in a small cottage which has leaves as its roof.  In the future S. hopes that her children will complete high school.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: A dedicated client of Lift Above Poverty Oorganization (LAPO), Mrs. Mercy C. has been in the fish-smoking business for 16 years. She is happily married with four children. With this loan of US$ 400, Mercy hopes to be able to expand her business by buying more fish to smoke for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish  to smoke for resale

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
At 28 years of age, Mrs. Essi D. is her husband’s third wife and mother of three children. Generally, husbands who have several wives tend to neglect their role as fathers because they are weighted down by too much responsibility for supporting their households. It is thus the women who eke out a living for their children, feeding, clothing, and educating them. Such is the situation that Mrs. D. finds herself in.

Fortunately for her children, Essi is a dynamic woman with lots of business activities. Currently, she has opened up a little telephone stand, together with selling shoes and various other products. In order to expand these micro-businesses, Essi is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 which will serve her as business capital. This will allow her to increase her profit and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 28 ans, Madame D. Essi est la 3ème femme de son mari. Généralement, les hommes qui ont plusieurs femmes négligent leur rôle de père de famille car ils sont écrasés par les charges du ménage. Il revient alors aux femmes de se battre pour nourrir, habiller et scolariser leurs enfants. Telle est la situation dans laquelle se retrouve Madame D. Essi qui est aujourd’hui mère de trois (3) enfants.

Heureusement, elle est une femme très active et mène beaucoup d’activités. Actuellement, elle a ouvert une cabine téléphonique et y ajoute la vente des chaussures et autres produits divers. Pour améliorer cette activité, elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui lui servira de fonds de commerce. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer ses revenus et d’améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Achat et revente des chaussures et autres produits divers

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es:
Doña Dionisia is 40 years old and is a very caring, happy, and enterprising mother. She dedicated herself to clothing sales in a market situated close to her native city, Juliaca. Her work in this sector is very competitive because there are many other vendors who offer the same variety of clothing, but Dionisia characterizes her shop through new stock in a range of colours, and above all, by both the patience and good work which she offers her clients . Thanks to these qualities she has been able to achieve success in her business. Her desire is to increase her stock of merchandise with the aim of generating greater income to cover the advanced studies that her son Oscar wants to pursue. To make this a reality she has come to solicit your help and asks for a loan of $500. This money will allow her to continue to increase her business thanks to the generous support that you can offer her.

Translated from the Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer
