Doña Dionisia tiene 40 años de edad es una madre muy cariñosa, alegre y emprendedora, está dedicada a la venta de prendas de vestir en un mercado muy concurrido de su ciudad natal, Juliaca, su desempeño en este sector es bastante competitivo porque existen otras vendedoras que ofrecen la misma variedad de artículos, pero Dionisia se caracteriza por las novedades y gama colores en su mercadería y sobre todo por la paciencia y buen trato que les brinda a sus clientes, gracias a esas cualidades está teniendo éxito en su negocio.Su deseo es aumentar la cantidad de artículos, con el fin de generar mayores ingresos económicos para cubrir los estudios superiores que desea seguir su hijo Oscar; para hacer realidad este deseo recurre a tu ayuda y solicita un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que le seguirá permitiendo acrecentar su negocio gracias al apoyo generoso que tu puedas brindarle.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater variety and quantity of merchandise

loans.name: Selau

texts.en: Selau is married with three kids. She applied for this loan in order to buy supplies and prizes for her bingo business. She runs it two days per week, and she makes a profit of 260 Tala ($104 USD) per day. She hopes to use her next loan to repair her house in order to improve her family’s living conditions. She is very appreciative of these loans which allow her to make ends meet.

loans.use: To buy supplies and prizes for her bingo hall business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a farmer and had us taste some of her delicious coconuts, mangoes and bananas, products which she grows with much effort and dependability with the help of her family in her fertile farming lands. She puts a lot of enthusiasm into the development of her farming efforts because she is aware that they can help her children. The unconditional support that she receives from them provides her with optimism, and despite the financial shortcomings at home she tries to alleviate those shortcomings efficiently. Martha feels a profound obligation toward her family, and especially for her youngest child, who suffers from epilepsy, and who to this day she has only been able to treat with natural herbs. Her wish to improve the health of her little one brings her to request a loan to increase the quality and quantity of her products with the goal of providing him with appropriate treatment in a hospital in their country once she obtains profits from the marketing of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha, es agricultora ella nos hizo degustar algunos de sus deliciosos cocos, mangos y plátanos productos que a costa de mucho esfuerzo y constancia logra producir en compañía de su familia en sus fértiles tierras de cultivo.Ella pone mucho ánimo en el desarrollo de sus labores agrícolas porque es consciente que de esta manera puede ayudar a sus tres hijos, el apoyo incondicional que recibe de ellos le inyecta optimismo y a pesar de las carencias económicas que hay en casa, trata de aliviar eficazmente las carencias de su hogar.Martha siente un profundo compromiso con su familia y aún más con el último de sus hijos, quien sufre de epilepsia, mal que hasta el momento sólo ha logrado aliviar con un tratamiento con hiervas naturales. Su deseo de mejorar la salud de su pequeño la llevan a solicitar un préstamo para mejorar la cantidad y calidad de sus productos a fin de otorgarle con las ganancias que obtendrá luego de su comercialización un adecuado tratamiento en un hospital de su país.

loans.use: Increase the quality and quantity of her products to provide adequate treatment for her son's illness.

loans.name: Daisy Miguelina

texts.en: Daisy is a kind woman who is passionate about abstract art. She is dedicated to painting pictures and decorative ceramic plates which she sells to the people of Hortaliza, a community of Santo Domingo.  Daisy is thirty years old, and she has two school-going sons aged seven and eight. Daisy explains that she didn’t go to a professional school of art, but she is talented and gets her inspiration from nature. The artist would now like to diversify her business. With her loan, she will buy an assortment of wooden collars and bracelets which she will paint and hopefully sell to a new segment of the market. The new products of the artist will be sold in Bávaro, one of the most touristy places of the country.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a large quantity of goods to expand a business of painting pictures and ceramic plates.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Born in May 1970, Mrs. Eya G. has been selling condiments and basic need goods since childhood. She is the mother of four (4) children, all of whom have been in her care after her husband abandoned the family. Disciplined in the management of her business, she was able to repay her previous loan. She is asking for a new loan in order to enlarge her store display and to stock up on food products in order to better serve her clientele. This will allow her to fulfill all her responsibilities with respect to her children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en Mai 1970, Madame G. Eya est revendeuse des condiments et de produits de premières nécessités depuis son enfance. Mère de quatre (4) enfants, qui sont tous à sa charge après l’abandon du foyer conjugal par leur père. Rigoureuse dans la gestion de son activité, elle a su bien rembourser son crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite de nouveau un crédit en vue d’agrandir son étalage et s’approvisionner en produit alimentaire afin de mieux servir sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’assurer toute sa responsabilité envers ses enfants

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana Milagros is 32 years old and the owner of a mototaxi, but at the same time she is dedicated to selling clothing for the nearby residents in her city. She has two young children who study in a modest education center. Her husband, Señor Richard, is the driver of her mototaxi and is the person dedicated to the care of this machine. In the future she desires for her kids to become successful professionals. It is for this reason that she also sells clothes to contribute to the family's needs. She requires a sum of money to invest in the maintenance and repair of their mototaxi, and much later to buy another mototaxi. Let's support this mother who continues working aduously with her effort and dedication to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Juana Milagros, de 32 años de edad, es propietaria de un mototaxi, pero al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir por los caseríos más cercanos a su ciudad. Ella tiene dos hijos menores que estudian en un modesto centro educativo. Su esposo el señor Richard es el chofer de su mototaxi y es quien se dedica al cuidado de esta herramienta de trabajo, en el futuro desea que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales de éxito, es por eso que también vende ropas para contribuir con el sustento de su familia.Requiere de una suma de dinero para invertirlos en el mantenimiento y arreglo de su herramienta de trabajo, y muy posteriormente comprarse otro mototaxi. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.

loans.use: Buy spare parts to improve the conditions of her mototaxi.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
V. started a business in order to increase her family’s income because her six children are all grown and have their own lives. She currently has stomach cancer and, even though her children and husband work, the treatment is very expensive, which is why she became determined to start her own business. She began two years ago and, because she has always been an enterprising person and likes sales, she decided to open a general store. Little by little she has made it grow and has generated an income from it.

She is requesting a loan for $500, which she plans to repay in six months, to continue to expand her business and thereby increase her sales and income. With your help V. will be able to continue her treatment.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

V. inició el negocio para incrementar los ingresos familiares debido a que sus 6 hijos ya son adultos y tienen su vida hecha, actualmente ella se encuentra enferma de cáncer en el estomago y aunque sus hijos y esposo trabajan, es muy costoso el tratamiento por lo que resolvió iniciar su propio negocio. Comenzó hace 2 años ella siempre ha sido una persona emprendedora y tiene el gusto por las ventas, por lo que decidió abrir una miscelánea, poco a poco ha podido hacerla crecer y ha conseguido ingresos con ella.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para seguir ampliando su negocio y de esta manera poder incrementar las ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Con tu apoyo V. podrá continuara con su tratamiento.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Joyce M.. She is a widow and has one child, aged 5. In 2000, Joyce opened a general store. Now she is applying for a loan to buy additional inventory in bulk to sell from her store. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional stock in bulk for a general store.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Mariam S., 32, lives with her three children and her husband in the Sogomougou district of the prefecture of Koutiala, Sikasso Region. She does livestock fattening (which consists in buying thin animals, caring for them, then reselling them) which she learned from her mother. With 7 years' experience, she is very knowledgeable in each aspect of this undertaking.

Having been with SORO YIRIWASO for four years, she has had a share in 8 group loans which were all appropriately reimbursed. This latest loan will be used to purchase 15 sheep in the villages surrounding Koutiala, 2 sacks of livestock feed, and medicines.The sheep will be fattened over the space of 3 months before being re-sold. Her clientele is essentially composed of buyers coming from Cote d’Ivoire.

She is expecting to make a profit of around US$ 280 every three months which she will use to make the payments on the loan and for daily living expenses.

Mariam finds that this business gives her family a good chance to work together. She hopes to expand her business over the course of time.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Mariam S. a 32 ans, vit avec ses 3 enfants et son mari au quartier sogomougou de la préfecture de koutiala Region de Sikasso. Elle mène l’activité d’embouche ovine (qui consiste à acheter des animaux maigres les entretenir puis les revendre) qu’elle a appris avec sa maman. Avec une expérience de 7 ans, elle maîtrise parfaitement le cycle de cette activité.

En relation avec SORO YIRIWASO depuis 4 ans, elle a eu 8 prêts solidaires qui tous été bien remboursés. Le prêt en cours sera utilisé pour acheter 15 moutons dans les villages environnants de Koutiala, 2 sacs de tourteaux et des médicaments. Les moutons sont engraissés pendant 3 mois avant de les revendre. Sa clientèle est essentiellement composée d’acheteurs venant de la république de Cote d’Ivoire.

Elle compte réaliser un profit moyen de 120 000f CFA par trimestre avec lequel elle payera les intérêts du prêt et assurera ses dépenses quotidiennes.

Mariam trouve que cette activité a crée une bonne cohésion au sein de sa famille. Elle compte élargir son activité au fil du temps.

loans.use:
Purchase of sheep, livestock food, and medicines

Achat de moutons, d’aliment bétail et de medicaments

loans.name: María Elvira

texts.es:
Maria Elvira is 56 years old, she widowed 20 years ago, has two sons and one daughter, she finished grade nine. She lives in #151 Jiron San Martin, district of Zepita, province of Chucuito – Juli and region of Puno.

She is a member of the “August 1st” community bank in the district of Zepita. With the first $115 USD (S/.300) loan, she bought 1 sack of rice, 1 sack of sugar and a bag of pasta for the general store she has had for many years.

With this loan of $550 USD (S/.1,500) which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar, 3 sacks of flour, 1 sack of broken rice, 2 bags of pasta and basic need items to prepare food in her restaurant, located next to the general store.

Maria Elvira states that since she belongs to the community bank, she has increased the merchandise and is slowly stocking the store, which makes her really happy.

Her vision is to fully equip the store, build a house in her lot and see her children find a job after raising them with a lot of effort.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Doña María Elvira tiene 56 años de edad, es viuda hace veinte años, madre de dos hijos y una hija, ella estudió hasta tercero de secundaria, vive en jirón san Martín Nº 151 en el distrito de Zepita, provincia de Chucuito - Juli y Región de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal Primero de Agosto del distrito de Zepita, con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 nuevos soles compró 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 bolsa de fideos, para su tienda de abarrotes que tiene hace muchos años.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprarà 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 3 sacos de harina, 1 saco de arroz granillo, 2 bolsas de fideos y artículos de la primera necesidad para la preparación de la comida en su restaurante que funciona al lado de su tienda de abarrotes.

María Elvira, indica que desde que entro al Banco Comunal pudo incrementar su mercadería y está equipando poco a poco tienda de abarrotes, por todo ello ella está muy contenta.

Su visión futura es equipar más la tienda y construir su casa al interior de su terreno y que sus hijos encuentren trabajo a los que educó con mucho esfuerzo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Shakir

texts.en:
This is an orphan boy, Shakir U.. He is 23 and engaged. He has been living with 13 members of his family in the Ningarhar province for about 20 years. His older brother is a car driver and two others are studying in a public school.

When his father was living, he had a small retail shop in Jalalabad city and theiee lives were going better. Shakir U. was helping his father in shopkeeping.

Just four months ago when his father died, some thieves were stole their money and a lot of expensive goods from their shop. These problems brought a lot of difficulties. His brothers had to leave the school and start some work, because their financial problems were increasing day by day. Shakir U. was so worried about it and didn't know how to struggle with these difficulties. 

Finally one of his relatives gave them some money as a loan, to start their business once again. ShakirU. bought a car and started driving. After two months he was able to re-enroll his brothers in a public school and now he can stand on its own feet. 

Shakir U. was able to repay 50% of the loan in a month. tTen he gave the car to his brother for driving, and he purchased some goods for his shop and started his own business for the second time.

Now Shakir U. is happy with life, and he wants to expand his business more. Even though he knows the business well, unfortunately, he doesn't have enough capital for this purpose. Therefore he has requested a loan, to purchase rice, oil, sugar, or other goods for his shop.

Shakir U. dreams to repay this loan as soon as possible and stand on his own feet completely, and then he will marry. Also he has planned to buy a big general store in the central location of the city in the future. Finally he thanks the lenders so much.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, sugar, and other goods for his shop

loans.name: Sakun

texts.en:
Sakun B. is 24 years old and sells groceries in front of her house, including products like cakes and soft drinks. She typically earns US$4 per day. Sakun lives in the Omperl Commune, Siem Reap Province, where she cares for her grandmother.

To satisfy increased customer demand, Sakun wants to expand her inventory. Hence, she needs a loan of US$200 to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mrs. Hem P. was born in 1962 and she now lives in Pour Dos Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Men Sie, are farmers. They have six children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. Two others are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only four.

Although Mrs. Hem P.'s family members have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Hem P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows for breeding. She hopes to increase her income after she sells her cows. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim T., 40, is married and lives with three children and her husband in the Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She works at home breeding pigs and is able to make US$2.50 each day, while her husband is a farmer and horse-cart driver. He makes a combined US$5.50 per day. One of their children is a mechanic and one is a tailor. These two children also support the family with around US$100 each month. Kim T. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to invest in a new business. This money will be used to rent a banana farm.

loans.use: To rent banana farm.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Hak S., 44, is a rice farmer who lives in Trapeangbeng Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She has been growing rice since 1979. She is married with four children, two of whom are married. Beside growing rice, S. purchases cashews from growers and sells them to wholesalers for a profit. Hak is requesting a loan to purchase more cashews for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cashews for resale.

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Mr. Rim S. was born in 1976 and he now lives in Sro Nge village in Kampong Speu province. He is a grocer in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for his inventory. His wife, Mrs. Poy Sokim, helps him with the current business.

Mr. Rim S. has three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study because they are only five months old and four years old. His wife is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for his inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
ELIZABETH DÁVILA O., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” ubicado en el Jr. Saenz Peña N° 320 en la Ciudad de Pucallpa, del Distrito de Callería, tiene 51 años de edad, 02 hios, su esposo es comerciante vende repuestos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró tapears para poder repartir la comida que ella preparaba, su contrato con la Dirección Regional de Educación, brindaba servicios alimenticios, cambio su tipo de venta ahora vende madera en tablillas.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invierte en tablillas machimbreadas de shihuahuaco de tipo cortos el cual trabaja solo con pedidos, que usa para cielorraso.

Está muy agradecida con el gran apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth D. O. belongs to the Mujeres Valientes (Courageous Women) Village Bank, located at Jr. Saenz Peña No. 320 in the Callería district of Pucallpa. She is 51, has two children, and her husband is a spare parts salesman. She used her first loan of 300 nuevos soles to buy plastic containers for delivering the food she prepared as per her food-service contract with the Regional Directorate of Education. Now she sells wood panels instead. Elizabeth will invest this loan of 1000 nuevos soles in short Shihuahuaco tongue and groove ceiling panels, for which she only takes custom orders. She is very appreciative of the great deal of support she gets from Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in Shihuahuaco tongue and groove ceiling panels, for which she only takes custom orders

loans.name: Ibodatoi

texts.ru:
Каримова Ибодатой проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 63 года, замужем и имеет шестерых детей. Торгует на центральном рынке. Торгует хлопковым маслом. Завозит товар из города Турсун-Заде. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 20 лет. Теперь планирует  получить кредит и увеличить товаролоборот. Это необходимо сделать так как 
 спрос на ее продукцию растет  и она не успевает обеспечить всех клиентов. Это поможет ей привлечь много новых клиентов. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Ibodatoi K. lives in Gissar. She is 63 years old and is married with six children. She sells cotton oil at the central market. She brings cotton oil from Tursunzade. She has been in this business for 20 years, and she would like to get a loan for increasing cash flow. This is necessary because at the moment she does not manage to satisfy the growing demand for cotton oil. A loan would also allow her to attract new customers. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase cash flow

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat, together with her husband (pictured), has a small business of selling construction supplies in their store, which they have recently expanded. They fill their store with attractive, reasonably priced items that appeal to many customers who are looking to construct or build offices, houses, and so on. Muhabbat has been in business for about 11 years. She enjoys her work and has developed a stable enterprise. She is requesting a loan to help purchase a new supply of items to sell.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new supplies of items to sell in a construction supplies store.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: El señor Carlos Luís A. vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos el trabaja como mesero en un restaurante-bar de la ciudad, el ingreso que el percibe por este trabajo no es muy alto, lo que ayuda a la economía de esta familia son las propinas que dejan los clientes, al paso del los años el Señor Carlos ha construido un patrimonio para su familia con ahorros propios. Primero el compro un terreno y empezó a fincar en el, a horita el tiene la obra detenida por falta de materiales y dinero para pago de mano de obra por lo que el nos solicita ayuda para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Luís A. lives with his wife and four children. He works as a waiter in a restaurant in the city. The income he receives for this work is not very high, what helps his family economically are the tips that his customers leave him. Over the years Carols has built an inheritance for his family with his own savings. First he bought a plot of land and began farming it. Now he has stopped work because he is lacking materials and money to pay the laborers so he is asking us for a loan to complete his project.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials and labor for construction

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris Y. is thirty years old. She is married and blessed with four children. Currently, they are all pursuing education in junior and primary schools. She lives together with her family in a family house in a town called Akim Oda, a farming community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Doris works with zeal as a resourceful parent to support her family and provide for the children's schooling. She is a fish monger and also runs a small grocery shop. She sells in a shed in the local market square. She procures her goods from big time fish mongers in Yeji and Mankessim towns, who sell at wholesale prices. She has been in business for five years. According to Doris, most of her customers are food vendors in her community.

She believes the loan assistance would enable her to buy tilapia and assorted fishes in bulk to serve a larger market and eventually help improve her family finances. She is a member of a Trust Bank group called Zion Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish and tilapia.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 51-year-old Veronica Z. from Mwanza, married with four children between the ages of 16 and 31. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. The operator of a pharmacy business since 2008, Veronica, assisted by one employee, works eight hours per day, seven days per week, earning about $200 monthly.  She is now requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase more medicines such as panadol and flagily. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Veronica thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines such as panadol and flagily.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Wiriasih

texts.en:
"Ni Ketut Wiriasih - (DNR.M-0680), a 43 year-old woman living in the town of Tuwed – Melaya, is married and has one school-aged child. To making a living, Ni Ketut Wiriasih owns and operates a business raising livestock; her main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Ketut Wiriasih has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month.

In 2008, Ni Ketut Wiriasih joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan, her second, from DINARI, of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Ni Ketut Wiriasih plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar Ghulam Sarwar Group

texts.en:
Nasreen begum baji wants a loan to buy music players to sell.

Sajida baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

M. baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell.

Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy medicines to sell.

Parveen akhtar baji is the wife of G. S. who is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). After the whole day’s struggle he only keeps half of his income. Parveen baji operates a clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden of her husband. Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband so that he gets the whole income of his struggle.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband's business

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie D. is from the village of Purok 8C, Barangay Santiago, Iligan City. She is 29 years old. Julie is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Julie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Julie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In June 2009, Julie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Julie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Purok 8C, Santiago, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Dildora

texts.en:
Dildora A. is a married mother of two children. Knowledge from her parents and grandparents has contributed to Dildora's work raising cattle in a special space in her home. Dildora's work in animal sales generates good income for her family. Currently she has two cows in her house. She would like to increase little by little the variety of her animals and is seeking a loan of $ 1200 USD. Dildora’s dream is to see her children complete their education.
Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Tajikistan is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve agricultural production and the manufacturing sector nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of small cattle

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos en el caserío Lagunas en el distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la confección y bordado artesanal de manteles, los cuales vende en el mercado de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero y dos de sus hijos estudian en un colegio cercano, los otros tres han tenido que dejar sus estudios e ir a trabajar para ayudar a sostener la economía de casa, esta situación es muy común en los caseríos de la zona.

El negocio que ella maneja con mucho esfuerzo es una pequeña ayuda para sostener a su familia, pero Margarita desea que sus hijos continúen estudiando para que se aseguren un futuro mejor.

Ella está solictando un crédito de 550 nuevos soles para comprar hilos seguir confeccionando los manteles, lo cual le permita juntar el suficiente dinero para volver a mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y que ya no tengan que dejarla por ir a trabajar.

Margarita goza de muy buenas referencias entre sus vecinos, los cuales reconocen su trabajo y la apoyan cuando es necesario.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 44-year-old mother who lives with her husband and their five children in the small town of Lagunas in the Mórrope district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She earns her living making and embroidering tablecloths, which she sells at the city market. Her husband works occasionally as a laborer. Two of their children go to the high school nearby, while the other three have had to leave school and go to work to help support the family. This is a very common occurrence in the towns in this region. Margarita's business, which she works so hard on, helps support her family to a small degree, but she wants her children to stay in school so they can be assured of a better future. She is seeking a loan for 550 soles to buy thread so she can keep making tablecloths and earn enough money to send her children back to school and not out to work. Margarita is highly regarded among her neighbors, who recognize her work and help her out when she needs it.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread for making embroidered tablecloths

loans.name: Lidia Del Transito

texts.es: Lidia del Transito R. L. tiene la edad de 54 años. Es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independencia. Su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos. Lidia es una mujer que disfruta mucho de su trabajo es atender a sus clientes hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para elaborar sus refrescos. Su mayor sueño es establecer una tienda de ropa, para seguirle proporcionando a su familia el alimento diario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de azúcar, frutas naturales, vasos entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Lidia del Transito R. L. is 54 and the single mother of three children, who are out on their own, working. She earns her living selling soft drinks. Lidia is a woman who really enjoys her job serving customers. She been in this business for five years, and gets up very early to prepare the soft drinks. Her greatest wish is to open a clothing store, so she can continue to feed her family daily. She is seeking a loan for working capital, and plans to buy sugar, fresh fruits, glasses, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ewoe Judith

texts.fr: Cette dame n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge. Elle a appris le métier de coiffure. En 2004, elle a ouvert son atelier de coiffure dans le quartier de Totsi à Lomé. Avec le temps, par rapport à la fidélité de ses clients, elle a commencé aussi à vendre des mèches et tissages pour apporter une valeur ajoutée à ses activités. Elle se rend très souvent au Grand Marché de Lomé pour s’approvisionner en mèches et tissages. Actuellement elle a une clientèle bien remplie ; aussi pour mieux répondre à leurs attentes, elle a recruté une apprenti coiffeuse. Pour renouveler son stock, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 50 mèches Nina, 50 mèches Curly, 50 mèches Ondulées et des tissages de différentes gammes. Elle est fière de son activité.
texts.en:
This is an unmarried lady with no children at all to support.  She has learned hairdressing as a trade.  In 2004, she opened her hair salon in the Totsi district of Lomé.  Over time, with regard to the loyalty of her customers, she also started to sell hair extensions and weaves to bring added value to her business.  She often goes to the Grand Market of Lomé to stock up on hair extensions and weaves.  At present, has has very busey customers; and to respond further to their expectations, she has recruited an apprentice hairdresser.  To renew her stock of merchandise, she's requesting a WAGES loan to buy 50 Nina hair extensions, 50 Curly hair extensions, 50 Ondulées hair extensions, and some weaves in different ranges.  She is proud of her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and weaves to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina O., 39 years old and the married mother of three school-aged children, is from the village of Minaog. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital for the business. This loan will be Gina's fourth from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Siempre Unidas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Siempre Unidas” esta representado por la señora Estela y conformada por 12 miembros muy trabajadores y cumplidos como lo demuestran en sus puestos D. venta D. productos como comida, jugos , cosméticos, otras D. las socias se dedican a la actividades como transporte D. medicamentos, transporte D. pasajeros, enseñanza y al servicio odontológico. En cuanto a la competencia  ellas venden en un mercado central D. la ciudad donD. es muy concurrido por nuestros pobladores D. tal manera que sus ventas les generan ingresos diarios frecuentes. El crédito lo utilizarán para invertir en su actividad económicas o negocios ya como podemos ver hay actividades variadas y  así aumentaran su capital,  a futuro ellas esperan incrementar sus ganancias haciendo crecer un poco mas sus negocios con mas mercadería y así poderles dar a sus familias mas comodidades y  una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia las socias van cursando un ciclo mas demostrando capacidad, responsabilidad y sobre todo ganas D. trabajar y sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios para darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Тариев Акрам проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст  28 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Акрам имеет среднее образование. Он более 3 лет занимается торговлей зерновыми продуктами на рынке. Жена, домохозяйка. Кредит просит для увеличения ассортимента.
texts.en:
Akram T. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 28 years old, married and has no children. His wife is a homemaker. Akram has secondary education. He has been involved in sales of grain products at a market for over 3 years. He is requesting a loan in order to increase product selection.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing selection

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio Vázquez es casado con la señora Claudia Marcela Nájera y son padres de unos niños de edad escolar, el labora para una empresa marmolera como pulidor desde hace 8 años. Y obtienen otros ingresos ya que junto con su familia iniciaron  su propio negocio de nombre “Abarrotes Vázquez “establecido desde hace 1 año, y sus ingresos se han incrementando ya que su clienta los prefieren por la buena atención que les brindan, ellos están tramitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía de su negocio ya que invertirán en mayoreo para así obtener mayor ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio V. is married to Mrs. Claudia Marcela Nájera. They are the parents of children are at school age. He works for a company as a polisher at a marble factory where he has been for the last 8 years. He started with his family a pantry shop business which became his second income. It is called "Abarrotes V.” and was established a year ago. Its revenues are increasing as their client prefers them because of the good customer service they provide.

He is asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of grocery products at a whole sale to obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora  ANDREA A. D. M., tiene  56 años, vive en el distrito D. la BUENOS AIRES provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 3ero D. primaria, refiere que ella es D. Julcan y que desD. niña se dedicó a trabajar en el campo o a cuidar y dar D. comer a los animales y por falta D. recursos económicos sus padres no le dieron más educación, tiene 3 hijos todos mayores quienes la apoyan eventualmente. La socia se dedica  a la preparación D. tortas y bocaditos para cumpleaños, matrimonios, quinceañeros, bautizos, primera comunión, etc. Y con sus primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró: harina al por mayor, pasas, guindones, vainilla, moldes, mantequilla, grageas, para la preparación D. sus tortas y bocaditos.
Con este crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles comprará un horno pequeño para así poder hornear sus tortas y bocaditos y no pagar un adicional por mandarlos a hornear a una panadería.
Andrea sueña con ambientar un lugar en su casa en donD. pueda vender tortas  y postres.
texts.en:
Sra. Andrea A. D. M. is 56 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires District, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras II” (Enterprising Women II). Andrea has a third graD. education because her parents lacked the financial resources to continue her schooling. As a child growing up in Julcan, she learned how to work in the fields and take care of the farm animals. She now has three adult children who currently support her.

Andrea prepares cakes and snacks for weddings, quinceañeras, baptisms, first communions, and other occasions. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought flour at wholesale, raisins, plums, vanilla, baking molds, butter, and gelatin for preparing cakes and snacks.

She is now requesting another loan of 300 soles to buy a small oven so that she can bake cakes and appetizers herself without having to pay to send them to a bakery. Andrea dreams of establishing a store in her home where she can sell cakes and pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an oven

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 22 years old and lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their newborn baby.
Ali has owned a coffee shop for a year, where he offers games such as billiards, bagman, card games, and lots more. He is successful in his work because he does his best to improve his income and is known for his good reputation and the welcome he gives to his customers. His customers are friends, neighbors and others from the region. Ali decided on this line of work because of his experience. He is an active man who does his best to improve his work and increase his income. He has also owned a clothing shop for two years.
Ali requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to alter the décor of his coffee shop – he wants to repaint the walls and make his shop look more attractive. This is his second loan cycle and he has always made his payments on time. His previous loan helped him open his coffee shop and improve his clothing shop by expanding his merchandise.

loans.use: To alter the décor of his coffee shop

loans.name: Marling Araceli

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, la dama Marling P. se dedica a atender su propio negocio de cyber café donde presta el servicio de alquiler de computadoras con acceso a internet atendiendo a diario desde la mañana hasta el atardecer.
Ella está comprometida con el mejoramiento de su negocuio y para ello quiere ampliar el local para brindar un mejor servicio. Es por esta razón que solicita un crédito con el fin de comprar los materiales de construcción para ampliar el cyber café y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes que a diario le visitan y estos puedan estar satisfechos con la atención que se les brinda en el cybercafe.
texts.en:
In the municipal of Somotillo, Miss Marling P. tends to her own cyber café business where she rents out computers with access to the internet. She tends to her business daily from the morning until dusk. She is committed to improving her business and for this reason she wants to increase its size to offer a better service. It’s for this reason that she is asking for a loan with the purpose of buying construction materials to increase the size of the cyber café and therefore provide a better service to her customers who visit daily. Then they can be satisfied with the attention that is given to them in the cyber café.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to increase the size of her cyber cafe

loans.name: Paula Elvira

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Paula M. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su actividad de venta de aguacates, limones, zapotes,entre otros ofrecidos ambulantemente en una canasta que a diario carga donde coloca estos productos y se moviliza en el mercado.

Su trabajo es muy cansado por la razón de que vende ambulantemente por las calles del mercado exponiéndose a la fatiga producida por el sol y al cansancio de caminar todo el día. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de aguacates, limones y zapotes para continuar con la venta y así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Paula M. fully dedicates herself to the sale of her fruits and vegetables in the wholesale market of Managua. She sells avocadoes, lemons, sapotes, and apples, among others. Her job is very demanding as she sells her wares throughout the market streets and often succumbs to fatigue caused by constant exposure to the sun and she gets tired from walking all day long. She is requesting this loan to purchase more avocadoes, lemons, and sapotes (a soft, edible fruit) so she can continue selling these and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 36 years old, married to Hannah Muthoni, and has a one-year-old baby. He has been operating a motorcycle business in Naivasha town for the last three years. He was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy a new helmet for his passengers that complies with the new PSV transport regulation recently set by the government.
In the future, Michael hopes to buy a car and operate it as a taxi, thereby increasing his income.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle helmet

loans.name: Donathile

texts.en:
Donathile is 24 years old and is an unmarried mother with one child. She lives in Ruramba, a region of Nyaruguru situated in the Southern Province of Rwanda.

Donathile was originally a farmer before thinking on how she could start a small business so that her life situation could be improved. She thought of starting to sell a variety of goods in a shop and this is her third successful year in this business. Her shop is open from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Donathile, after these three years of experience, now has so many customers that she can’t even satisfy them. To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan which will allow her to add a variety of requested goods such as beans, rice, sugar, etc. With this loan, she is planning to increase her sales and she hopes that her profits will also increase.

With these profits, Donathile will reinvest a portion in her business with the purpose of keeping her business sustainable.

loans.use: To buy additional goods including cosmetics

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Mrs. Luzviminda A. has been farming for quite a while now. She is married to Ronelo and they have five children. She continuous to tend her rice farm because it is the only source of income her family has. She is starting to raise hogs to add income for her family. She applied to CEVI and she is hopeful that its program will be really helpful to her business. She applied for a loan of PHP 5,000. She said she would use the loan to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers and hopefully acquire a piglet.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Koem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem K., 42, is the leader of a 4-member group loan offered by AMK, located in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. Each member of the group will use the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Koem K. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Khom Ouch, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. The couple has a 4-year-old child.
Mrs. Koem K. is requesting a loan of 400,000 Riels to buy fertilizers and to pay for pumping water to support her crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay for pumping water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cassavas and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Bakyala Kwekulakulana, Lugazi Group

texts.en:
She has been plying her business of secondhand clothing in Ajjija, Lugazi for the last eight years. With this business, 42-year-old S. Aminah has sustained herself and her family of nine children. All her children are in high institutions of learning. 

Before she fully ventured into the business of secondhand clothing, Aminah was preoccupied with farming. She still does some farming to supplement her minimal earnings.

Aminah mostly sells children’s and women’s clothing and her clients have mostly been women from the locality she operates from. Her good human and customer relationship skills have lent that much needed countenance as she operates her business. 

In general terms, the problem of inadequate capital has been Aminah’s main undoing throughout these years of operation. With this loan, Amina is optimistic that her  business will make headway. She is looking at buying more secondhand clothing to sell to her ever-increasing clientele.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand garments like trousers, shirts, jackets and vests

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is 40 years old, married with 4 children. Her children are doing well at school and this gives her joy as a mother. Her husband also works to support their home. She is a happy and hard working woman. She sells medicines and cosmetics at retail prices to make a living. She has been in this business since 10 years and she hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger in the future. She hopes for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more medicines and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Emma

texts.es: Emma, es una madre muy trabajadora, vive junto a su hijo en su casa que es propia.Se dedica a la preparación de tamales y humitas (platillos típicos peruanos); muele granos de maíz  y los amasa  para preparar sus productos. Después de su separación, emprendió este negocio, y ya lleva 8 meses comercializando sus tamales y humitas. Vende en el mercado aledaño a su barrio, y otras veces en lugares donde se realizan espectáculos folklóricos y algunas veces, le hacen pedidos, que vende muy bien a sus fieles clientes. Se siente motivada con su negocio, aunque le resulte difícil moler los granos con su máquina que esta un poco antigua. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio, y también quiere captar mayor cantidad de clientes, y después planea comprar sus artefactos electrodomésticos con el fin de mejorar  su negocio.Este es el primer préstamo con MFP, y sabe que el dinero  le será muy beneficioso para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente.Enma tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en comprar insumos, para continuar  elaborando sus tamales y humitas, y de ese modo busca consolidar sus clientes.
texts.en:
Emma is a hardworking mother who lives in her own home with her son. She prepares and sells tamales and “humitas” (traditional Peruvian dishes). Emma grinds the corn and mixes the dough that is used to make her products. She started this business after she separated from her husband and has already been selling tamales and humitas for eight months. Emma sells her products at the market near her neighborhood and occasionally in places where folkloric performances are held. Sometimes she accepts orders since her food sells well among her loyal customers. She is motivated by her business, but finds it difficult to grind the corn using her outdated machine. Her greatest wish is to expand her business and also attract more customers. Afterwards, she plans to buy electrical appliances to help improve her business.

This is her first loan with MFP. Emma knows that this money will be beneficial to increasing her operating capital, so she promises to submit her payments promptly. She plans to buy ingredients needed to continue making tamales and humitas so that she can strengthen her customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in preparing her dishes

loans.name: Soth

texts.en: Mrs. Soth N. lives with family members in a commune in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Soth N. makes a living by sewing clothes in a garment factory. Her husband, Mr. Sophal, is a 41-year-old building constructor and earns about $5 per day. They have three children, two of whom are employed; the other one attends school. Soth N. has a problem: her house doesn’t have electricity. She hopes to connect it by requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner, HKL, in the amount of $600 to be used to pay the fee of connecting a new electricity system for family use.

loans.use: To connect a new electricity system

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou B. is from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 39 years old. Marilou is married and has 2 school-aged children. Marilou owns and operates a business whose main source of income comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marichu's Group

texts.en:
Marichu S. is from Mantic, Tangub city. She is 31 years old. Marichu is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marichu is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marichu owns & operates a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Marichu has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marichu joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marichu is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marichu from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aura Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Aura Del Carmen, tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hija, de 7 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en la Alcaldía en proyectos, su cargo es de soldador. La señora se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante, generalmente vende los fines de semana y viaja entre semana para comprar mercadería a Managua.  Ella dio inicio con este negocio desde hace 2 años, fue su mama la que le enseño lo relativo al negocio de comercio, ya que ella vendía ropa y comerciaba en el mercado. Ella solicito este crédito con el objetivo de comprar más mercadea, para aprovechar la época de fiestas patrias que están próximas, desea comprar desde ahorita ya que los precios no han incrementado tanto. Su sueño es llegar a comprar un tramo en el mercado, para vender más. Aduce, el crédito le ayudara a obtener más utilidades y ella confía ganarse los clientes a los cuales les distribuirá sus productos.
texts.en:
Sra. Aura Del Carmen is 30 years old, married, and has a seven year old daughter. Her husband is a municipal employee, working as a welder on different projects. Aura sells general merchandise as a traveling merchant, usually generating sales on the weekends. During the week she travels to Managua to buy her merchandise. She started this business two years ago. Her mother taught her everything related to the retail business since she sold clothing as a trader at the market.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise so that she can take advantage of the upcoming patron saint festivals. Aura wants to buy now since prices have not increased as much. Her dream is to secure a booth at the market so that she can sell more. She says this loan will be put to good use and is confident that she can gain more customers who will buy her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old man from Gaza Strip. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee. As his salary is not that large, he opened a small cosmetics store with the help of his brother. The store has all the necessary cosmetics and make-up products, which are widely used as in every other place.

Ahmad wants to re-decorate his store.  He needed a $1,500 loan, which he took from FATEN for this purpose. Ahmad is saving money in order to get married soon and his work and store are helping him save.

Ahmad stands in his store in the picture.

loans.use: To re-decorate his store

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz  is from the village of Culpan, Aloran, Mis. Occ. . She is 31 years old. Luz  is married and has two very young children. To make a living, Luz owns  & operates a general store (Sari-sari store). 

Luz has been in this business for about 2 years  and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for this activity. In 2008, Luz  joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz  has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC amounting to PHP 10,000. Luz is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for her house repair project. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Luz from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to cover additional expenses for her house repair

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam C. is 42 years old, married and has two children aged seventeen and twelve. She is from the town of Banga in South Cotabato province on the Mindanao islands. Meriam runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She also helps her husband plant rice at their farm. She says their harvest is both for their own consumption and is also sold at the market.

Meriam joined CEVI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Meriam is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and buy additional merchandise to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is forty-five years old.  He lives with his wife and their five children in their own home in Tambogrande in the province of Piura.  Tambogrande is a primarily rural zone which consists of farmers squeezing a living out of the desert valleys through skillful use of irrigation systems.

The family raises animals and manages a small farm.  They own a number of sheep and pigs which they maintain in corrals near their home.  Juan also owns a small plot of land which he inherited from family.  He cares for the trees on the property, harvesting lemons and mangoes.

This is Juan´s first loan with our institution.  He plans to use the loan proceeds to purchase additional feed in bulk in order to ensure that their animals continue to grow and reach the appropriate size and weight for sale at the maximum price.  Juan hopes that the loan will assist his family in expanding their business and improving their life style.

loans.use: Purchase additional animals and feed

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona Q. is from the town of Veruela. She is 45 years old. Alona is single. To make a living, Alona owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Alona is happy that she is able to help her family financially.

Alona joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Alona is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia D. is 26 years old and married with two school-aged children. She is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. To make a living, Lelia runs a grocery store. She has been in her business for two years with a monthly net income of 2300 PHP.

In 2010, Lelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lelia is requesting her first loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the store.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for the business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca 57 años, es una madre de familia noble de un trato muy agradable, vive en compañía de su hija ya mayor, en su casa propia. Desde temprana edad ha incursionada en diversos trabajos, ya que su principal prioridad era sacar adelante a sus hijos. Hoy en día se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, ofreciendo estos productos a sus familiares, amigas y vecinas de su barrio, negocio que le va muy bien. El  buen trato que tiene le ha dado ventaja para ganar clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es recorrer las calles y conversar con sus clientes, puesto que así se mantiene en continua comunicación con ellos, además es bueno para su salud el caminar. En adelante, lo que más desea es comprarse vitrinas, para guardar y conservar sus productos en buen estado. Este es su 16avo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, para no perjudicar la confianza depositada en ella; de los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza, para cumplir los diversos pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Francisca, 57 years old, is the mother of a noble and pleasant family. She lives with her grown-up daughter in their own home. Since an early age she has participated diverse types of work, as her main priority has been to care for her children.  These days she sells beauty products to her relatives, friends and neighbours: a business which is going well for her. The good treatment that she offers has enabled her to win new clients. Her favourite part of her work is travelling through the streets and talking to her clients, as this allows her to maintain ongoing communication with them, as well as which the walking is good for her health. Furthermore, she really wants to purchase glass cabinets for storing and keeping her products in a good condition. This is her 16th loan via MFP and she is committed to making repayments in a timely fashion, so as not to damage the trust that has been placed in her by the members of her communal bank. With this loan, she will buy more beauty products in order to fulfil her clients' different requests.

loans.use: To stock beauty products

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is a 42-year-old married man with three children who are in school. He sells second-hand shoes to earn a living. He started the business ten years ago. His business has grown since he joined Faulu Kenya because he is able to access financial support. He sees himself becoming a successful businessman in the future. He has requested 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Yeth

texts.en:
Yeth S., 29, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for its rubber plantations. Her husband is a fisherman, earning an income of USD 2 per day. The family has to spend USD 41 on food, USD 2 on electricity, and USD 3 on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase fertilizer to improve her farming business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to improve the farming business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and two young children who attend school. He is from Lebanon. He has specialized in baking bread and pastry for 10 years and in 2005, he decided to open a small bakery. He is the only income source of the family.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to do some maintenance on the oven and repaint it so he can proceed with his baking work properly.

loans.use: To do some maintenance on the oven and repaint it

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana K. is 42 years old.  She is married and has two children. After graduating from school in Panfilovka village, Svetlana went to law school in Russia and started work as a lawyer in Barnaul town (Russia). There, she met her husband, who is also a citizen of Kyrgyzstan.  In 1988, they were married.  In 1991, they decided to come back to their native village in Kyrgyzstan, and with the money they saved, built a house and a small barn. 

In order to find a means of subsistence for her family, Svetlana decided to start a business in animal breeding and land cultivating.  With the initial capital of 1,500 KGS, Svetlana bought piglets to fatten and resell. Today, thanks to a persistent personality, Svetlana has a farm with two bull-calves and fifteen pigs, and cultivates barley and clover which is used as forage for her animals. With the aim of developing her farm, Svetlana took her first loan from Bai-Tushum and repaid it without any delay.
 
Svetlana has applied for another loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase more livestock. With the revenues generated, she plans to further increase the number animals on her farm. In the future, Svetlana dreams of opening a shop selling different kinds of meat products. 

About Bai-Tushum: 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Solidario Jireh Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Jireh: Este Grupo Esta Formado por tres señoras muy trabajadoras,La Señora Basti Astrid, se dedica a la venta de alimento y medicina para animales es un negocio que a hasta la fecha le a dejado un poco de ganacias pero solicita este credito para la compra de cocentrado para su veterinaria ya que quiere incrementar sus ventas para poder tener mas ganancias para ir creciendo en su negocio.
La Señora Maria Antonieta, se dedica a la crianza de animales ella nos cuenta que es un negocio que le a gustado porque ella cria los animales pollos,cerdos, desde pequeños y cuando estan grandes los vende su sueño es poder tener una granja mas grande para tener mejores ingresos solicita este credito para la compra de animales como pollos, cerdo para crianza y alimento para los mismos.
La señora Claudia Ester,tiene 40 años es casada tiene 3 hijos  se dedica a la venta de tortillas en los tres tiempos, y venta de productos medicinal
ella tiene ya tiempo de trabajar en este negocio,y se a trazado metas las cuales una de ellas es tener una tortilleria mas grande para poder distribuir en toda su comunidad donde vive,el credito que solicita es para la compra de maiz y contratar persona que le ayude,sus sueños es poder darñes a sus hijos la educacion nesesaria para que puedan ser unos profecionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Jireh Solidarity Group: This group has three, hard working members.  Basti Astrid sells feed and medicines for animals.  It’s a business that to date has produced a bit of profit but she’s asking for this loan to buy feed for her veterinary supply store to increase sales and earn more profits so that the business will grow.

María Antonieta raises animals.  She tells us that this is a business that she’s enjoyed because she raises chicks and piglets and when they are grown she sells them.  Her dream is to have a larger farm so that income will be higher.  She is asking for this loan to buy chick and pigs to raise and to buy feed for them.

Claudia Ester, 40, is married and has three children.  She sells tortillas in three shifts and also sells medical products. She has been in this business for some time now and one of the goals she has set out for herself is to have a larger tortilla shop in order to supply the entire community where she lives.  The loan she’s requesting is to buy corn and to hire a person to help her.  Her dream is to be able to provide her children with necessary education so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed, to buy animals to raise and to buy corn.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has been operating a second-hand clothes selling business for the past two years, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also sells green vegetables to contribute to her income. 

Fatuma faces a major challenge in the difficulty of selling during the rainy season, when it is a challenge to sell door to door in bad weather. She hopes to establish a clothes selling stall in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Fatuma wants to purchase four bundles of second hand clothes to resell. She decided to join after being introduced by friends who are already members of Yehu.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Valentina Del Carmen

texts.es: Valentina de 36 años de edad casado, labora para el MINED  de Juigalpa desde hace 16 años como docente. Esta solicitando su 7mo. credito con el objetivo terminar de un cuarto anexo a su casa ponerle las mochetas, persianas y repellar las paredes y brindarle a su familia  mejores condiciones de vida.  Cabe mencionar que el credito anterior lo utilizo para reparar el sistema electrico de su casa y ademas instalo el servicio de agua potable, expresa sentirse agradecida con AFODENIC y KIVA, pues gracias al apoyo brindado pudo hacer lo que necesitaba en su casa.
texts.en: Valentina is 36 years old and is married. She has been working for MINED of Juigalpa for 16 years as a teacher. She is requesting her 7th loan with the goal of completing a fourth annex to her house, by putting in the molding and baseboards, windows, and plaster the walls so she can give her family better living conditions. This is a good place to mention that she used her previous loan to repair her house’s electrical system and also to install running water. She says she is grateful to AFODENIC and Kiva, since with their help she was able to do what she needed in her house.

loans.use: to plaster her walls and put in windows

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes M. R. tiene 60 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.
