GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUC ÑAN se encuentra ubicado en la Comunidad Guanto Cruz, parroquia Guanujo, pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 22 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en cultivo de mora, maíz, cría de animales de corral y vacas lecheras para la elaboración de quesos. 

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de mora y maíz y a la cría de animales de corral comprar sus productos en Guaranda y los vende en la feria de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y animales de cría y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es trabajar para tener dinero para dar buena educación a los hijos.

Le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes M. R. is 60 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and 5 children in Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.  

The 'GRUPO DE MUJERES MUSHUCÑAN' community bank is located in Guanto Cruz community, in Guanujo parish, in Guaranda canton.  The 22 members of this group work in agriculture, growing blackberries and corn.  They also raise farmyard animals and dairy cows for making cheese.

Maria is a farmer who grows blackberries and corn.  She also raises farmyard animals.  She buys her supplies in Guaranda and sells her produce in Guaranda market.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy supplies, animals to raise, and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her work such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to work so that she has enough money to provide her children with a good education.

Maria enjoys having a rest.

loans.use: to buy supplies, animals to raise and feed for her animals

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene E. is from the village of Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 26 years old. Mylene is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mylene owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating tricycle (three-wheeled vehicle) transport services. Mylene is just starting this business.

In 2011, Mylene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mylene is requesting a loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be the first loan taken out by Mylene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories.

loans.name: Miriam Victoria

texts.es:
La Señora. Miriam Arizaga es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive por el barrio Las Peñas en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, fue nombrada en 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy calida  y con un gran carisma.

Doña Miriam tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija esta en una escuelita de la ciudad.  Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un vehiculo de una fabrica, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Miriam es consultora y se dedica a la venta de productos Yanbal, Avon y ropa por catalogo, actividad que  la desempeña hace 6 años, no tiene un horario fijo y trabaja   de domingo a domingo.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 9 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos y ropa.

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Miriam Arizaga is a member of La Paz community bank.  She lives in Las Peñas neighborhood, in the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate city which was named a World Heritage Site in 1999.  The locals are very warm and have a lot of charisma.

Miriam is 35 years old, married, and has two children aged 13 and 7.  Her eldest (a boy) is in high school and her youngest (a girl) is in a local elementary school.  Her husband is a driver and drives a factory vehicle.  Through their joint work, they have managed to build their own home.

Miriam is a beauty consultant and she sells Yanbal products, Avon products and clothes through catalogs.  She has been in this line of work for six years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday but does not work regular hours.

Miriam has been a member of her community bank for nine years and she will invest her new loan in buying cosmetics and clothes.  Her dream is for her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes

loans.name: Rigoberto Antonio

texts.es:
Rigoberto pequeño comerciante, con más de ocho años en las ventas, negocio que inicio con ahorros de su trabajo en  el exterior. Su negocio es una pulpería en donde también vende medicina general para obtener mejores ingresos.
Fue a través de Afodenic que aumento productos de mayor oferta  a sus clientes lo que espera seguir aumentando y creciendo para un bienestar común de la familia.
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo comprara: granos básicos, y productos farmacéutico como: zepol, cofal fuerte, panadol, aspirina, alkadel, pastilla para parásitos entre otros medicamentos, que son de mayor demanda. Teniendo mejores ganancias al vender variedad.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a small businessman with more than eight years of experience in sales. He started this business using the savings he accumulated from his regular job. His business is a general store where he also sells basic medicines to generate more income.

It was with the help of AFODENIC that he was able to increase the number of products that he offered to his customers. He hopes to continue increasing and growing for the good of his family.

Today Rigoberto is seeking a new loan to buy basic grains and pharmaceutical products such as menthol ointment, analgesic cream, acetaminophen, aspirin, alkaline tablets, anti-parasite pills, and other medicines that are in high demand. By selling a variety of items, he hopes to achieve better earnings.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains and various medicines to sell in his store.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a 60-yea- old widow from the Negev. Siham scraped by with welfare for many years until she decided to open a business activity from her home and nearby area. She started by selling treats, sweets and toys from her house and near the local elementary schools during breaks and at the end of the school day. A couple of years ago, she began selling these trinkets and clothes in an area near the city market. Gradually she has expanded her business and focused on clothing and in-demand items. Siham has seen her business provide a steady income and grow gradually over the last couple of years. She has grown out of her current location and is ready to move to a stall in the nearby souk, an open-air market.

Siham needed this loan to expand her business, move into a stall at the city market and for additional stock. This will ensure her a larger clientele and steadier income.

Siham wants to continue to manage her business. She hopes to begin saving steadily to ensure a safety net for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: El señor Carlos trabaja como chofer  con el taxi de su propiedad; el crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de tramites de transferencia del vehiculo. Vive en casa propia, la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; es divorciado,  tiene tres hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Carlos is a cab driver and he drives his own taxi. The loan he is requesting will be used to repay the transfer expenses of the vehicle. He lives in his own house in Achachicala, a neighborhood of the capital La Paz. He is divorced and has three children. This is the first time he is requesting a loan through IMPRO.

loans.use: To repay the transfer expenses of the taxi.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel  es de la comunidad de la Trinchera, es conocido por ser una persona que le gusta cooperar con la comunidad.
El es agricultor de toda la vida, y ahorita está dedicado únicamente al producto del plátano, es por eso que don Miguel solicita un préstamo de  $200 000 (doscientos mil colones) para la compra de los insumos necesarios para el mantenimiento de su plantación de plátano.
El es socio de La empresa de Crédito Comunal La Trinchera, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Miguel is from the community of Trinchera.  He is known as being a person who likes to work together with his community.

Miguel has been a farmer his whole life and now he is solely farming bananas.  He is requesting a loan for 200,000 colones to buy the supplies he needs to maintain his banana plantation.

Miguel is a member of the La Trinchera Community Loan Company, one of EDESA's 110 member companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his plantation

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua makes donuts and millet porridge for sale. She prepares this dish in the early hours of the morning, since most people prefer to eat it as breakfast. Ekua has received a senior high educational background. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She supports her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy flour, millet, sugar, salt, oil, and other ingredients. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, millet, sugar, salt, oil, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Andre Bernard

texts.fr:
Client de 48 ans, marie et pere de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 7 et 22 ans. N'ayany pas d'appui necessaire pour la poursuite de ses etudes , il se lance dans la coiffure homme.
Vu la frequence elevee des  clients, l'octroi du pret permettra de renforcer le materiel ou les outils de travail comme les chaises confortables, les tondeuses, le generateur electric, le ventilateur et un poste televiseur.

Il envisage de beaucoup epargner a partir de ses benefices afin de construire un salon de coiffure mixte et ainsi generer de l'emploi pour un jeune desoeuvre.
Soucieux et responsable de l'avenir de ses enfants, ul fait face a leurs droits.
texts.en:
This customer is 48 years old, married and father to three children, whose ages range from seven to 22 years old. Since he lacked the necessary support for his studies, he began a hairdressing activity for men. Given the high frequency of customers, the granting of this loan will allow him to boost his materials or work tools, by getting comfortable chairs, for instance, as well as hair clippers, an electric generator, a fan and a television. 

He is planning to save a large part of his profits so that he can build a hairdressing salon for men and women, and, as such, generate employment for an unemployed youth. Caring and responsible for his children's future, he is fighting for their rights.

loans.use: Acheter deux tondeuses, lames, de gilettes , douzaine de razoirs, ventilateur, generateur, chaises to buy two hair clippers, gillette blades, a dozen razors, a fan, a generator and chairs

loans.name: Mawar Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang lives in Pejarakan – Singaraja, North Bali. Though Ni Komang often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.    

Ni Komang is the head of the Mawar group, which is made up of 10 neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s second loan with MUK.  With the Rp. 1,500,000 that Ni Komang receives, she will purchase two piglets and pig feed and to renovate the barn. She hopes that the piglets will grow healthy, which she will then be able to sell.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to renovate her kitchen.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and pig feed and to renovate the barn

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana de 31 años junto a su esposo trabajan desde las 6:30am hasta las 22:00pm, ella cuenta que inició y aprendió el trabajo siempre con sus padres.El hecho de vivir en una zona de dificil acceso le hace temer ser víctima de la delincuencia, aunque aduce que ya es algo de lo que hay que cuidarse. 

Ella relata que cuando sus 2 niños llegan de la escuela le ayudan a atender a sus clientes, claro está luego de hacer sus tareas diarias. El hecho de abastecer la tienda le hace tener como prioridad no muy lejana de comprarse un vehículo, y es por este motivo que desea hacer un préstamo para comprar arroz, aceite, sal y viveres en general, con lo que podría reunir el dinero y lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Ana, age 31, and her husband work from 6:30 am to 10:00 pm. She tells us that she started and learned the business with her parents. Living in a hard-to-access zone makes her afraid of being a victim of crime, although she says that that is always something for which one should be on guard.

She tells us that when her 2 children arrive home from school, they help her to tend to her customers. This is, of course, after they do their daily homework. In order to stock her store, her priority for the near future is to purchase a vehicle. For this reason she wants to take out a loan to purchase rice, oil, salt and general supplies, with which she will gain the necessary money and achieve her goal.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, milk and general supplies.

loans.name: Tunu

texts.en:
Tunu is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business, selling retail and at the market to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a beauty salon business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, cooking fat and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, cooking fat, and charcoal.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería  y artesanía.

Rosa desde hace 3 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral, su corrales se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para qué pueda ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados y mejorar sus corrales, con los ingresos que obtenga puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Rosa es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia se supere y  tener mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 26 years old, lives with her husband and children in their own home. They don't have basic services (electricity, running water), since their home is located in a rural area of Tambogrande, in the department of Piura, an area known for its agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.
Rosa has been raising and selling sheep and barnyard fowl for the past three years. Her pens, which are outside her house, are large and well kept. She gives her animals balanced feed, grains, and grasses so they'll grow quickly and she can sell them in the regional markets. The profits she makes from selling the animals allow her to pay for her family's daily expenses.
She has requested a loaan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 soles to buy balanced feeds and improve her pens. The increased income will help pay off her loan and improve her family's quality of life. Rosa is a hard-working, responsible person whose only desire is for her family to get ahead and be better off economically.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and improve her animals' pens.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA”; este banco muy simpático está ubicado a 30 minutos de la Ciudad del Cusco en el poblado llamado Yuncaypata, este es un típico pueblito en el que se conserva toda la herencia andina pura, y viven todos en comunidad apoyándose en la época de siembra y cosecha, cuidando a sus hijos y a sus animales, es un pueblo muy bonito y es quechua hablante, está en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Basilia; la socia tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 15, 18, 26, 24, 20 años de edad;  la socia trabaja en agricultura  y a criar animales como aves de corral, chanchos, ovejas y vaca, la socia lleva  a vender sus productos como cereales a la ciudad de Cusco en los diferentes mercados, la socia ahora desea el crédito solo por esta vez para invertir en los acabados de sus vivienda, la socia y su esposo terminaron de construir su casa y ahora desean revestir la fachada, la socia está muy feliz de poder lograr el acabado de sus propia casa les costó tanto hacer cada paso que ahora solo quieren terminarla. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de yeso, estuco, y todo lo referente a los pagos a los obreros para hacer el revestimiento de su fachada en su vivienda.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE YUNCAYPATA. This is a friendly communal bank that is located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco in the village called Yuncaypata. This is a typical little village in that it retains its pure Andean heritage, and they live together in a supporting community, planting and harvesting, caring for their children and their animals, in a very pretty town where they speak Quechua, and in the department of Cusco.

Brasilia, a member of the communal bank is 45 years old, married with 5 children who are 26, 24, 20, 18, and 15 years old. She works in agriculture and raising animals such as poultry, pigs, sheep and cows. She sells her products such as cereal in various markets in the city of Cusco.

She is asking for a loan at this time to finish her house. She and her husband completed building their house and now want to cover the facade. She is very happy to be able to finish off her own house where each step cost so much and now only wants to complete it. She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of plaster, stucco, and related expenses to pay the workers for covering the facade of her home. She is thankful and grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time as she has done in her previous loans.

loans.use: to buy plaster, stucco, and to pay workers the related expenses for covering the facade of her house

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Mr. Nou is a 36 year-old man who has been living in Kompong Speu province. He operates a business as a firewood seller. Everyday, Mr. Nou picks up the firewood from the nearby forest, buy it from suppliers at a lower cost. He then puts the firewood in his trailer and transports it to sell in a local market for profit. 

Mr. Nou has a life partner in his wife who is a local rice cultivator. Besides farming, his wife also assists Mr. Nou in selling the firewood. They are blessed with three unmarried children who are attending school and live from the same income. 

This humble family normally earns $3USD per day to meet the family’s needs. With the coming rainfall, Mr. Nou and his wife don’t have enough capital to use on their farm. To solve the problem, Mr. Nou is applying for a loan from Kiva to buy some farming materials such as rice seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies to start the farming business. In the future, Mr. Nou hopes that he will be able to send all his children to finish at least high school.

loans.use: to buy some farming materials such as rice seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Fleming

texts.en:
Fleming is 48 years old. He is married and together they have five children. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last twelve years. His farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for maize farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan, with which he is planning to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, to increase his maize production and to educate his children. 

His dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 34 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.  Geraldine runs a sari sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years.  She sells a variety of items such as detergents, canned goods, and other groceries. 

Geraldine is requesting a loan for  20,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy more items to sell.  Geraldine would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Emilson Alexander

texts.es:
Emilson, tiene 33 años de edad, casado desde hace 10 años, su esposa trabaja en una maquiladora como operaria, vive en La Lima Cortes, tienen 2 hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad, quienes están estudiando.

Emilson tiene un microbús desde hace 8 años, con el cual presta el servicio de transporte escolar, traslada niños a la escuela y colegios, este negocio lo tiene debido a que sus hijos tenían dificultad de transporte para ir a la escuela, entonces decidió hacerlo y tiene sus clientes fijos.
El préstamo lo va a invertir en reparar su microbús, le cambiará el motor para que no le siga fallando y dar un mejor servicio.  De este negocio obtiene los ingresos necesarios para el hogar y estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emilson, age 33, has been married for ten years.  His wife works in a factory as a laborer.  He lives in La Lima Cortes.  They have two children; ages eight and nine.  The children go to school.

Emilson has had a mini-bus for eight years.  He uses to bus to provide school transportation.  He transports children to elementary schools and high schools. He has this business because his children had trouble finding transportation to go to school.  He then decided to provide the transportation, and he has fixed customers.

He will use the loan to repair his mini-bus.  He will change the motor so that it does not continue to break down.  Then he will provide better service.  He gets the income he needs for the household and his children’s education from this business.

loans.use: to buy a new motor for his school mini-bus.

loans.name: Kapeneta

texts.en:
Kapeneta is a married mother, who is 52 years old, and has two kids.

Kaneta owns and operates a business venture, raising pigs for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Kapeneta needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2010, Kapeneta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Kapeneta's second loan with SPBD. 


*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anyas

texts.en:
Anyas is a 23-year-old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her mother and two siblings. Her siblings are both working in addition to their mother, who is the one covering the family’s expenses. 

As for Anyas, she has been working as a private teacher for the past four years from her home. She is intelligent and expert in her field. Today she is asking for a loan of $800 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase a laptop for her business. She notes that this will allow her to develop her way of teaching and thus her communication with her students.
 
In the future, she plans to open her own learning center.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop for her business.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Sara, quién  invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. Ellas aceptaron gustosas y de allí surgió el grupo. Ellas están trabajando en forma conjunta, ayudándose para poder salir adelante.
La sra. Cynthia, es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas y lencería. Esta acompañada  hace 8 años con el señor Diego quien se dedica a la Herrería, tienen dos hijas menores que van a la primaria. Ella comenta que su negocio de bebidas va muy bien, por que siempre tiene muchos clientes, es por ello que le gustaría seguir invirtiendo en el.
Solicita crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, como ser vinos, cervezas, energizantes y demás, para poder abastecerse. Ella sueña con habilitar un negocio propio en su casa donde pueda ofrecer a sus clientes buena variedad de comidas y bebidas, logrando así aumentar sus ingresos y brindarle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The contact for starting this communal bank was Sara. She invited and organized her friends to become part of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendoras (Enterprising Women) program. They were happy to do so, and the group came about from that. They are working jointly, helping one another move forward.

Cynthia is one of the members. She sells drinks and lingerie. She has been together with Diego for eight years. He is an ironworker. They have two daughters who are minors, and go to primary school. 

She says that her drinks business is going very well, because she always has a lot of customers. This is why she likes to continue investing in it. She is applying for a loan in order to stock up on all kinds of drinks, such as wine, energy drinks, and others. 

She dreams about setting up her own business in her home, where she can offer her clients a good variety of meals and drinks, and so manage to increase her income, and provide the best for her family.

loans.use: To buy drinks for later sale.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is 46 years old and married to Mohamed. They have four children.

She has been in the business of cooking and selling food for the last five years, from which she earns a monthly income of KES 50,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She plans to use the funds to buy foodstuffs (wheat and rice) for cooking and selling, and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs (wheat and rice).

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz y vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, es muy rica en su cultura, su gente es muy amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
Doña María tiene 27 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una niña de 3 años de edad. Su esposo labora en una carpintería, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de periódicos, revistas y billetes de lotería, esta actividad la realiza hace 10 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de revistas, periódicos y billetes de lotería para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
27-year-old Maria is a member of the community bank 'Loma de la Cruz' and lives in the city of Cuenca. The city is rich in culture with beautiful architecture, and it's people are very friendly and strive to maintain their culture and traditions.
 
María is married, with a 3-year-old child. Her husband is a carpenter, and they are currently renting their home as they do not not have their own.

María sells newspapers, magazines and lottery tickets. She has had this business for 10 years and works from Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule.
 
This is María's fourth loan cycle with her community bank. She will invest the money in the purchase of magazines, newspapers and lottery tickets to continue with her business.
 
María's goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: to purchase magazines, newspapers and lottery tickets for her business.

loans.name: Vestine.

texts.en: Vestine is 39 years old. She has no children yet. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver. She has spent 16 years selling pots for decoration. With the loan, she will buy more pots for decoration. She expects to use the profits for renovating the house. In the future, she dreams to start her business outside of the country because she has realized that the pots for decoration are really in demand.

loans.use: To buy more pots for decoration to sell.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella quiere continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayuda a incrementar el capital del negocio y también se siente motivada para continuar trabajando en  su negocio, ella continua con el negocio de la elaboración de pan entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo harina, azúcar,  manteca y mantequilla.
texts.en:
Juana thanks the investors for the loan and is happy for the support given. She wishes to continue participating in this project because it helps her increase her working capital. She also feels motivated to continue working in her business.

She continues with the business of making bread and in this opportunity needs the loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, lard and butter.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, lard and butter.

loans.name: Francisca Concepción

texts.es:
Francisca Concepción es originaria del municipio de El sauce, un poblado ubicado al occidente de Nicaragua donde sus habitantes se caracterizan por su buena hospitalidad y amabilidad.
Ella es madre soltera de tres hijos todos en edad escolar y le ha tocado ser madre y padre a la vez para sacarlos adelante sola.
Conchita como popularmente y por cariño la conocen en el pueblo se desempeña como obrera en el Hospital de dicho municipio donde tiene cuatro años de laborar.
Le ha tocado una vida dura con la mala situación económica de Nicaragua porque no se encuentra trabajo fácilmente, ya que ha trabajado de mesera en restaurantes, de cocinera todo por llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar pero se siente orgullosa de desempeñar este trabajo que es digno y ahora con la bendición de Dios que encontró este trabajo estable.
Conchita necesita el crédito para la compra de medicamentos, realización de exámenes médicos, ultrasonidos para un familiar que necesita de su apoyo y se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de este apoyo, ya que sus compañeras de trabajo le recomendaron que hay unos inversionistas llamados Kiva que apoyan a las personas de escasos recursos.
Espera que le apoyen.
texts.en:
Francisca Concepción is originally from the town of El Sauce, which is located in western Nicaragua. The residents are known for their warm hospitality and friendliness. She is a single mother of three children who are of school age, therefore, she helps them move forward by playing the role of both mother and father at the same time.

Conchita, as she is popularly and affectionately known in her town, has been working at a municipal hospital for the past four years. She has had a hard life due to the bad financial situation in Nicaragua, which makes it difficult to find work. Conchita worked in restaurants as a waitress and as a cook in order to provide for the daily household needs. She is proud that the work she had done was dignified, but now God has blessed her with a stable job.

Conchita is requesting a loan in order to pay for medicines, medical exams, and ultrasounds for a relative who needs her assistance. She came to the office of CEPRODEL in search of this support. Her coworkers have recommended her to the Kiva lenders as being a person with limited resources. She hopes to have the support.

loans.use: to pay for medicines, medical exams, and ultrasounds for a relative.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a single mother in charge of caring for two children. Her aunt motivated her to start her own business three years ago, shortly after her husband left her. Today she operates a shop out of her house where she sells kitchen products and other household items. Her first source of finance was her aunt, who lent her $50 so that she could get her business going. With that money she made a down payment to a wholesale seller for pots, silverware and fabrics. She says that she has come a long way in these past three years but still feels the pressure of being the sole provider for her children. She is seeking a loan in order to diversify her product offerings and to make her shop look a little more professional.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new products

loans.name: Jumshud

texts.en: Jumshud was born in 1958 in Sumgait. Difficulties of life forced them to start the business. He is 49. He is the only breadwinner in the family. In the beginning he used to sell fish to restaurants. Having borrowed $300 he has bought the fishing-tackles. Jumshud applies for a $1200 loan. He plans to buy a small boat.

loans.use: He plans to buy a small boat

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh is 69. Her husband died a long time ago. She lives with her three sons who are between the ages of 23 and 34. The sons work as laborers, but the work is not stable. Although she is too old to work, she can make baskets out of bamboo to earn extra money for her family. Their income is $7 per person per month. She is requesting a loan of $75 to purchase bamboo to make more baskets and increase her family's income

loans.use: To purchase bamboo for making baskets

loans.name: Osaafiane

texts.en: "I am proud to be a member of LAPO because LAPO has helped my business grow, and I now can send my children to school," says Mrs. A. Osaafiane, 28 years old.  A. is requesting a loan of $750 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more jewelery and drinks for sale

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
At 40, Mrs. Abla A. is unmarried and has three children. She also supports two orphans. Her main activity is the buying and selling of poultry in the markets around her village. This business brings in enough income to meet the daily requirements of her family. However, she is still very limited in her financial resources, especially as she has no one to help her. Mrs. A. is asking today for a loan of $500 to put into her business. In view of her earnings that always show a surplus and her dynamic attitude towards work, she is more than capable of making a profit on this loan and paying it back promptly.

A 40 ans, Madame A. Abla est célibataire avec trois (3) enfants. Elle supporte aussi deux (2) orphelins. Son activité principale est l’achat et la vente de volailles dans les marchés environnants de son village. Ce commerce lui rapporte assez de revenus nécessaires pour assurer le quotidien de sa famille. Cependant elle est très limitée en matière de ressources financières d’autant plus qu’elle n’a personne pour lui apporter des aides. Madame A. Abla sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $500 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce. Au vu de son compte d’exploitation toujours excédentaire et son dynamisme au travail, elle est bien capable de rentabiliser ce crédit et de le rembourser promptement.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying and selling poultry

loans.name: Thelma Odilia

texts.en: I am dedicated to selling natural medicines like manzanillas, anise, romero, cinnamon, linseed, and others. I also sell vegetables and plastic boats in a market in the city of Tegucigalpa, Honduras. I have been doing this for 11 years. With the profits from the sales, I have been maintaining my family and the expenses of studies and medicines for my children. My husband and I work hard from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. to be able to maintain our family.

loans.use: Purchase of natural medicine and vegetables

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas told us that besides beautiful sightseeing at the jungle, tourists can enjoy an infinite amount of exotic beverages. These are fabricated by Tomas and his crew with extreme hygiene. They utilize native medicinal plants from their dear Peruvian land. These beverages can only be enjoyed in this region. The vast amount and variety of plants and fruits allow the diversity of flavors and fragrances in the beverages.

Tomas has, without a doubt, been able to exploit these benefits to their maximum due to his experience and vast knowledge about the beverage preparation. This is why, with lots of sacrifice, he was able to open a bar at his community that sells a great variety of high quality beverages.

He's only been married for a short time so he doesn't have any children. He maintains his hopes high and his purpose of acquiring his own home and the necessary furniture so that when children come, they'll be able to enjoy some comfort. Nonetheless, in order to complete these goals, he needs all our support and requests a loan to make his promising business grow. Lets make this happen so that a lot more people are able to enjoy these excellent beverages from the Peruvian jungle.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Tomas nos contó que además de encontrar hermosos paisajes en la selva, los turistas pueden disfrutar de un sin número de bebidas exóticas fabricadas por ellos mismos con mucha higiene y utilizando plantas medicinales oriundas de su querida tierra peruana y que solamente pueden disfrutarse en esta zona, ya que la gran cantidad de plantas y frutas posibilitan la diversidad de sabores y fragancias en las bebidas, razón que sin duda ha sabido explotar al máximo con su experiencia y amplio conocimiento en su preparación. Así con sumo sacrificio logró aperturar en su comunidad un bar en el que expende gran variedad de bebidas de muy buena calidad. Él está casado hace muy poco tiempo, por lo que no tiene hijos y mantiene todo el ánimo con el propósito de adquirir su propia casa y los muebles que son necesarios para que así cuando lleguen los niños estos puedan gozar de comodidad.Sin embargo para cumplir estas metas es necesario del apoyo de todos nosotros y solicita un préstamo para acrecentar su prometedor negocio. Posibilitemos su petición para que muchas más personas puedan disfrutar de estas excelentes bebidas de la selva peruana.

loans.use: Inject capital to  enlarge the small business of typical alcoholic beverage sales

loans.name: Paula's Group

texts.es:
Julia is 39 years old with three children, Paula is 37 years old with three children, and Karina is 27 years old with no kids.

Julia, Paula and Karina have belonged to the Gratitud Comunal Bank for 1,4,1 years respectively and Paula is the president of the bank.

Julia makes bread and has a little grocery store. Both business are run in her house and it has been for the last 4 years.

On the other hand, Karina sells treats, in the fairs of Matara and Seccelambras, activity that learned when she helped her aunt.

Paula has a grocery warehouse and she tells us that at the beginning she had a small store and it needed capital and that’s how she joined the Communal Bank. At the present time her grocery warehouse has assorted groceries and has implemented a liquor store, in addition she’s thinking on implementing another didactic department of material for gardens.

They need a loan of $625 together, which will be used to purchase flour, sugar, butter, treats, chocolates, cakes, candy, beer, wine and pisco.

The partners are friends and companions and tell that in the Communal Bank they learned the responsibility, punctuality and mainly the saving. Their dreams are to implement a new business, have more capital, finish their studies and that their children go to university.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Julia tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Paula tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, mientras que Karina tiene 27 años y no tiene hijos. Julia, Karina y Paula pertenecen al Banco Comunal Gratitud desde hace 1, 4, 1 años respectivamente y actualmente Paula es Presidenta de su Banco Comunal. Julia elabora panes y además tiene una tienda de abarrotes, y ambos negocios los realiza en su casa desde hace 4 años. Por otro lado Karina vende golosinas en las ferias de Matara y Seccelambras, actividad que aprendió cuando ayudaba a su tía. Paula tiene una bodega y nos cuenta que al inicio tenía una tienda pequeña y le faltaba capital y fue así que entró al Banco Comunal. En la actualidad ella tiene una bodega surtida y ha implementado una licorería que cuenta con variedad de productos, además ella piensa implementar otro negocio de material didáctico para jardines. Ellas necesitan préstamos de 400 soles, 600 soles y 800 soles, que serán invertidos en la compra de harina, azúcar, manteca, golosinas, chocolates, galletas, caramelos, cerveza, vinos y pisco. Las socias son amigas y compañeras y cuentan que en el Banco Comunal aprendieron la responsabilidad, puntualidad y sobre todo el ahorro. Los sueños de Julia, Karina y Paula son implementar un nuevo negocio, tener mas capital para su negocio, una tienda de golosinas, terminar sus estudios y que sus hijos estudien en la universidad.

loans.use: Julia, Paula and Karina need a loan of $625, which will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, butter, cookies, chocolates, cakes, candies, beer, wine and pisco.

loans.name: Thi Chien

texts.vi:
Mrs Chiến is 30 years old. She has 2 children who are attending school. Her main occupation is farming and pig raising. She also collects and sells waste metal to gain extra money. Her husband works in construction so he is often away from home. She never had a loan before. She joined Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) because she likes the weekly repayment condition. She applies for a loan of 150 USD to invest into her business to raise the production.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Chiến, 30 tuổi, có hai con nhỏ còn đang đi học. Nghề chính là làm ruộng và nuôi lợn, nhưng bên cạnh đó, chị đi chợ đồng nát để tăng thu nhập. Chồng chị là thợ xây nên thường đi xa để làm. Gia đình chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Chị tham gia vay vốn của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc vì chị thích được tiết kiệm để trả góp hàng tuần. Số tiền 2006000đ vay được từ Chương trình chị dùng để tăng gia sản xuất.

loans.use: Chăn nuôi lợn

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duong Thi D., 52 years old, is an exemplary member of the branch. She was one among the first 5 members of TYM Fund in the area. She also encouraged other people to join the Fund. Her early plan was to invest in breeding pigs and work on rice field. However, since there was policy allowing people to exchange the rice field for other-purpose land, she bravely invested money and effort in transforming the land into the fish ponds and orchards. Her family income from the fish ponds in 2007 was approximately 3000 USD. Currently, her family is working on 3 rice fields, 4 fish ponds. Therefore, she is very busy at this time. However, she still manages to find some spare time to join activities of the area. She is elected to be the head of her living area. Her husband is very sympathetic with her work and is a great help to her. Her business plan is going very well; therefore, she wants to borrow 950 USD to buy more fishes and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Đường Thị D., 52 tuổi, là một thành viên gương mẫu của cụm. Ngay từ những ngày đầu khi Quỹ về, chị là một trong 5 thành viên đầu tiên, ngoài ra chị còn tích cực vận động nhiều thành viên khác cùng tham gia. Dự án ban đầu chỉ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và làm ruộng nhưng từ khi hợp tác xã có chính sách dồn điền đổi thửa, gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư tiền của, công sức cải tạo ruộng đào ao thả cá kết hợp trồng cây ăn quả. Thu nhập từ cá năm 2007 vừa qua khoảng 3000USD. Hiện tại gia đình cấy 3 mẫu lúa, gần 4 mẫu ao thả cá, hàng ngày chị tập trung toàn bộ thời gian vào công việc nên rất tất bật. Mặc dù vậy chị vẫn dành thời gian cho việc đi sinh hoạt và các công việc chung của cụm được chị em tín nhiệm bầu làm cụm trưởng. Chồng chị rất hiểu và tạo mọi điều kiện để chị hoàn thành công việc chung. Dự án đang trên đà phát triển nên chị D. tiếp tục xin vay 950USD mua cá giống và thức ăn.

loans.use: Buy fishes and food for them

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
The sale of cold drinks and good customer service is the daily routine for Josefina. She has a small stand well located along the lake in Yarinacocha. She is very pleased to be in such a good location as many people come through and lots of tourists come to enjoy the natural beauty. Josefina is 41 years old and the mother of 2 children, both of them are now independent and working. She would like to remodel her stand to be able to serve the greater numbers of tourists who visit her small business.

La venta de bebidas heladas y otorgar una buena atención es la rutina diaria que desempeña con mucha alegría la señora Josefina, quien posee un pequeño espacio de ventas en un lugar muy apropiado y a orillas de la laguna de Yarinacocha (Pucallpa), está muy contenta de estar en este lugar ya que concurre a diario mucha gente de todos los lugares y sobre todo turistas para apreciar la belleza de este incomparable paisaje. Josefina a sus 41 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos quienes son profesionales e independientes.Desea iniciar su plan de remodelación para acoger a mayor cantidad de turistas en su pequeño centro de ventas.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO REMODEL HER SMALL STAND TO BETTER SERVE THE GROWING NUMBER OF TOURISTS WHO VISIT HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos P. Dure (58) is married to Adelina Escobar (50). The couple lives in Bertoni - San Estanislao and they work as partners. While Amos sells, house by house, natural medicines and other products such as thread, elastic bands and buttons, Adelina stays at the grocery store they have in their house. Both have been in this business since 2000. They are characterized as being very hardworking people and good partners who always help each other in difficult situations. They want to take out a loan in order to buy more products and hence to satisfy the huge demand they have.

loans.use: Purchase of products such sugar, flour, pasta, soda, natural medicine, eggs, meat, bread, etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Amina M., who is married and has two children aged 4 months and 6 years. Amina owns a butcher business and requires a loan in order to purchase three cows and pay for their transportation. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase three cows and pay for their transportation.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun S., 45, is married and has five children. She and her husband have owned a plot of farmland growing rice crops and various kinds of vegetables since 1988. 

Besides growing crops, her husband also works climbing palm trees around his house in order to collect palm juice which is refined as palm sugar. With the farming activity, she and her husband makes collectively around $3.50/day. Traditionally, the palm juice refining business is considered  a traditional way of making income for Cambodian countryside people. 

Mrs. Bun S. and her husband are requesting a loan from KIVA to buy more seeds, insecticide and fertilizer to expand their crops in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase insecticide and fertilizer to produce a fertile soil and improved crop production

loans.name: Mir Abdul Woli

texts.en:
M. Abdul Woli is married. He has the responsibility for his family. He has a gas shop. He is new in his business. Woli was in Pakistan with members of his family. When he came back, he opened up a shop selling gas in Kabul. He is working hard but still he is unable to enlarge his shop.

So Woli has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and expand his business to make good monthly income for his family to help them do better in Kabul.

He is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan. He would like to thank both AFSG and Kiva that help people who are hard workers.

loans.use: To expand his business and complete his stock

loans.name: Sanela

texts.en: Sanela is a student, and she lives with her parents. She doesn't work for now, and she decided to ask for this loan in the amount of 1200 KM because she wants to buy seeds for sowing in the greenhouse. After they grow, she will sell them to earn money for school. She wants to ensure that she has enough money to finish her studies and to find a job so that she can help her parents with her salary.

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Patima's Daima Tudumu Group

texts.en:
Patima is 36 years old. She is divorced with four children, aged 15, 13, 10 and 2 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2006. She works every day from 6 am to 8 pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

In the past, Patima has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Khadija, who has a business selling firewood.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en: Aisha began selling charcoal in Zanzibar earlier this year.  She works from 8:00am to 10:30pm every day and earns a monthly profit of approximately $60.  She is now taking out her first loan from BRAC Tanzania in order to buy a greater inventory of charcoal, so that she can increase her sales.  Aisha is 25 years old, married, and has two children.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Ashura.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Sum N., 26, is married and lives with one of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers and rice sellers who typically make about US$10 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sum N. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase more rice from individual growers to resell. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase rice for sale.

loans.name: Apronia B.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Apronia K. from Kyela, divorced with one child aged 14. Apronia has been running a crops business since 2006, buying crops from farmers and bringing them to town where she can sell them at a higher price.

Working at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and assisted by her mother, Apronia currently earns about $30 per month. She is requesting a loan of $250 in order to purchase maize, beans and rice, and in the future plans to establish another business. Apronia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase maize, beans and rice.

loans.name: Mbagnan

texts.en:
Mbagnan K. is a married man with 2 children, and he received schooling through senior high. His wife is a trader.

Since 2003, Mbagnan has been in the business of selling yams at Praso near Elmina. With the income generated from his business, he is able to pay for his children's school fees, utility bills, and other family expenses. Now, he is seeking a loan to buy more yams in order to meet the demands of his customers. Mbagnan is hoping to generate an increase in his business profits, which will enable him to someday build a house for his family.

loans.use: To expand his business and meet customer demand by purchasing additional yams

loans.name: Nelinda

texts.es:
NELINDA VÁSQUEZ OCHAVANO, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valientes” ubicado en el Jr. Coronel Portillo N° 836 del Distrito de Callería tiene 36 años de edad, 01 hija, madre soltera.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compro tarjetas telefónicas al por mayor, vendía en el frontis de su casa, complementando con productos de belleza.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,700.00 Nuevos Soles, compro más productos de belleza y accesorios.

Agradezco a Manuela Ramos por confiar en mi persona.
texts.en:
Nelinda Vasquez Ochavano is a member of the Communal Bank "Corageous Women", located in the Calleria District. She is 36 years old and is the single mother of one daughter. She used the first loan that she received (300 soles) to purchase phone cards and cosmetics that she sold out of her home. This new loan of 1,700 soles is to purchase more cosmetics and accessories. Nelinda is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for the trust she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru: Юсупов Mухамад проживает в Гиссарском районге. Возраст 50 лет. Женат и имеет четверых детей.  Жена нигде не работает. Сам он работает сварщиком . Имеет точку  на рынке. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы закупить метал , для работы. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhammad U. lives in Gissar. He is 50 years old and is married with four children. His wide is unemployed. Muhammad works as a welder. He has a welding point at the market. He is applying for a loan in order to be able to puchase welding materials. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: welding materials

loans.name: Farakh

texts.en:
Farakh M. has two children to take care of and provide daily sustenance. He has dedicated himself to the agriculture industry since he was very young, has acquired experience and in this way is able to maintain his family. Today this gentleman needs to promptly acquire the economic resources to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants for planting wheat, watermelon and onion. This was Farakh's motive for coming to IMON International to obtain the loan necessary for the purchase so that he can continue caring for his humble family that really needs his support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Шафоат 50 лет, замужем имеет 5 детей. Она продает хозяйственными товарами. Ее товар, это кипятильники,  батареи, лампочки и туалетные бумаги. Она торгует 10 лет. Ее магазин находиться среди ряда хозяйственного товара. Торговля идет с 8 утра до 5 вечера.С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2007 года. Кредит получает на расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Shafoat is 50 years old, is married and has 5 children. She sells household products. Her products include water boilers, batteries, light bulbs and toilet paper. She has been a saleswoman for 10 years. Shafoat’s store is located in the middle of a row of household products. Sales occur from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening. Shafoat has been working with MicroInvest since 2007. She is taking out a loan to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. Both of her children are in the primary school. Mary lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver. 


Mary is a trader who works to support her husband financially.  She trades in textiles and ladies’ underwear. She sells her goods at the local market and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Mary buys her materials from wholesalers in Accra. She has been in business for more than eight years now and is seeking a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She hopes to provide all of her children a college education.

loans.use: To buy textiles and underwear.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.en:
Vũ Thị Được is a 57 year old female living in the town of Nam Định. She is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Vũ Thị Được owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Được has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 300000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2006, Vũ Thị Được joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Được is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 4th taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Moinposho

texts.en:
G. Moinposho is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life for her family. She is married and the mother of three children. Moinposho has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. She was able to open her own shop at her home 13 years ago and has been successful because her customers have recognized the high quality of her products. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Today Moinposho is applying for a loan to IMON International for the seventh time. She is requesting 4000 Somoni that she will spend to purchase summer fabrics for sewing national dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of Moinposho’s family. She sincerely appreciates your support and thanks you!   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase summer fabric

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Bayarmagnai N. lives with her husband and two teenage children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her children are both high school students. Her husband, Dorjderem, has a small retail business butchering animals to prepare their meat for selling.

Bayarmagnai runs a small retail business in second-hand clothing. Since 2003, she has been selling second-hand clothes at the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. She purchases the clothes in large boxes from the wholesale market in Ulaanbaatar and sells individually-priced clothes at the stall that she rents at the Narantuul market. From the beginning, she has gained significant experience in retail.

In the future, she intends to expand her business by adding new clothes imported from Beijing, China. She requests a loan to purchase more second-hand clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lamine Sangaré est âgé de 28 ans et n’a pas d’enfant. Il vit  chez son père avec son épouse et d’autres parents dans le quartier Dougounina de Bougouni. (troisième région administrative du Mali).
Nanti d’un diplôme en comptabilité, il  reste pendant des années dans le chômage. Pendant cette période, il a tenté plusieurs activités sans réussite. C’est ainsi que Monsieur Lamine Sangaré décida  d’apprendre  l’activité de meunier auprès de son père qui détenait un moulin. Avec une expérience de 10 ans, Monsieur Lamine Sangaré maîtrise  bien cette  activité et est sollicité par une clientèle  composée surtout  des femmes.
Dans le souci de rénover son moulin il décide de rejoindre Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Monsieur Lamine compte acheter un nouveau dynamo  à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès du représentant de sa marque.
Il espère réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA qu’il compte utiliser pour entretenir son moulin, payer les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Lamine Sangaré is 28 and has no children. He and his wife live with his father and other relatives in the Dougounina neighborhood in Bougouni (third administrative region of Mali).

Although he has a diploma in accounting, he has been out of work for years. During this period, he tried various business activities without success. Thus, Mr. Lamine Sangaré decided to learn to be a miller together with his father who has a mill. With 10 years experience, Mr. Lamine Sangaré is very knowledgeable in this business and is much in demand with a clientele made up primarily of women.

With the intention of repairing his mill, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan. He intends to buy a new dynamo in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from the representative of that brand of mill.

He hopes to make a monthly profit of 65,000 F CFA that he intends to use to maintain his mill, pay the interest on the loan, and contribute to family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a dynamo for his mill

loans.name: Gayatri

texts.en:
Mrs. Gayatri D., 36 years old and a resident of Kuleshwor, lives in a single family with her husband and two sons. Both her sons are studying in pre-primary school. Her husband, Mr. Shyam D., is a driver.
Mrs. D. opened her grocery store five years ago to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of grocery goods in her store. She even sells mineral water and vegetables in her shop.
Now Mrs. D. is requesting an Rs 20000.00 loan to buy grocery goods such as noodles, biscuits, vegetables and mineral water for her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es: En la zona de villa Tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Gaviotas” , esta formado por doce mujeres que trabajan de manera organizada hace seis años aproximadamente. Las actividades que realiza la asociación, son de todo tipo, una de ellas tiene un puesto de electrodomésticos, también se dedican a venta de cosméticos, ropa, celulares, maletines, además otras de ellas se dedican al tejido artesanal, ahora necesitan comprar materia prima y mercadería para ampliar sus ventas
texts.en:
In a district of the village Tejada, you will find the Gaviotas center to which the Gaviotas association belongs. It is comprised of 12 women who have worked together in an organized manner for, approximately, the last six years. The association includes activities of all types. One of the women has a household appliances stall, others sell cosmetics, clothing, cell phones and briefcases, and still others sell handcrafted weaving. Now they need to buy raw materials and merchandise to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials and Increase of Inventory

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: yacine S. est vendeuse de poissons au marche de camberene depuis trois qns.elle est parent beneficiaire et exerce cette activite pour soutenir sa petite famille.elle sollicite un pret de cent cinquante mille (150 000)pour aug,enter son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Yacine S. has been a fish seller at the Camberene market for three years. She is a recipient parent and operates this small business to support her family. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Jamale

texts.en: Jamale is a 47-year-old married woman. Twenty years ago when she was newly married, she opened her own business selling beauty products and clothes. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios R. is from the village of  Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old. Remedios is widowed and has 12 adult children. To make a living, Remedios owns and operates a specialized retail store, where she sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Remedios has been in business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Remedios from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her product offering

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora ELENA G. S. , tiene 53 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES VALEROSAS.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to  de Secundaria.
La socia es casada  y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 dependen económicamente de ella.
ELENA se dedica venta de productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, pan, golosinas, gaseosa, cerveza, etc.
En la tienda de comestibles que tiene en su casa.
El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de productos alimenticios para abastecer su tienda.
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar más productos alimenticios para abastecer su tienda de comestibles y así tener todo lo que sus clientes le solicitan.
La empresaria sueña aumentar sus ventas y empezar a vender todo lo que sus clientes le solicitan así ganar mas clientela y aumentar sus ganancias.

loans.use: comprará más productos alimenticios como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc.

loans.name: Jane Wanjiku

texts.en:
Jane has a retail shop in a sturdy structure. She is 30 years old, married and has three children. Five years ago, Jane started selling general food and household items. She now earns 10,000 Kenyan shillings a month. This is Jane's second loan and she will use it to purchase sugar, wheat flour and maize flour to sell in her store. Most of her customers come from the low income urban settlement where she is based. Jane dreams of business progress and of one day being a wholesale supplier of goods to other retail shops.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To add stock to her shop: sugar, wheat flour and maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a shop for storage

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto P. is 53 years old and is married to Teresa de Jesús Sosa who is 53 years old. They have four children, a son who is married and has a business in vehicle equipment, and three daughters who are still in school. 
Modesto has a small restaurant where he serves seafood and mostly fish-based dishes. He has been running his restaurant since 1983 and is the only restaurant in the area that serves fish. Modesto needs a loan to purchase higher quality fish – it is very expensive as Paraguay is a land-locked country – so he can make higher profit. He will also use it to buy a new freezer and tables and chairs.

loans.use: Freezer, tables, chairs.

loans.name: Talal

texts.en: Talal is a 29-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon. Talal has been working in the construction field since 1999. Since he started his business, he has become known for his good work, and his networking skills have helped him gain more and more clients from people in his region. In the future, he plans on expanding his business. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua  to purchase tools and rope for his work. This is the first time that Talal has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase tools and rope

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua, la dama Fabiola H. trabaja a diario con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación donde tiene el deber de mantener a sus dos hijos en edades escolares supliendo sus gastos de estudio y brindándoles buenas condiciones de vida.
El crédito lo está solicitando porque necesita invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción porque le urge reconstruir su casa de habitación que ha estado en malas condiciones pero confía que con el crédito otorgado logrará continuar mejorando sus condiciones ya que comprará los materiales de construcción y también comprará una puerta para continuar con la reconstrucción.
texts.en:
Fabiola H. works everyday in the San Rafael del Sur municipality in Managua. She works in order to bring home the daily bread. She needs to support her two school age children. She needs to pay their educational expenses and provide them with good living conditions. She is asking for a loan because she needs to buy construction material. She urgently needs to rebuild her house, which is in bad condition. She is confident that with the loan she will be able to continue improving the house’s condition. She will buy construction materials, and she will also buy a door to continue with the reconstruction.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material and a door

loans.name: Marcos Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Marcos, cliente antigüo (4ta Secuencia), padre de familia de 3 hijos todos independientes, separado hace mucho tiempo, trabaja con su propio micro bus en la Línea 38-39-85 dependiente del Sindicato  DE TAXIS y COLECTIVOS 24 DE SEPTIEMBRE desde el 2003. a la fecha. Tiene su casa propia producto de su trabajo y esfuerzo. Trabaja a diario desde las 5:00am hasta las 23:00pm su trabajo es muy exigente y sacrificado por lo que demanda mucha responsabilidad. Responsabilidad que asumió desde muy joven aprendió a conducir a la edad de 15 años trabajo como taxista y luego con la ayuda de sus padres logro adquirir su  propio vehiculo. Hoy en día el trabaja para  asegurar su vejez y el futuro de sus hijos si es que necesitaran de el en algún momento. Talvez mas adelante piensa en conformar otra familia si es que el tiempo se lo permite.

Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Marcos is an old Emprender customer (currently in his 4th loan cycle); he is the father of 3 grown children who have lived apart for quite some time. He has worked driving his own micro-bus on the 38-39-85 Line in the Sept 24 taxi and bus syndicate since 2003. He has his own home which he built through his hard work and effort. He works every day from 5 am to 11 pm; his work is very hard and takes significant sacrifice on his part but he is very responsible. He learned such discipline and responsibility when he was young as he learned to drive when he was 15; he worked as a taxi driver and later, with his parents' help, he was able to buy his own vehicle. Now he works to ensure he has enough money in his old age and to help provide for his children if they need his support in the future. He may also want to form another family in the future if he has time. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for having the confidence in him to provide this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ladies' and gents' wear in bulk

loans.name: Boubacar Sidy

texts.fr: Monsieur Boubacar Sidy B. est un couturier yoffois qui habite dans le quartier de Ndenatte. Il  est  sociétaire de  la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis septembre 2009.
