Il est âgé  de 22 ans et exerce l’activité  de couturier  depuis 2002. C’est un métier qu’il a hérité de son père et pour lui  c’est le seul moyen de gagner sa vie, satisfaire ses besoins et aider ses parents. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000frs pour compléter son épargne en vue d’acquérir une machine a coudre cornière. Ceci l’aidera a mieux rentabiliser son activité et répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle. L’augmentation de ses revenus va lui permettre de mieux assurer l’entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Boubacar Sidy B. is a tailor and a native of Yoff living in the Ndenatte district. He has been a member of the Yoff UIMCEC credit union since September 2009. He is 22 years old and has been working as a tailor since 2002. He inherited this career from his father, and for him it is the only way of earning a living, meeting his needs and helping his parents. He is asking for a loan of 100,000 francs CFA which, combined with his savings, will go towards the purchase of an embroidery machine. This will help him make his business more profitable and meet his clients’ needs. With his increased income, he will be able to better ensure his family’s well-being.

Translated from French by Chelsea Rosendale, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four people who are living in Prey Totueng village in Kandal province. Mrs. Vanna S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. They each will use a loan for different purposes. Vanna and her husband, Mr. Phai Thuch, sell coconuts to support their family. They have four children, one of whom is a laborer on a mango farm, while the others are enrolled in the local public school.

The family has a problem because their house is too old to live in. Thus, in order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Vanna S. decided to ask for a loan to construct another house.

loans.use: To construct a house

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon K. is a villager from Prachum Angk village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. For her farming, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine and hose. With the rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer and pesticide and pay for a farm laborer. 

Mrs. Phon K. is a 66-year-old widow with four children: one of whom is an iron welder, another one is a construction worker, and the other two are students in the local school. They also help their mother with the farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine and hose as well as fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for a farm laborer

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis oriental. She is 35 years old. Erlinda is married and has two adult children. Erlinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Erlinda is requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand store inventory

loans.name: Sujeewa

texts.en:
Sujeewa is a 37-year-old married woman living with her husband in the town of Telijjawila in southern Sri Lanka. She has two daughters and her husband works as a mason.    

Sujeewa has managed a vegetable cultivation business for a long time and she is very enthusiastic about her business.

Sujeewa has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her cultivation. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy materials and equipment for the vegetable cultivation business

loans.name: Tataisuple Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Tataisuple” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 2,000,000. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mohamed K. (left) is the leader of this group. The 32-year-old is married to a student with no children yet. Mohamed has been a businessman for over three years now. He owns a shop right in the center of Magburaka town where he sells radios, tape recorders, mobile phones, top-up cards, soft drinks, etc. With his share of this loan, Mohamed will expand his business by buying the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current stock.

loans.use: To buy radios, tape recorders, mobile phones, top-up cards, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es casada y tiene 5 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Huayllapampa que se ubica a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Maximiliana se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales, con la ayuda de peones, sus ventas los realiza a los distribuidores en el mismo lugar.
Maximiliana integra el Banco Comunal Violeta y necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que sera invertido para la compra de leña.
El sueño de Maximiliana son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is married and has 5 children. She lives in the community of Huayllapampa, which is located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Maximiliana makes artisanal bricks, with the help of workers. She sells her products to distributors in the same place. Maximiliana is a member of the Violeta (Violet) Community bank, and she needs a loan for 1000 soles, which she will invest to buy firewood. Her dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
la señora Carmen Luz E. B. tiene 60 años de edad esta casada con el señor Pantaleon Flores quien se dedica a la albañileria y le ayuda economicamente con los gastos del hogar. ellos tienen una hija estudiando en la universidad. Carmen Luz se dedica desde hace 16 años a atender la pulperia y la cria y venta de pollos, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de concentrado ya que la produccion de pollos a aumentado y requiere mayor inversion para la comida de los mismos tambien comprara mercaderia para la pulperia. Carmen vive en una bonita casa y su granja de pollos esta bien
arreglada. Su deseo es que su ultima hija se le gradue de la universidad.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen Luz E. B., age 60, is married to Señor Pantaleon Flores, who works as a mason. She helps with the household expenses. They have a daughter studying at university.

For 16 years, Carmen Luz has worked running a small grocery store and in raising and selling chickens. She will use the loan to purchase chicken feed since her chicken production is increasing and requires a greater investment in feed. She will also buy merchandise for her grocery store. Carmen lives in a beautiful house, and her chicken farm is well established. Her wish is that her youngest daughter graduates from university.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken feed, soft drinks, sweets, sugar, rice, coffee, beans, toritllas, bread, cookies, toilet paper, soups, juicies, milk, cheese, butter, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Morb

texts.en: Mrs. Morb L. currently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes over 100 sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave baskets. Recently, Morb L. has run out of essential materials from her stock and hopes to acquire other raw materials to continue making baskets. She depends on using her Kiva loan as an advance. Morb L. is a 26-year-old married woman blessed with a school-aged child.

loans.use: To acquire other raw materials to continue making baskets

loans.name: Siguidiale  3 Group

texts.fr:
Siguidialé 3 est un regroupement de 10 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans,  4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Koba, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. 
Les spéculations sont l’arachide, le petit mil, le maïs et le haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, TENIN B. compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 1,7 hectares d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice 45 000FCFA  en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
Siguidialé 3 is a group of ten married women who, on average, are 34-years old, have four children, and live mostly in polygamous families in Koba, one of the villages of the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro area, Mali's second administrative region. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to carry out their winter activities.The crops they speculate are peanut, millet, corn and beans. This is their third campaign loan, and past loans have been repaid without incident. With this new loan, TENIN B. plans to buy seedlings and small farming equipment, and pay for labor costs necessary to maintain 1.7 hectares of peanuts. After the harvest, produce is sold in the village of Nangola and surrounding neighborhoods of the city of Dioïla to a clientele consisting primarily of retailers from the big cities. Tenin expects to end the season with a profit of 45,000F CFA.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and small farming equipment, and pay for labor

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose L. Jr. is from the town of Banga. He is 55 years old and married with 7 children. His younger kids still go to school and he wants them to finish college someday. To make a living, Jose grows rice for sale, and has done so for over 10 years.

Jose joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jose has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jose is now requesting his 4th loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seed and fertilizer.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marcaj Layco Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “Markaj Layco” (expresión aymara que quiere decir "por mi ciudad")es parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, tiene como presidenta a la señora  Saturnina.

Doña Saturnina ingresa a la asociación de Markaj Layco gracias a la invitación de una amiga.  Su negocio es la venta de artefactos electrodomésticos en la Feria de la Zona 16 de Julio, los jueves y Domingo, ella  compra la mercadería de la ciudad de Oruro.  Por ahora trabaja sola, tiene un solo hijo, lamentablemente enviudó hace un tiempo.
De los servicios que ofrece Pro Mujer el que más le ha gustado ha sido la capacitación inicial.

Las integrantes de la asociación comunal, son siete mujeres y un varón. Tienen negocios diferentes, como: venta de comida, venta de artesanía, tejido de mantas, confección de mantas, venta de artefactos y electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
The “Markaj Layco” communal bank is part of the Centro Focal de German Busch. The name comes from an Aymara expression meaning "for my city", The president of the communal bank is Señora Saturnina. Doña Saturnina joined Markaj Layco at the invitation of her friend. Her business is the sale of electrical appliances in the market in Zona 16 de Julio, on Thursdays and Sundays she buys her merchandise in the city of Oruro. At the moment she works alone. She has one son, but sadly he has been away for some time. Of all the services offered by [Field Partner] Pro Mujer, Saturnina has found the initial training most valuable. The members of the communal bank are seven women and one man. They have different businesses, such as: food sales, craft sales, weaving, making blankets, and selling electrical appliances and other goods.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase electrical appliances

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sayda;  La socia tiene 38 años de edad;  ella es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica al transporte de cargas pesadas,  La socia  tiene un medio camión y lo alquila, ella alquila su transporte para mudanzas y para llevar artefactos o materiales de construcción. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su camión. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sayda is a member of the Communal Bank “Prosperidad” (Prosperity), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Sayda provides heavy cargo transport services by means of a truck that she offers for rent. Her vehicle is available for residential moves and for hauling large items or construction materials. The loan she is requesting will be used to maintain her truck.

Sayda appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad V. is from the village of Burgos. She is 57 years old. Natividad is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Natividad owns & operates a business selling vegetables in the market. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Natividad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Natividad from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Meche

texts.en:
Meche L. is from the town of Banga. She is 64 years old and married with four children. To make a living, Meche operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Meche also buys fish from fishermen and makes dried fish which she sells in the neighborhood.

Meche joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase farm supplies and additional fish to dry. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and additional fish to dry

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 24-year-old single man who supports his family, including 5 siblings and 2 parents. He borrowed $2000 to improve his existing barbershop, which was established in 2008.  What distinguishes his barbershop is that it is the only barbershop in his area.

loans.use: To improve his barbershop

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon S., 24 years old, is a car taxi driver in Kompong Cham Province where he lives with his elderly mother, a local farmer. He runs his business along the streets from his province to Phnom Penh City every day. Most of his family’s income comes from his car taxi driving, and he typically earns an average of US$ 10 a day. 

Unfortunately, his car has broken down during use, and now his savings are not enough to buy car parts. To solve the problem, Phon S. has decided to seek a loan of US$ 1100 from Kiva, which he will use to purchase car parts to repair his broken-down car.

loans.use: To purchase car equipment to repair his broken-down taxi

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is a married woman with a teenage daughter named Darina. She lives and works in Belaya Tserkov.

To earn a living, Oksana sells groceries in the central marketplace of her home town. For instance, she sells food items such as cookies, candy, and chocolates. She has been working in this line of business for seven years. Presently, Oksana owns a vending kiosk worth 24,000 UAH. Her gross income is approximately 26,000 UAH per year, and her net profit is a little over 3,000 UAH per month.

Oksana is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 UAH ($650) to diversify the merchandise she offers for sale in her kiosk. She always sees an increase in demand for her inventory around Christmas and New Year’s. As such, Oksana wants to increase her stock of goods with additional merchandise to be able to meet the growing demand and generate additional income this holiday season. One of Oksana’s long-term goals is to have her own grocery store in downtown Belaya Tserkov.

loans.use: To satisfy customer demand during the holiday season by expanding her inventory

loans.name: Roberto Carlos

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Huertas Martínez del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado que consiste en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina en donde se puede brindar servicio de transporte) el brinda este servicio en las diversas calles del distrito de Lambayeque y con el dinero que gana se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Roberto desea brindar mantenimiento al vehículo que maneja ya que el contínuo uso ha hecho que empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que dificultan su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

El es un joven bastante responsable y de carácter servicial, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo y de confianza.
texts.en:
Roberto is 22 years old, is single and lives together with her parents and siblings in the village of Huertas Martínez in the Lambayeque district, a commercial zone located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

He provides transportation in a rickshaw (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached cabin for his passengers). He provides this service for various streets in the Lambayeque district and with his earnings he covers his personal expenses and helps his family with household costs. 

Roberto wishes to obtain maintenance for his rickshaw, since he continues to experience several defects that have made it difficult to run correctly. He has requested a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1200 nuevos soles. 

He is a very responsible and service-minded young man, and those who know him consider him a reliable and peaceful person.

loans.use: vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Carlos  Segundo

texts.es:
Carlos  Segundo A. L. tiene 41 años. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene hijos
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la America, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol gandul. 

Carlos  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López  y en Agripac en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es construir la casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte y andar en bicicleta.
texts.en:
Carlos Segundo A. L. is 41 years old.  His is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province.  He has no children.

He is a member of the UNIDOS VENCEREMOS farm co-op, located in an area called America which belongs to the Ventanas Canton. This co-op grows short-cycle crops such as corn, rice and beans.

Carlos specializes in growing corn, rice and beans. He buys products from Comercial López and Agripac in Ventanas, then sells them at the Ventanas market.

He is requesting a loan to buy farm equipment and fertilizer for his crops. The loan will help him purchase items to combat plagues, disease and climate change. He dreams of building a house one day.

He enjoys being active in sports and riding a bicycle.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment and fertilizer

loans.name: Kabundaire United Association Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 31-year-old, enterprising married man with two children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

He longs to set up a venture for the family that can generate sustainable income. For seven years, he has been selling fresh food. Amidst the challenges of perishable goods and high rental fees, his goal is nonetheless to supply more fresh food. He is a member of the loan group, Kabundaire United Association. 

Ibrahim needs the credit facility to buy fresh food for sale.

loans.use: Buying fresh food for sale

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma M. is 49 years old and married with three adult children. She is from the village of Casul, Sapang Dalaga. 

To make a living, Elma is engaged in farming, and she sells assorted crops from her farm. From this activity, she is able to earn a monthly net income of 4,000 PHP. She has been in her business for 10 years.

In 2007, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase farm supplies. Elma is requesting her third loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is rent.

He has operated a retail business for the past four years, selling at the market to his neighbors and passerby. Hassan faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. He hopes to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar for sale. He decided to join Yehu because it offers good services.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sacks of sugar for sale

loans.name: Yuri Rolando

texts.es: Yuri Rolando tiene 40 años, su actividad es la de brindar el servicio de triciclo. Hace más de 7 años que tiene este negocio,  inicio este medio de vida por una liquidación que había recibido fue así que empezó este negocio, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación por lo que todos los días se levanta temprano pues existe competencia y siempre se preocupa por ofrecer un buen servicio a cada uno de sus clientes. El motivo de su crédito es para la compra de asientos, pedales, cadenas, carpas y otras mejoras que quiere realizar. Sueña con comprar otro triciclo y así agrandar su negocio.
texts.en: Yuri Rolando, 40, has a business providing cycle rickshaw (3-wheeled bike with attached cart) transportation services.  He has had this business for more than 7 years.  He started out in this line of work with severance pay that he had received, so in this way he was able to start the business.  He works with a lot of effort and dedication; each day he gets up early because there is a lot of competition and he is always concerned about providing good service to every one of his customers.  The reason for this loan is so that he can buy seats, pedals, chains, canopies, and other improvements that he wants to make.  He dreams of buying another cycle rickshaw, and in this way expanding his business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Proem

texts.en: Proem C. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and four young children in Battambang province. To earn a living, he has been working as a recycler and is able to make about US $7 every day. His wife stays at home making food and taking care of their children. Proem C. is asking for a loan of US $250 to reinvest in his recycling business.

loans.use: to reinvest in his recycling business

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina tiene 42 años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa propia en la parte urbana del sector Cruce Jaén – Nuevo Olmos, situado en el distrito de Olmos, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque.

Gana su vida brindando servicios de transporte de pasajeros en sus dos mototaxis, un vehículo que consiste de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de sus vehículos. Necesita mantener sus motos en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos y usarlos para comprar otra mototaxi. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maximina is 42 years old and single.  She lives in her own home, in the urban part of Cruce Jaén - Nuevos Olmos sector, in Olmos district, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Maximina earns her living providing passenger transport services in her two 'mototaxis' (a vehicle that consists of a motorbike with a cabin for transporting passengers).  She would like to use her loan to have her vehicles serviced and repaired.  She needs to keep her mototaxis in good condition so that she can continue offering her customers a good service.  With the support of this loan, she hopes to increase her profits and use these profits to buy another mototaxi.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to repair her 'mototaxi'

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia, de 28 años, es una madre abnegada. Pues su esposo viajó al país de Estados Unidos a buscar trabajo. Ahora ella tiene que cuidar de su hijo Franklin, de 8 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Hace 7 años que comenzó a abrir una pequeña tienda de comestibles, poco a poco fue llenándola con dulces, bebidas, frutas y demás. Ahora, es la más abastecida de su localidad y todas las mañanas se encuentra llena de personas deseosas de querer comprar productos comestibles para el alimento diario. Asimismo hace 3 años que compró un terreno agrícola donde siembra; arveja, espinaca y demás hortalizas, los cuales mantiene con ayuda de peones que contrata temporalmente. Su principal deseo es mejorar su tienda de comestibles para poder salir adelante en compañía de su hijo, y de esa manera poder juntar dinero para viajar a EE.UU, en compañía de su esposo, para formar una buena familia. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde agradece la confianza depositada en ella; pues comenzará a mejorar su negocio. Amelia, invierte semanalmente en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda de comestibles, por ello con el crédito comprará varios sacos de arroz, azúcar y demás bebidas.
texts.en: Amelia, 28 years old, is a self-sacrificing mother.  Her husband has gone to the United States in search of work.  Now she has to take care of her son, Franklin, 8 years of age, alone in her own home located in the Palcamayo area.  She opened a small food store 7 years ago and has been slowly supplying it with sweets, refreshments, fruit and such.  It is now the best supplied store in the area and every morning it is full of people wanting to buy food items for the day.  Also, three years ago she bought a plot of farm land and she grows peas, spinach and other vegetables, she takes care of these with the help of laborers that she hires for the season.  Her main goal is to improve the food store to be able to get ahead together with her son, and this way be able to save money to travel to the USA to be with her husband and be together as a family.  This is her first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the trust placed in her. as she can start improving her business.  Amelia buys weekly the  basic products for her food store, therefore she will use this loan to purchase bags of rice, sugar and various drinks.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, sugar and sodas.

loans.name: Santos Emilio

texts.es:
Santos tiene 37 años de edad y es casado con 2 hijos. Vive en casa de familiares en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz en la provincia de Chiclayo, en el norte de Perú. Su comunidad es urbana y en vías de crecimiento. Cuenta con servicios básicos como agua potable y servicio de electricidad. 

Desde hace más de 5 años, Santos se dedica a la preparación de desayunos. Realiza esta actividad en venta ambulante en las calles cerca del Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado grande y con mucho movimiento. Con su préstamo, Santos comprará otro puesto para así tener dos puntos de venta: uno administrado por él y el otro por su esposa. Esto ayudará a incrementar sus ventas y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. 

También desea usar parte de su crédito para invertir en la educación de sus hijos y pagar sus gastos escolares ahora que la temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú. Desea mejorar el nivel de educación que sus hijos reciben para que puedan obtener mejores oportunidades en el futuro. Para lograr sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Santos es un cliente recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado otros préstamos que lo ayudaron mejorar su nivel de vida y educar a sus hijos. Es muy responsable y canceló sus préstamos de manera puntual. Su mayor anhelo es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para generar mayores ingresos y continuar a sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 37, is married and has two children.  He lives in relatives’ house in José Leonardo Ortiz District, Chiclayo Province, in northern Peru.  His community is urban and growing.  He has basic utilities like potable water and electricity.

Santos has been preparing breakfasts for over five years.  He does this activity in an itinerant manner along streets near the Moshoqueque Market, a large, very busy market.  Santos will use the loan to buy another stand so that he can have two sales points, one run by him and the other by his wife.  This will help increase sales and provide better customer service. He’d also like to use part of his loan to invest in his children’s education and pay school fees now that the school term has begun in Peru.  He wants to improve the level of education his children receive so that they will be able to obtain better future opportunities.

To reach his goal he’s thought it convenient to turn to Edpyme Alternativa to request a 2000 new sol loan.  Santos is a recurrent client of Edpyme Alternativa.  He has managed his other loans which helped him improve his standard of living and educate his children.   He is very responsible and repaid his loans punctually.  His greatest desire is to continue investing in his business to generate higher income and continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy another food vending stand and to pay for his children's school expenses.

loans.name: Poaju Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo en el Barrio Bernardino C. de la Ciudad de Caaguazú.
La señora Norma Elizabeth Z. participó de una reunión informativa en donde le encantó la idea de formar un comité en su zona, invitó a las señoras más responsables y con mucho entusiasmo se unieron en equipo en donde la responsabilidad es conjunta, solicitando así un apoyo crediticio a la Fundación Paraguaya. Las mismas son señoras que desean un progreso personal y familiar, luchan cada día para que esto sea posible.
La sra. Zunilda se dedica a la venta de joyas, ella compra joyas en Luque a menores costos y luego los vende por Caaguazú obteniendo una pequeña ganancia económica, es la manera en que ella puede mantener a sus hijos, es muy conocida por esta actividad en su zona y debido a la belleza y calidad de sus joyas aumenta la cantidad de clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder aumentar la cantidad de joyas que ofrece de modo a aumentar sus ingresos ya que su meta es poseer su propia joyería alguna vez.
texts.en:
This committee was established in the neighborhood of Bernardino C. in the city of Caaguazú. Sra. Norma Elizabeth Z. participated in an informational meeting and liked the idea of forming a committee in her area. She invited responsible women who were excited about forming a group so that they could work together and apply for a solidarity loan from Fundación Paraguaya. These same ladies want to make progress on a personal level and with their families. They struggle each day to make this possible.

Sra. Zunilda sells jewelry. She buys her merchandise in Luque at low cost and then sells it in Caaguazú in order to earn a little bit of money so that she can support her children. Zunilda is well-known for her local business. Due to the beauty and quality of the jewelry she offers, she has been able to increase her customer base.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her inventory of jewelry that she offers so that she can earn more income. Her goal is to have her own jewelry store someday.

loans.use: to purchase gold and silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La señora Blanca tiene una tienda donde vende cosméticos y también ella es profesora. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una puerta para la tienda que tiene, para tener mayor seguridad contra robos. Vive en anticrítico en la zona de Vino Tinto de la ciudad de La Paz; es viuda y tiene un hijo. Es primer crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca has a shop where she sells cosmetics and also works as a teacher. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase a door for her shop in order to provide greater protection against thieves.

Blanca lives in a rental property in the District of Vino Tinto in the city of La Paz. She is a widow and has one child. This is her first loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a door to install in her cosmetics shop to protect against thieves.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Morlaquitas, vive en por el sector de Sinincay en de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999, cuna de grandes atletas y escritores, cuenta con una variada gastronomía, su gente es calida y amable.

Doña María tiene 37 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 10 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en la área de la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. 

La Señora. María  tiene una tienda de comestibles hace 9 años en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche y en el mismo local se dedica a la venta de comida.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer crédito los mismos que le han beneficiado para su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad e ingredientes para preparar sus platos para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
 
Su meta es  tener una sucursal de su tienda.
texts.en:
María is a member of the “Las Morlaquitas” (Sly Little Vixens) communal bank.  She lives around Cuenca’s Sinincay sector.  Cuenca was designated a Cultural Heritage of Humanity in 1999.  It is the birthplace of great athletes and writers and has a varied cuisine; its residents are gracious and kind.

María is 37 years old, married and has three children who are 15, 10 and 7 years of age.  Her eldest daughter is in high school and the other two children go to the local school.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  With their joint work as a couple they’ve managed to build their house.

María has had a grocery store for nine years.  She sells basic need items and is open Sunday to Sunday from 7am until 10pm.  She sells prepared food in the same space.

She’s in her third loan with the communal bank; they have been beneficial for her business.  She will use the new loan to buy basic need items and the ingredients to prepare her dishes to continue growing in her business.  Her goal is to have branch of her store.

loans.use: to buy basic need items and ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Ivan Alfredo

texts.es:
Ivan Alfredo tiene 42 años, es soltero vive solo, tiene un hijo vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Ivan se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao y a la crianza de pollos y chanchos. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos y alimento para sus animales, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir trabajando.

Le gusta salir a jugar inbdor con el hijo y los vecinos.
texts.en:
Iván Alfredo is 42 years old, single and lives alone; he has one son.  He lives in Agua Clara belonging to Chillanes Canton.

The “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara” communal bank is located 20 minutes from the Chillanes office.  It has 20 members and this is the second loan they’ve requested from the Cooperative.  The members of this communal bank farm cocoa beans and manioc and are also merchants.

Iván farms cocoa beans and raises chickens and pigs.  His purchases take place in Chillanes and San Pablo and his sales at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

This loan will help him buy farming supplies and animal feed.  The loan has helped him in that his crop yield has increased.  He has faced challenges like illnesses among laborers and infestations and illnesses of his crops.  

His dream is to stay healthy to continue working.  He enjoys going out to play Indoor (a modified type of soccer played on a smaller field with surrounding walls that become an additional game element) with his son and neighbors.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba sells jewelry at Tayido, a village near Abura in Cape Coast. She is a widow and has 8 children. She feeds, clothes and educates her children. Her loan will be used to buy more jewelry to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Batiyaye Djisofor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Le groupe est  composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Dialika qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de six enfants à sa charge. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de balaies. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This community group was created on the 3rd of June, 2010 and is made up of eleven women who live in the same quarter. They all run small businesses. Madame Dialika, who is on the right with her hand raised in the photo, is the group leader. She is 51 years old, and is a widow with six children. 
She has sold rakes for a living for a number of years, and this loan will enable her to boost her working capital and develop the business. The profits will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing etc) and to increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to purchase rakes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: La señora Carmen es artesana y realiza el trenzado de mantas, también teje las mismas y es costurera. Es así como ella percibe sus ingresos mensuales. El crédito lo requiere para la compra una maquina de coser para terminar sus productos más rápido. Carmen nunca ha tenido un crédito en ninguna institución financiera, de tal manera que esta es la primera vez que tendrá una experiencia como ésta. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Seke  en  la ciudad de El Alto;  es casada y tiene un hijo.
texts.en: Carmen is an artisan an she weaves blankets. She also knits blankets and she is a seamstress. This is how she earns her monthly income. She requires the loan to purchase a sewing machine to complete making her products faster. Carmen has never had a loan from any financial institution. This is the first time she will have an experience like this. She lives in a house of her own and it is located in the region of Seke in the city of El Alto. She is married and she has a son.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Kak

texts.en: To be the head of family is a big responsibility of parents. Mrs. Kak never takes time to visit anywhere. She always cares about the living standards of her family nowadays. She has a grocery store in one market near her village. She earns about $3 per day. Her husband doesn’t laze at home. He takes time to sell junk goods around his village and other villages. He earns perhaps $3 per day also. Both of them would like a loan of $750 to purchase more junk goods.

loans.use: to purchase more junk goods to sell.

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Manuel es socio del banco comunal Unión y Prosperidad, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad, lugar que cuenta con hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes trabajos.

El Señor Manuel tiene 41 años, es casado y tiene 4 hijos de 12, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y tres  en una escuelita. Su esposa se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en que habitan es de su propiedad.
 
Nuestro socio tiene un aserradero, esta actividad la desempeña hace 15 años, trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y de domingo a domingo.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir como parte de pago en la compra de una tienda ya que va a comenzar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo para su negocio de la aserradora.
texts.en:
Manuel is a member of the “Unión y Prosperidad” (Unity and Prosperity) communal bank.  He lives in Zhidmad Parish, a place of beautiful scenery.  Its residents raise livestock and farm; many work at various jobs in the city.

Manuel is 41 years old, married and has four children who are 12, 10, 8 and 6 years of age.  His oldest son is in secondary school and the other three go to the local little elementary school.  His wife’s a farmer.  He owns the house they live in.

He owns a sawmill.  He’s been in this business 15 years.  He works from 6am until 6pm from Sunday through Sunday.

This is the first loan he’s had with the communal bank and he will use it as part of the payment to buy a store since he’s going to start this business.  His goal is to buy a vehicle for his sawmill business.

loans.use: to buy a store.

loans.name: Barika

texts.en:
Barika is a married woman with three boys, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase creams and a blow dryer machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase creams and a blow dryer machine.

loans.name: Percy David

texts.es:
Percy de 23 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual cuenta con servicio de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Túcume que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola,  ganadera y turística de los pobladores.

Percy se dedica desde hace un año a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puede ofrecer a sus clientes o a los distintos mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque y con los ingresos que obtenga pueda solventar los gastos personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento, al estar bien alimentados los puede ofrecer a sus clientes a un mejor precio,  con la finalidad de que obtenga  más ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  Percy es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es salir adelante y seguir ayudando a sus padres en lo que sea necesario.
texts.en:
Percy is 23 years old.  He is single, and lives in his parents' home, which has running water and electricity.  He lives in the rural area of the Túcume district, which is part of the Lambayeque Department.  This area is characterized by its people working in agriculture, livestock, and tourism.

Percy has been working for the last year raising and selling pigs. His farmyard is in the rear of his house, and he feeds them a balanced animal feed.  Once they are fully grown to their optimum size, he offers them for sale to his customers, or to the various markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque, and with the income he earns he is able to cover his personal expenses.

He has requested a loan of 1,500 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more animals and their feed, so that they can be well fed and he can offer them for sale to his customers for a better price.  His end-goal is to generate more income so he can have a better quality of life.

Percy is a hard-working and very responsible person; the only thing he wants is to get ahead in life, and to continue helping his parents with whatever they need.

loans.use: to buy animals and their feed.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Yvyra Pyta Group

texts.es:
El comité Ybyra pyta está situado en la ciudad de Curuguaty, está conformado por 12 integrantes. Este comité se encuentra en el segundo ciclo, están aprendiendo la importancia de trabajar en equipo dentro de un grupo con responsabilidad, honestidad y comunicación. Demuestran conciencia por el compromiso asumido con el comité como también con la Fundación Paraguaya que les ha brindado una oportunidad de mejorar la calidad de vida a través del trabajo y la integración grupal incentivando así también el ahorro de cada una de ellas con el único objetivo de crecimiento económico suyas y la de su comunidad.
Una de las miembros es la señora Zulma, ella se dedica a la cría y venta de animales. Por medio de este arduo trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarlos adelante. Comenta que este es un trabajo muy duro, pues debe estar al pendiente de que a los animales no les pase nada y cuidarlos de enfermedades.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de animales, como así también para alimentos de los mismos. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Yvyra Pyta committee consists of 12 members and is located in the city of Curuguaty. The committee is in it's second loan cycle. The members are learning the importance of group teamwork with responsibility, honesty and communication. They have demonstrated awareness of the commitment they have made to the committee and also to the Fundación Paraguaya, which has provided them with an opportunity to improve the quality of life through work, encouraging group integration, and also helping each member with the sole purpose of economic growth for themselves and their community. 

One of the members is Mrs. Zulma, who breeds and sells animals. Through her hard work she has been able to sustain and raise her family. She says that her work is very hard as she needs to make sure that the animals are always safe and well looked after, and also take care of diseases.
She has requested this loan to purchase more animals, as well as food for them. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity they have provided, as obtaining this loan will help her very much.

loans.use: to purchase animals and food for them

loans.name: Nusura

texts.en: Nusura is a 40 year old married woman with five children, all of whom are in the school.  For the past four years she has been in the business of selling bread in Kator, South Sudan. She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business by purchasing more bread to sell.  She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for sale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is married with 2 children, aged 5 and 9, living in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. For 9 years he has been operating an electronics shop and this has facilitated him in providing the basics to his family. He is requesting a loan to buy a new music system. He has the challenge of bad debtors, and his dream is to own a big shop. Patrick needs the loan facility to buy music systems to sell.

loans.use: to buy music systems to sell.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Remedios works hard to support her family. She has a purified drinking water business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit and vegetable vending. Remedios is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more gallons of water for her water refilling business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of water for her water refilling business.

loans.name: Bidii Women Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii Women Group in Western Kenya! Roselyne is the facilitator of the group. They joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Roselyne takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate her children and access fertilizer and hybrid seeds for food security. In the recent 2011 season, Roselyne had an excellent maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Roselyne was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Roselyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Roselyne will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Bidii Women group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.
